Their children are working as house helpers and sales workers.

The couple's tricycle transport business is providing them at least PHP300.00 a day, which they are using for their daily expenses. Vilma wants to engage in another business for an alternative source of income. She is now is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 9,000.00. This amount will be of great help to pursue her plan of selling vegetables, while some of the amount will be used for the maintenance of their motorcycle. Vilma also dreams to have a big business in which she can help other people by means of employment.

loans.use: To start a business selling vegetables and to maintain a motorcycle

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
“Nothing is impossible; just trust God in times of need and trouble,” shares Marilou P., a 48-year-old vegetable vendor in the village of Saranay Cabatuan, Isabela. She is married to Edwin, a rice farmer. They have two children: Louwyne, who is 28 years old, married, and working as a physician assistant; and Edmar, who is 23 years old and who works as sales agent in Isabela.

Marilou and her husband plant eggplants, which they sell in their village. For almost three years in this business, they were able to cope up with their financial needs. Their vegetable vending business also assisted them in providing their farming needs. They want to sustain their vegetable planting and vending so they can have a source of income while waiting for the harvest season for their palay. Marilou would like a loan of PHP 7,000.00 that she believes will be of great help in her enterprise and also for her to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: To continue growing and selling vegetables

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina S. is 53 years old and a resident of Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Hermilo and they are blessed with three children: Melvin, Hermilo and Katherine.

Sabina is engaged in the buying and selling of frozen foods in their village. Some of her products are hotdogs, tocino, longganisa and so on. She has been in this business for two years.

With her strong determination to expand her business, she decided to request a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she can use as her business capital for her frozen food products. At present, she is able to earn at least PHP 500.00 a week and she is hoping that her income will also increase. One of her business dreams is to put up a village store and a small eatery or canteen. She believes that patience and hard work will pave a way to her success.

loans.use: To buy additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married to Jaime D. C. and currently lives in Barangay Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with four children: Jojo, Joey, Jomar and Jovina. Their eldest son is a criminology graduate who works as a security guard in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. The other children are still studying in tertiary and secondary level school.

Virginia used to help her husband plant onions on the farm, since this is their sole source of income. Financial constraints have kept the couple from expanding their farming, even providing some of the agricultural inputs (like fertilizers) needed by the farm. Fortunately, Virginia found a microfinance institution that would answer her prayers. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be utilized in maintenance and expansion of their onion farm to generate better income. Virginia said that she believes that through patience, hard work, and strong determination, they will able reach their goals in life.

loans.use: To maintain and expand an onion farm

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma O. was born on July 17, 1953; she is now 55 years old and an ordinary villager of Barangay Tuao North, in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Roberto O., who is a farmer. They are blessed with six children who have already graduated from college and are now working abroad. Wilma and Roberto are very proud to have responsible and hardworking children who finished their studies and became successful--unfortunately not exactly with their chosen professions, but they are still thankful for their opportunities abroad. They believe that this is the fruit of their sacrifices and the answer to their prayers.

With the support coming from her children, Wilma has able to put up her community store. She does her best to improve her business without depending on her children because they will have their own families in the future and she wants them save for it. She wants to earn a higher income for her own future, especially now that she and her husband are getting old. Due to lack of finances, Wilma is requesting a loan of 10,000 pesos to buy additional stock in bulk for her store. Despite her age, Wilma still has a strong determination to succeed in her business endeavor.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Nulu's Group

texts.en:
N. Nulu is the leader of the Wanyange Tusubira group in Jinja. She is a businesswoman with a retail shop, and she also sells used clothes in Jinja. In the shop, she sells sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil and many other things as well as displaying some of her clothes. She also takes some of the stock to the daily markets.

This is her 18th loan with the group and she is happy that the loans have enabled her to buy a sewing machine, a sofa set, a bicycle and a radio. She says that these are things she used to see as less important but now due to the change in her standard of living, she is happy that she is taking this path. Nulu needs a loan to help with buying more goods for her retail shop plus buying more clothes to sell.

loans.use: Buying more goods for the shop and used clothes to sell

texts.en:
As parents, Donna and her husband, Joselito, must be responsible in developing a good family, particularly in terms of their physical, emotional, social and spiritual aspects, said Donna Tulod. Donna is a hard-working mother and entrepreneur in the village of Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She has three children: Asear, Jonna Mae and Jonna Marie, who are all studying. The eldest is in college, while the last two are still in elementary school.

Donna works selling barbecue and vegetables in their barangay (village) from a table in front of their house, where she displays her products daily. From her business, Donna usually earns an average income of PHP1,000 weekly, which is utilized for their immediate daily needs and for the allowances of her children. But according to her, this is not enough to finance the school needs of her children since education nowadays is very costly. Therefore, she hopes to strengthen her business in order to increase her income for the schooling of her children. Due to a lack of financial capital, Donna is now asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP10,000, which she will use for the improvement of her vending business.

loans.name: Laurice

texts.en:
“Try and try until you succeed” is the favorite quotation of Laurice. She is 28 years old and married to Dennis, a driver. Their marriage is blessed with two children: Christopher, who is 9 and a grade-three student in the public school located in their village; and Clifford, who is 2 years old.

Laurice has managed a village store for almost two years and generates a weekly income of PHP2,000 that she uses as rolling capital. Her business also enables her to help her husband in meeting the needs of their family and to save something for the education of their children. She is now asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to be used to improve her business and to purchase more stocks for her store.

loans.use: Business improvement and purchase more stock

texts.en:
Tariyel E. is a 47-year-old married man who lives with his wife and three children. Tariyel has 10 years of experience in cattle raising. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Tariyel has become a very successful businessman.

Tariyel has a friendly family who are always try to help each other. Thus with their cattle-raising business, his wife and elder son help him. He works very hard and spends all his time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing them.

Now Tariyel wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He applied for a loan of $1,200. He promises to repay the loan within 15 months and thanks all lenders for their support.

“Patience is the key to become a successful businesswoman,” says Elsa, a 46-year-old entrepreneur and a mother of two children. Her husband, Jaime, is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) and their two children are: Evangeline, who is 18 years old and a second-year college student, and Jaime Jr., who is 10 years old and now in grade four. She and her family live in the rural village of Saranay in Cabatuan, Isabela.

Elsa has been a direct seller of personal products for almost two years in their village. Her business has greatly helped her in providing the school allowance of their two children and some of their basic needs at home. When she learned that there are lenders who are willing to finance micro-entrepreneur like her, she was motivated to borrow a loan of PHP7,000.00 that she can use to improve her business and somehow become successful.

Devorah manages a rolling store business, selling fish and chicken. She also buys and sells used clothes in her neighborhood. She usually roams around the village to sell fish, chicken and second-hand clothes. Her products are very salable in their village and for this she wanted to develop and expand her business in the market somehow. She believes that availing herself of a loan of PHP10,000.00 as additional capital will be of great help in her business and to her family. Devorah patiently maintains it since it is a great source of her family income.

Devorah is 37 and married to Jaime, a retired policeman. They were blessed with three children: April Imee, who is 10 and in grade four; Princess Sarah, who is 6 years old and a preschool student this coming school year; and Jaimelyn, who is 18 months old. The family is currently residing in the large village of Research, Minante, Cauayan City. Devorah is a mother who wants the best for her children and she is fulfilling these dreams through patience and hard work.

Juliet is a calamansi (a citrus fruit) vendor. She is 44 years old and married to Bonifacio, who is working in a multi-gas company as a manual worker. They have two children: VJ, who is 21 years old and already in the fourth year of college, and Julius Bryan, who is 17 and in the first year of college taking a computer-engineering course.

Her two children are studying in a distant place, while her husband is assigned to the different places where the gas company delivers their product. Because of this, she usually lives alone in their house and focuses on her calamansi business so as not to miss her family so much.

Calamansi production is the common business maintained by the residents in Cabatuan, Isabela, and Juliet is one of them. She gets her products through the farmers.

She is now asking for financial assistance of PHP 7,000.00 so she can buy sacks of calamansi at a wholesale price that she can sell in the market. She has been in this business for four years and is still doing great. “Just be patient and always persevere for the better to become successful entrepreneur and always pray to God to direct and light our path,” said Juliet.

Tsermaa M. is 44 and married with two children in elementary school. She and her family moved from the countryside to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, 15 years ago. They sold all of their livestock when they moved, and opened a small butcher business in the city. Tsermaa purchases wholesale meat from the countryside and resells it in her stall in the local market. She is requesting this loan to buy more mutton to resell. One day she hopes to be able to supply meat to her clients on a larger scale. She would like to be able to invest in her children's higher education and purchase an apartment with running hot water in the future.

Janeth O. and her husband Dexter are blessed with three children: Diether, Sharla Mae, and Fhenilyn, all currently in primary school. They live harmoniously in the rural village of Sta. Lucia, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Dexter and Janeth have great ambitions for their children, so they are doing the best to provide for their needs.

Janeth is a door-to-door sales rep for products from Natasha and MSE. She also sells frozen products and electronic load (prepaid cards). Her income isn’t enough to satisfy the family’s basic needs and cover her children’s education, so she is hoping to improve her business by acquiring additional products to sell. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP that will be amortized weekly. Janeth says that joining this loan program will greatly help her improve her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia and her family live in rural Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She belongs to a poor family, but they have a strong determination to become successful entrepreneurs some day. She has learned that the weapons to eliminate poverty include patience and hard work. 

Cecilia and her husband Reynaldo help one another earn an income to provide for the family’s basic needs and their children’s education. Cecilia buys and sells charcoal in their village while Reynaldo works as a farmer cultivating land that they own. Cecilia requests a loan of PHP5,000 to be used to improve the farming business of her husband. They have the greatest desire to uplift their poor living conditions, which is why they strive to strengthen their business and increase their income. She believes that their efforts and sacrifices will bear good fruits through the help of lenders.

In the picture, Cecilia is shown with her charcoal for sale. The picture of her husband's farm will be provided later as part of updating journal of her loan is approved.

loans.use: to improve the crop production of her husband

texts.en:
Akbar A. is a 60 year old farmer. He has worked in agriculture for the past four years, raising sheep. He cares greatly for his sheep because they enable him to cover his household expenses.

Akbar's work is very important to him, and he is very dedicated to his animals. He believes that by improving his stock and feed, his sheep will bring in better prices. This enterprising gentleman is turning to you for the support that will permit him to continue developing his business. He is seeking a loan to purchase additional sheep, so that in the future he will be able to generate additional income for his family. Thank you for supporting Akbar’s project.

“Success is difficult to achieve for those who fail to try, but it is attainable for those who have the courage to try,” is Leima B.’s quotation in life.  She is an industrious mother from the village of Sta. Lucia in the municipality of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Stalin B. and they are blessed with three children: Lance Allen, 8; Leign Krestel, 6; and Leinard, 1. They live happily with a simple standard of living.

Leima is a dealer of fish and a prepaid phonecall credit retailer in their village.  This way, Leima helps her husband earn income for their family life satisfaction. She is borrowing her additional working capital of PHP7, 000 for her business maintenance. Learning to manage a simple vending business is of great help to her and her family, for her, it was of great achievement. Furthermore, she wants more to strengthen her business in order to increase her income thus working hard and patiently maintain her fish vending and prepaid phonecall credit retailing businesses. Somehow, she will expand the business with her income gains. Leima is hoping to enjoy the lending program she entered because it will be of great contribution towards the success of her business and in their life especially in terms of financial, social and spiritual.

loans.name: Amylyn

texts.en:
Amylyn lives in a rural place in Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Dominador P. and they are already blessed with a 4-year-old boy named Kurt Loyd. Amylyn is now preparing for the future education of her child and her future children through managing well their major source of her family income: farming.

Farming is the common source of living for most of the residents in their area. They cultivate their farm lot twice a year by alternately planting onions and vegetables.

They want to improve their status of living in order to satisfy their basic needs and to give their child a bright future. To do this, Amylyn requested a loan amounting to PHP15,000.00 to be used for the improvement and expansion of their small onion farm. She is hoping to harvest a large volume of onions so they will gain a higher income. For Amylyn, she believes that the only way to attain success is through patience, sacrifices and strong faith in God.

loans.use: Improve and expand their onion farm

texts.en:
“Learn to survive and get out of poverty by means of hard work and patience,” shared Rogelyn C., together with her husband, Joel C.. They live happily in a rural place located at Barangay (township) Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya with their two children, namely, Erikamae C. and Harold C.; they are currently studying in high school and college.

Rogelyn is a housekeeper while her husband is only a tricycle (local three-wheeled vehicle) operator who only earns a net income of 180 pesos daily. Aside from that, they also manage planting onions on their half-hectare farm lot. Providing their needs for farm inputs and allowances of their children is too hard for the couple thus Rogelyn decided to help her husband to earn a living in order to satisfy their basic needs, especially the school needs of their two children. She plans to engage in hog-raising since farming is a seasonal business, using the amount she is able to borrow from lenders, at least PHP 5,000.

Amir M. is a farmer who dedicates himself to the business of farming and livestock raising. Amir is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his three children. The necessity that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this reason he is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to purchase cattle to raise for sale. Amir is grateful to everyone supporting him.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy boards and work tools

texts.en:
Jocelyn and her family are living in Barangay (township) Saranay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is already 36 years old and married to Edwin, a secretary in their village. They only have one son named AJ, one year old. Jocelyn helps her husband earn an income by maintaining her poultry and vending businesses.

Jocelyn sells meat products in their village. She roams from one house to another to offer her products. Aside from meat vending, she also raises poultry such as native chickens and ducks. Her weekly net income out of her businesses is averaging PHP 1,000. She budgets her income for their daily food and immediate needs at home. Her business has been a great assistance to their daily living.

To further sustain the businesses, Jocelyn thought of asking for financial support from lenders. She would like to borrow the amount of PHP 7,000 that she can use as additional capital. Jocelyn is hoping to become successful in her business someday so it would be easy for them to send their son to school in the future. “Just believe and put God first before anything else,” said Jocelyn.

Adoracion F. is a 58-year-old widow from Bolinao, Aurora, Isabela. She and her late husband had one son named Ariel, 30 years old, a high school graduate and already married. Her son is operating a tricycle (local three-wheeled vehicle used for transport) to support his family. At present, her son and his family help her sometimes in her Calamansi production business. (Calamansi is a citrus fruit which is smaller than a lemon.) Since her husband died, she solely manages her small “kalamansian” (a Filipino term for a Calamansi farm).

Adoracion is working hard in her business for her grandchildren and to have some savings for her health security. She wants her grandchildren to finish their studies since her son was not able to pursue his education due to poverty. She is glad that she is able to earn a monthly income of PHP 1,500. She wants to grow another kind of fruit other than Calamansi for additional income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to pursue her plan.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester has managed a rolling store business for almost 3 years. She sells meat and fish in their village. With her desire to increase her products, she wants to borrow PHP 8,000 that she can use to purchase a bigger quantity of fish and meat. Through her business, she is able to help her husband generate income to support the basic needs of their family, for household expenses and to support the education of their children. She strives hard to increase her income for the benefit of their family since her husband does not have a permanent job.

She is already 45 years old and her husband is working as a part-time welder. They have eight children: Analyn – 24 years old, college graduate; Fernando – 21 years old, a helper; Anabelle – 19 years old and already married; Erlindo – 18 years old, a high school sophomore; Ana Rose – 13 years old, grade six; Carla – 10 years old, grade four; Carlo – 8 years old, grade one; Kately Ann – 7 years old, is not studying due to lack of financial resources. They have a big family and she wishes to uplift their poor life situation, thus Ester and her husband are doing their best to become successful in the business.

loans.use: To purchase fish and meat for re-sale

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is already 29 years old. She is married to Esucimo, a private employee. The couple was blessed with four kids: Angelo Miguel – 4 years old; Angelica Marie – 3 years old; Angel Jan – 1 year old and their youngest Princess Angela, was just born a few months ago. The family lives in Barangay Research, Minante 1, a community with a large population and considered an urban place.

Edlyn is engaged in the direct selling business of AVON products. According to her, she enjoys her work for she is able to meet different kinds of people, and she is glad that her husband supports her in her business activity. Since her capital in the business is too small for her to purchase the needs of her customers, she has requested a loan of PHP 10,000. Edlyn is very confident that through her direct selling, she is able to help her husband in supporting their family and in the education of their children in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for direct sales

texts.en:
Adoracion L. is 52 years old and happily married to Mariano, a driver. The couple was blessed with four children: Joel - 28 years old, college undergraduate as is Jerry - 26 years old; Maria Arleen - 19 years old, third year college and their youngest is Mark John - 8 years old, already in elementary level. They are residing in the rural area of Saranay, in Cabatuan Isabela. She and her husband are doing their best to give their children a better life and good education.

Adoracion has been engaged in the direct selling business for almost a year. Before she came into this type of business, she used to sell vegetables in their place. Since her income was not enough, she then looked for another business until she came onto direct selling. She is now a dealer of Boardwalk and AVON products for men, women, and kids. With the aid of the company brochures, she has been able to encourage more customers and purchases their orders in the company outlet in Cauayan City which is near their village.

At present, Adoracion is seeking financial assistance in the amount of PHP 5,000 to increase her business capital. She hopes that with her small enterprise, she will be more contented and focus on the development of her business.

“Little trials without God can break you, but big trials with Him can make you great,” a favorite quotation Beatriz G. remembers, every time she is tested by troubles in life.

Beatriz is 48 years old and married to Jessie, a security guard in DTI (Department of Trade and Industry) in Makati City, Manila. They have two children: Jessabeth - 21 years old, a lady guard, and Mark Bee Jay - 14 years old, third year high school student.

Beatriz is really an entrepreneur. She is very diligent in looking for other livelihood resources. Being an extraordinary entrepreneur, she was able to manage at least three simple businesses such as buying and selling frozen foods, food vending and direct selling of personal collection of AVON and NATASHA products for men and women.

With those businesses, Beatriz is able to earn a weekly net income of PHP 1,000 that she uses to support the education of her youngest child. She is now borrowing an additional capital of PHP 5,000 to maintain her small businesses. She is thankful that her husband is very supportive to her business undertakings; that makes her inspired every time.

Evangeline is 40 years old and married to Bilmon, a driver. They were gifted with three children: the eldest is 17 years old and already married at that very young age; the second is in high school and the youngest is in the elementary level. The family is living in a simple community where agriculture is the major source of income for most of the residents.

Evangeline is a dealer of Boardwalk and NATASHA products in their village. Aside from that, she has also been selling calamansi (a citrus fruit, but smaller compared to lemon) in the market for almost two years to generate higher income for her family. She also sells fish and meat at least twice a week for her to have a quality time with her family. The business is good enough to maintain, thus she wants to borrow PHP 7,000 as additional capital for her businesses, for their continued growth for the benefit of her family.

Corazon G. is a dealer and retailer of “basi” (vinegar) in their village.  Her husband, Dominador, is a simple farmer and most of their products are root crops and vegetables.  Despite her age, she still strives in developing her business in order to earn and save for their future. She is presently requesting for a loan of PHP 6,000 that she will use as business capital for their farming business.  

Corazon said that by patience, she will somehow develop her business for its progress.  She is already 60 years old but still very determined to have a good life.  Through their hard work and the cooperation of their children, they were able to send them all to school which she considers the fruit of their sacrifices.

“I cannot do everything but I can do something” is a quotation Julieta B. thinks of every time she encounters problems and trials in life. She is already a widow and left with three children: Judith, Jeremy, and Jhon Loui. The eldest is a high-school graduate, the second is in his senior year in high school, and the youngest is in grade school. She and her children are living a happy life in the village of Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya.

Julieta manages a village store located in front of their house. Aside from her store, she also manages their farm for extra income. Her farm products include vegetables and other root crops. Her income from her businesses is being used to meet the needs of their family and to send her children to school. She is planning to improve her business but she lacks capital. With determination to succeed in the business, she is asking for a loan of PHP6,000.00 that she can use as business capital.

Zakhid M. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the town of Bilasuvar. Zakhid is an animal farmer. He owns cows and calves and, with the help of his wife and children, sells cattle for meat.

In order to further develop his business, Zakhid wants to take out a loan to buy two more calves and feed for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. He is asking for a loan of $1,200 for this purpose. He will repay the loan in 15 months.

texts.ru: Клиент Мирзоев Карим, проживающий в районе А_Чоми занимается животноводстом более 18 лет у него имеется несколько голов скота. Клиенту 60 лет, женат, имеет 6 детей, образования среднее. Клиенту помогает его дети.На получившие деньги, клиент хочет купить несколько молодых бычков.
texts.en:
Karim M. is a client who lives in the A-Chomi region and does animal husbandry for more than eighteen years. He has several heads of cattle. He is 60 years old, married and has six children. He has secondary education. His children are helping him. Karim will use the loan money to buy a few more young calves.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Thuận sinh năm 1979,(Mã số: 010103090001). Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con bé đang độ tuổi đi học. Chồng chị chuyên đi làm thuê ở cơ sở sản xuất sắt thép, còn chị ở nhà bán hàng bánh mỳ ăn sáng và bán quà bánh cho học sinh trước cổng trường học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là: 3.000.000 VND/tháng. Các thành viên trong nhóm đều là thành viên mới tham gia chương trình nên mọi người đã tin tưởng bầu chị làm nhóm trưởng vì chị là người rất nhanh nhẹn, tháo vát và đã tham gia vay vốn qua mấy chi kì trước. Chu kì lần này chị tham gia với mức vốn là: 1.972.000 VND để đầu tư vào việc bán hàng ăn buổi sáng. Trong nhóm chị gồm có:
 Nguyễn Thị Huệ sinh năm 1953, (Mã số: 010103090002). Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 1.500.000 VND/tháng. Chu kì này chị vay mức vốn là: 1.508.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà, ngỗng.
 Nguyễn Thị Sự sinh năm 1963, (Mã số: 010103090003). Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi, chồng chị có lái xe kiếm thêm tiền. Thu nhập của gia đình chị là: 2.000.000 VND/tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn là: 1.972.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.
 Trần Thị L. sinh năm 1977, (Mã số: 010103090004). Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và có bán thêm hàng tạp hóa. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là: 2.000.000 VND/tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn là : 1.972.000 VND để đầu tưu bán cửa hàng tạp hóa.
texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị Thuận was born in 1979. She lives with her husband and their two young children who attend school. Her husband works in a steel factory, and she sells baked goods for breakfast from her home and snacks in front of the gate of the local school. The total monthly income of the family is about 3,000,000 VND (172 USD). All of the members of this group are new participants in the lending program, so they all enthusiastically elected Mrs. Thuận as the group leader because she is energetic and resourceful, and has borrowed money in some of the previous lending cycles. In this round of lending, she requests a L. of 1,972,000 VND (113 USD) to invest in her business selling breakfast. The group’s other members are: Nguyễn Thị Huệ was born in 1953. Her main occupations are farming and raising animals. The average total income of her family is 1,500,000 VND (86 USD) per month. In this lending cycle she requests a L. of 1,508,000 VND (86 USD) to invest in raising chickens and geese. Nguyễn Thị Sự was born in 1963. Her main occupations are farming and raising animals, and her husband works as a driver to earn extra money. Her family’s income is 2,000,000 VND (114 USD) per month. She requests a L. of 1,972,000 VND (113 USD) to invest in raising chickens. Trần Thị L. was born in 1977. Her main occupations are farming and selling groceries. The average total income of her family is 2,000,000 VND (114 USD) per month. She requests a L. of 1,972,000 VND (113 USD) to invest in selling groceries.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

Zakir K. is a 50-year-old entrepreneur who has kept his own café for the last four years. Zakir is married and has four children. He started his business in 2004 when he was without a permanent job. He opened his café next to the local factory and now this place is very popular and full of people during lunchtime. In the evening, people often come to Zakir's place to have some tea, whic is part of the heritage of Azerbaijani people.

Zakir spends all his income on his large family. He would like to expand his business and improve the conditions he is working in. He especially wants to make a small repair in his café. For this purpose, he applied for a $1,200 loan and promises to repay it on time.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman I. is 45 years old. He supports his wife, their three children and his parents who all live with Osman in one house. Osman makes traditional Azerbaijan bread called ”tendir.” He has been working at baking since he was 20. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes tendir and bread so that people have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. He purchases all the input materials like flour, salt, and yeast in the local market.

Now due to high demand, Osman wants to increase the quantity of bread he makes, so he requests $1200 for a term of 15 months. The loan will be used to purchase more flour and also coal for baking. In the future he dreams of opening his own workshop and with the profit, building his own house. Osman deeply appreciates the trust and support you give him.

loans.use: to purchase more flour to increase bread production

texts.vi: Phạm Thị Dích sinh năm 1959, (Mã số: 010103090005). Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, chồng chị lái xe chở thuê hàng vật liệu xây dựng. Thu nhập của gia đình chị là: 2.000.000 VND/tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn là 3.270.000 VND.
texts.en:
Phạm Thị Dích was born in 1959. Her main occupation is farming, and her husband drives a truck transporting building materials. The total income of her family is 2,000,000 VND (122 USD) per month. She requests a loan of 3,270,000 VND (200 USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

Sabir M. is 46 years old and married with four children. His business has been the purchase and sale of livestock, which he offers once a week in the livestock market where he takes his animals. Sabir grew up in the countryside and being close to nature is very gratifying for him.

The difficulty arises in transporting his livestock, but Sabir isn't discouraged by this and works very hard to fulfill his dreams. He wants financial stability so he can educate all his children. With this loan he hopes to acquire more heads of cattle to help generate additional income. With that income, he would like to start another business; he is still analyzing and deciding exactly what business that will be. Sabir is a trusted client of KIVA and Aqroinvest; he has a successful loan history and paid back an earlier KIVA loan on time.

This is a small loan requested by four people, all residents of Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. The loan will help them improve their standard of living.

Mrs. P., 63, has been selected to be the lead by the other members. She is a widowed mother of two children who live away from the family home. P. plants rice on her own farmland in the village; she can plant twice a year, during the dry season and the rainy season. She now faces difficulty with plowing the farmland because her cow is too old to plow a field. P. would like a loan to replace her old cow. 

The other three borrowers include T., 52, who sells groceries from home. She needs a loan to buy rice to offer for sale.
K., 34,  is a local farmer who will use the loan to buy fruits to sell. And M., 51, is a rice farmer who will use the loan to purchase rice in bulk to store and re-sell for income.

texts.ru: Клиент Бабиев Махмараджаб, проживающий в районе А_Чоми, клиенту 51 год.Женат имеет 6 детей, образование высшее. Сам клиент занимается животноводствам уже более 22 лет у него имеется несколько бычков.На полученные деньгт, клиент хочет купить несколько молодых телят, с дольнейшей перепродажи.
texts.en:
Mahmaradjab B. is a client who lives in the A-Chomi region, he is 51 years old. He is married and has six children. He has high education. He has been doing animal husbandry for more than 22 years and has several calves. He will use the loan money to buy a few more young calves for future resale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Rakhman P. is married and the father of 2 children. Although he is primarily a farmer, he also raises animals, a sideline business which he feels passionate about. Selling animals he has raised is his special source of income. Rakhman raises his animals in the traditional fashion, which does not provide much in the way of financial return. Interested in modernizing his operation, so as to earn more profit, Rakhman would like to build a pen for his animals and add more sheep to his flock. Accomplishing this will allow him to increase his income and better provide for his family.

K. Annet is the leader of the Konoweka group in Lugazi. She is a hard-working lady with a retail shop as her business. In fact, out of the six members in the group, four have retail shops as their main businesses in addition to farming for food production.

In her shop, Annet sells mostly the basics like sugar, bread, eggs, cooking oil and paraffin. She buys her goods from Zziba's wholesale shops as well as from Lugazi town. She needs a loan to help with restocking her retail shop so that she can be able to make more profits to cater for her family.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
S. is 57 years old and a resident of the Siem Reap Province. She is a mother of seven children: the oldest two are married and live separately, the second two are single and work with Saroun in her business, and the last three are students. She is married to Aiy, 73, who earns a living fishing along the Mekong river.

S. gets up early every morning to gather the fish from her husband and other fisherman in bulk and then hurries them to the market. She has many customers because her store is located in the busy market. The family has a big piece of land from which they raise chickens and ducks to earn more income for the family. Recently, to make the family more healthy, S. has decided to request a loan of $ 500 to buy ducks for the family to raise and to renovate her house. The loan will help the family upgrade their standard of living. She dreams of her children having a degree.

loans.use: To buy ducks for the family to raise and to renovate her house

loans.name: Alimusa

texts.en: Alimusa F. is 61 years old and is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs like: cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea and many others in his grocery store which he built eight years ago. Currently, Alimusa has about $2000 of goods in inventory. His monthly net profit is about $ 300. Today, Alimusa is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress in their studies. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more food inventory for his store.

texts.en: Parvana A. is 40 years old, married and has three children. Parvana has been running a grocery store for the past ten years. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and also detergents. The goods she has for sale are of very good quality with a wide selection. Parvana is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to buy groceries from her again. Parvana is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Parvana reach all of her aspirations.

loans.name: Naiba

texts.en:
Naiba K. is 60 years old and a widow raising her one daughter alone. Her daughter is Naiba's inspiration to work hard every day and continue with her business. When her husband passed away, Naiba was left without steady income. Supporting her children practically on her own was very difficult. After a long suffering she decided to open a grocery store near her house. Naiba is trying to generate income not only for her family's consumption, but also to be able to create savings for the future wedding of her daughter.

To increase the range of goods she has for sale, Naiba is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 15 months. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working. Your generosity can change her life and her family's life.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Domptila

texts.fr: Domptila N., 35 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois des femmes catholiques de Ziguinchor depuis 8 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme, du citron, du pain de singe, et des poissons secs. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Domptila N., age 35, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group of Catholic women of Ziguinchor for 8 years. Her work consists in buying and reselling palm oil, lemons, “monkey bread” (the fruit of the baobab tree), and dried fish. She wants to boost her commerce and to improve the health and living conditions of her family. The loans she’s requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To re-sell palm oil, lemons, monkeybread, and dried fish

texts.en: Idris M. is a hard-working man who strives every day to provide for his entire family, which consists of his wife and three children. He manages a grocery store where he sells many staples, such as bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods. Although he started this business only six years ago with less than $100, Idris has attracted a strong base of customers who are impressed by his efforts to travel to neighboring cities to purchase especially valuable items. In order to purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory, Idris is requesting a loan of 1200 USD.

Ramiz K. is 49 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of home products and detergents in his store. His store is very famous in his community, which allows him to have a good clientele.

Today Ramiz is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. Ramiz’s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they’ll become successful entrepreneurs. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will be key factors in the success of his small business.
Khaqani

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en: Sarantsetseg N., 41, is the proud mother of 21-year-old and 18-year-old daughters. She lives with her husband and children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 1999, with her husband, she began to rent a small candy stall in Narantuul market, the largest open-air market in Ulaanbaatar. When she started the candy business, she had only 250,000 MNT in capital ($1=1,600 MNT). Today, thanks to the steady growth of her business, she has diversified her products. She now sells candies, fruits and vegetables and her capital has increased to 1,300,000 MNT. Her husband also has begun to run a small retail shop for various consumer products. She requests a loan to expand her business and diversify it with more products. Sarantsetseg is a well-experienced and responsible person. She hopes to be able to invest in her children’s education soon and to one day have her own supermarket with diverse food products.

loans.use: To buy more candies, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Savri

texts.en:
Savri is a woman with much courage who strives to provide her three children with food and education, as well as keep them healthy and give them a sense of well-being. She goes to the fields every day, where she grows potatoes, wheat and maize. She was taught farming techniques by her parents as a child, and the nature of her work and her eagerness to get ahead in life motivate her every day. Consequently, her farm products are consistently of high quality. Savri needs your support, through this loan, to invest in high-quality seeds and fertilizer and improve her harvest. This is why she requires a loan of $2,400 for 12 months. Let's support this effort by a mother who wants the best for her children.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; Alexander the Great's rule; and many famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Boimahmad

texts.en:
This is K. Boimahmad, who is married and has four children. He is 42 years old and lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan, where he runs a retail shop with which he supports his family. In his shop, Boimahmad sells spare parts for many different types of foreign cars. He has worked in this business for more than five years. He hopes to increase his income and send his older son to university. To do this, he needs a loan for $1,900 to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to better meet the needs of his customers. The loan will be repaid within 10 months. Boimahmad is happy to be able to apply for this loan and would like to thank everyone for this trust. Hr promises to be precise in making loan payments. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Zaftarhoja

texts.en:
A. Zaftarhoja has worked closely with MicroInvest since 2006. He is one of our most active clients, and has a reputation as a serious and highly-capable businessperson who has never been late with any payments. For the last eight years, he has made a living raising livestock. He has a good deal of education, having graduated from an agricultural institute and worked as farm manager in a local collective farm.

Zaftarhoja loves his work and spends a lot of time taking care of his animals -- a cow and eight rams. His wife and his oldest daughter help him in his work. They also make many milk products that the family sells to neighbors. Zaftarhoja has applied to KIVA for a loan to build a summer barn for his cows. He thanks KIVA for its support and for the assistance it provides to small businesses like his.

loans.use: To build a barn for his cows to use in the summer

loans.name: Mumin

texts.en:
M. Mumin is a family man who wants to expand his business so that he can better support his family and give it a better quality of life. Eleven years ago, Mumin started selling spare parts for various types of cars.  His business has grown little by little, and now offers a variety of products. His started with capital worth no more than $1,000. Today, Mumin has been working with IMON International for almost two years, and feels very satisfied with the support he has received, because it has allowed him to increase his business, satisfy the needs of his customers and support his family. Mumin has applied to borrow $1,900 to buy new goods for his store. He wants to expand his business and increase his income to create a better life for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  hese conditions have created high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his business by buying additional spare parts for cars.

texts.en:
A. Abdufattoh lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and is the loving father of two pretty children. He works hard to ensure a good future for his children.

Abdufattoh has been engaged in the livestock business for 10 years. It is the general family income. Abdufattoh has good skills with the livestock he works with at the collective farm. Abdufattoh applies to Kiva with the request of a business-development loan of 1600 STJ for six months to purchase a pedigree bull. He thanks Kiva for its support and wishes it all the best for the future.

T. Khusein lives in a community that lacks industrial and commercial jobs. Due to these circumstances, he decided to become self-employed and thus not have to emigrate to Russia. He started selling different kinds of tubes like pipes, culverts, drainpipes, and also fittings and channels.

Soon he became known in his community and now he has many clients. Khusein tells us that he has many pending orders. This is the reason he is asking for a loan of $3,000 that he will pay back in 12 months. With this money, Khusein will be able to buy more merchandise in order to have a larger variety and fulfill his pending orders. With your help, Khusein and his family will be able to get ahead.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work tools and to fix up his shop

texts.en:
K. Ekonboy was born in 1974 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has four children. Ekonboy has been engaged in the family livestock business for 20 years. He raises and sells the livestock. He has a reputation as a hardworking man who is ready to work to ensure a good future for his children.

Ekonboy dreams of having a big herd. Today he has a milk cow and five rams. He wants to purchase a pedigree bull to increase the number of his herd. Ekonboy thanks Kiva for its support and contribution to small entrepreneurs' development.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is a hard-working person and for many years this has allowed her to earn enough income to support her two children by herself. She is devoted to the raising of animals, especially cows, which she buys and sells in her local market. In this manner, she obtains the income that she needs. In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, Mariya is requesting a loan of $600 with a term of 12 months to be used for purchasing young cattle. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, earn more, and meet the needs of her children. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International 

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, its culture is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to expand the business

texts.en: Mavzuna M. is 38 years old. She lives in Khujand and trades woman's wear, which she imports from Kyrgyzstan, at the week-end bazaar. She has good taste and a good assortment so repeat customers come to buy her goods. Mavzuna is a school teacher by professional background. She teaches the history of Tajikistan but a school teacher's salary is too low to live on so Mavzuna decided 2 years ago to start a woman's wear business. Mavzuna is applying to  KIVA in order to request a business support loan of 3700 STJ for 6 months to import new seasonal inventory. She thanks KIVA and wishes all the best in future.

loans.name: Marohat

texts.en:
Marohat is 32 years old. She is married and is the mother of a two-year old. Her husband, a farmer by profession, does not completely cover all household expenses. To address this situation, she started selling meat products such as: sausages, frankfurters and chicken. She was successful in saving a little money and invested it in expanding her business. She has a lot of experience after 5 years in this kind of business. Warmly accommodating and innately moral, Marohat is requesting a loan of $800 USD to buy more chicken and sausage to meet customer demands. The success of this project will help her family to fully thrive where health, nourishment, schooling, and clothing are concerned.

loans.use: Purchasing chicken and sausage for selling

texts.en: M. Inoyat first applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and has stayed in its loan program to the present day so she trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure.  Inoyat is married with 4 children and she lives in Khujand. She has sold the national Tajik bread named “lepeshky” for 13 years.  Inoyat is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2000 STJ for 8 months to take advantage of a trade outlet opening so she can trade out of any trading center.  Inoyat thanks KIVA for its support and contribution to the development of small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Dodkhudo

texts.en:
Dodkhudo K. is a successful businessman in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He has been selling spare parts for foreign cars for the past eight years. He provides the only source of income for his family, which includes three children. 

Dodkhudo started out with only a few parts that hardly anyone would buy. With the help of three loans from IMON International, he has been able develop and grow his business over the past three years and gain an advantage over his competition by diversifying his inventory. He is seeking a loan of $1200 USD, which he will use to re-stock his inventory and purchase more merchandise. This will help him further diversify his collection of parts, increase his sales, and better provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchase spare car parts to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy lumber and work tools

texts.en: Tojinisso M. is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Khujand, Tajikistan, where she sells menswear in the central bazaar "Panjshanbe." She offers a good assortment of clothing that she imports from Istaravshan and Kyrgyzstan. Her business brings in repeat customers. Tojinisso  is requesting a business support loan of 4100 STJ for 6 months so that she can import new seasonal wear. She thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best in future.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima M. is married with two children. She started her business out of economic pressure six years ago, as her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to cover the family’s expenses. She began to investigate the types of work she could do, and one of her friends recommended that she sell children’s clothing. She decided to try it. Little by little, she brought in more clients, and her income increased as she sold more clothing. Rahima is applying for a loan of $700 USD to purchase merchandise to fill existing client orders, which she is offering to repay in 5 months.

She hopes that you will collaborate with her. She and her family thank you for supporting them and helping them move ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to fill client orders

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima started her business 12 years ago selling fabrics for sewing national dresses. Her husband works as a teacher. As a result his earnings are small and she wanted to give her children a better quality of life. Thanks to her effort the business has gone very well for her. Now she is requesting a loan for $800 which she will repay in 5 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise, since her sales are increasing and she wants to have inventory in stock for all of her clients. With your contribution Salima will move ahead.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital to buy merchandise and develop the business.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat R. is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. For more than 14 years Saodat has been engaged in the business of selling fabrics for national dresses. She gets up at 6 am to prepare breakfast for her husband and children and afterward she is busy selling her merchandise until 5 pm.

With this loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, Saodat plans to buy fabrics to increase the range of her selling goods. She is very happy that thanks to her effort, she has less worry, can help her children with their homework, and is able to make a contribution to her family. Saodat is very grateful for the support that IMON International, with the help of Kiva, provides for her business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Increasing working capital to buy fabrics and increase the range of her selling goods.

loans.name: Asadulla

texts.en:
Asadulla S. is from the district of Rudaki, Tajikistan. Currently, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. He is the father of 6 children whom he cares for and has the responsibility of educating. It’s important to note that Asadulla is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. It’s for this reason that he turned to IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase some pregnant cows to help him increase his income. With your help, Asadulla will be able to make his business succeed and support his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Murod U. lives in Khujand. He has been engaged in commercial service and trade for 7 years. He sells eggs and has the trade outlet in his home area. Murod works in the bird farm and sells eggs in his free time. It is an additional business so he trades in small wares at a home trade outlet. Murod is applying to Kiva with the request of a business development loan of $275 (1000 TJS) for 4 months for eggs to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy eggs and expand his business.

texts.en:
Mavjuda is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is a divorced mother and has a son. Mavjuda has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. With a lot of effort, she has been able to open her own shop at her home and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today she is requesting a loan of $800 for the term of 12 months for purchasing a new sewing machine. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Mavjuda and her son are grateful for your generosity and support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

Abdujabbor T. first applied to MicroInvest in 2009 and he recommends himself as a reliable business owner who trusts in the MicroInvest loan procedure.  Abdujabbor is married and has 2 children. He lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He has been selling the national Tajik bread named “lepeshky” for 10 years. Abdujabbor is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months. He will use the loan to open a new trade outlet. Abdujabbor thanks KIVA for its support and contribution to the development of small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Mehri

texts.en:
T. Mehri is a 48-year-old widowed mother who does sewing work in a tailoring shop to earn money for her children. She started because she loves this trade. Shortly after her husband passed away, this activity became her only income source and way to get the resources that her family needed.

Mehri is doing the best she can to ensure her children have a good education and the best future. She wishes that her children can continue with their education. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business. She asks for a $800 loan that will be invested in buying a new sewing machine to increase her production and cover the customers' demands. She commits herself to return back the amount in 12 months. 

Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Mehri’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine and fabrics for sewing the national dresses

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita G. is 28 years old. She is single and enjoys trading, the business through which she make a living. Rita lives at a family house at Kwahu Da in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run other types of businesses.

Rita trades in second-hand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second-hand clothes, including bedspreads, ladies clothing and menswear, from Kumasi, a nearby city. She then sells them in the market square of her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell.

Rita has been in this business for eight years and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales. She also prepares and sells banku (fermented corn dough) in her community to beef up her income. Rita says she prepares her banku in the morning and switches over to the sale of used clothes in the evening through hawking.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to reach out to other market centers and eventually, help improve her finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called ‘Anigyee’ (Happiness) Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee loans for one another and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand textiles

texts.en:
U. Rano sells eggs in the local bazaar. Since she has hard competition, she has had to lower the existing price but she also sells in large-scale quantities. Rano first applied to MicroInvest in 2004, when she decided to open the egg-selling business. Today she knows the nuances of and is skilled in the business. She works directly with the supplier so every time she has fresh and good eggs. Rano has repeat customers and she is a very communicative woman.

Rano applies to Kiva for the business-development loan of 2000 STJ for eight months to expand her business. She thanks Kiva for its support.

Martha A. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children. She says two have graduated from senior high school but the youngest is currently studying in junior high school. She lives with her family in their own house at Kwahwu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. 

Martha works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. She sells food, such as plantain, cassava, and yams from a table top in the community market. She also distributes cassava and plantain to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. She buys her goods from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. 

She wants a loan to buy the food on large scale so that she can cut costs, including frequent trips to procure the goods, and also to maximize profit.

She is a member of the community group called ‘Anigyee’ ("Happiness:). Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

texts.ru: Юсупов Бахтиер житель района Хуросон. Возраст 43 года. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже восемь лет. За кредитом обратился для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет ему развивать бизнес и получить прибыль.Погасить планируемый кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bahtior Y. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 43 years old, married and has five children. He does animal husbandry and breeds cattle. He has eight years experience in this field. He has asked for a loan to increase the headcount of cattle. This will help him expand his business and increase his income. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en:
Since she was a small girl, Bahriniso has been entirely dedicated to work. She buys and sells cattle. Until now, this has been the most important source of income for her. Her work consists of raising beef cattle. After fattening them, she sells at the best price and makes her profit. In the future, she wants to start another business. 

In the meantime she will continue dedicating herself to cattle-raising. Right now she wishes to expand her business and purchase more cattle. That is the reason that Bahriniso has asked for a loan of $1200 USD. You could become an important part of Bahriniso family's life. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: To buy cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy three baskets of dried fish

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 37-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ali has been working in construction for twelve years. He has requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time. 

His previous loans helped him to improve his business. Ali chose this business because of his experiences. In the future, he plans to expand the business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 45-year-old engaged man who lives in Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Ibrahim has been working as a furniture painter since 2002. He has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work and to save money for his wedding. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan.

Ibrahim is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. Ibrahim chose  his business because of his experience, especially because he learned it when he was young.

loans.use: Ibrahim will use the loan to purchase tools for his work and save money for his wedding.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Ahmad has owned a butcher shop since 2006. He requested a loan of $1,200 from Al Majmoua in order to expand his business by opening a restaurant. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad is special in his work because he sells a good, clean quality of meat. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Ahmad first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing the necessary machines and tools for his work. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on opening his restaurant.

loans.use: To expand his business by opening a restaurant

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 33-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Mohammad has been working as a house painter for thirteen years. He has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase paint and tools for his work. This is the first time that Mohammad has requested a loan.

Mohammad is special because of his good and fast work. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. He chose his business because of his experiences. In the future, Mohammad plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mohammad will use the loan to purchase paint and tools for his work.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married. She sells jewelry in a space that she rents in a department store in Vasilievka. Ludmila has been in this business for five years. At first, someone told her she could start a business. She did the calculations, chose the type of goods she wanted to sell, and just decided to have her own business. Ludmila is a very decisive person; she works hard to reach her goals and she is determined to develop her business even further.

Ludmila would like a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase her assortment. This particular kind of goods does not lose its value, unlike other products. An increased assortment would bring more clients to Ludmila and increase her profits.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of jewelry

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 45-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Mouhamad has been selling vegetables and coal for seven years. He has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

Mouhamad is special in his work because he has good quality products. His clients can be anybody. Mouhamad chose his business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mouhamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Aabbass

texts.en:
Aabbass is a 41-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Aabbass has been working as a painter for seventeen years. He requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools and paint for his work. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time. 

His previous loans helped him to improve his business. His clients can be anybody. Aabbass chose his business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Aabbass will use the loan to purchase tools and paint for his work.

texts.en:
Igor is 29 years old. He is married. He fixes houses and apartments. He has been in this business for two years. His monthly income is 5,000 UAH. He is a very responsible and lively person. People trust him and hire him to help them  fix their houses and apartments. 

Igor would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to fix an apartment. This will help him to improve his own living conditions.

loans.name: Sopey Naby Group

texts.fr:
