http://sem-fund.org/villages.php?val=2

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui ont été formées pour la transformation des fruits et légumes. C'est pour cela que nous venons solliciter un financement auprès de Kiva pour pouvoir acheter beaucoup un grand nombre de produits de première nécessité( fruits légumes et bocal, produits de consevation)pour en disposer d'un stock qui nous permettra de vendre sans discontinuer durant toute l'année. Cette activité nous permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de nos familles et permet ainsi la création d'emploi pour les jeunes filles du village.
texts.en:
We are a group of women trained to transform fruits and vegetables. We are seeking a loan from Kiva to purchase large quantities of products (fruits, vegetables, glass jars, and preservatives) to constitute a stock that will enable us to sell without interruption throughout the year. This business will enable us to provide for our families, and will also create jobs for the young women of the village.

http://sem-fund.org/villages.php?val=2

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for home canning

texts.ru: Мирзоев Исматулло проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 37 лет , женат и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке района. Торгует одеждой , которую привозит из города Душанбе. Опыт в бизнесе уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 9 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ismatullo M. lives in the Gissar region. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. He has secondary education. He works on the central market of the region. He sells clothing which he brings in from Dushanbe. His experience is ten years in this business. He plans to use the loan to increase his commodity circulation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

A greeting from Odette B.. Odette lives in Nyarugenge District in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. Odette is 43 years old. She is married to Marcel Rutaganda and they have five children.

This entrepreneur owns a stationery shop in the middle town of Kigali where she sells all office supplies and the services of a photocopier. She has two full-time workers who help her to run her business. In fact, Odette has such a stable business that, from her profits, she is able to pay school fees for her children and buy food to sustain them. 

She had been doing the same business for 5 years. This entrepreneur opens her business from 7:00am to 19:00pm. She makes approximately 200000Rwf per month.

Odette B. hopes to expand her business and continue to pay school fees for her children.

Odette is requesting a loan of 500000Rwf from Vision Finance Company, S.A. This loan will be repaid in eight months on a monthly basis.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seeds and agricultural supplies

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Leocadia M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has one child who is two years old. She is also responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents cannot take care of them. 

Leocadia has been running a beauty salon since 2008. This is a place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, or blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.

She works at her business for 5-8 hours per day, 3 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Leocadia currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan to open a fish business. In the future, she plans to improve her fish business. Leocadia thanks you for her support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is thirty nine years old and lives in Zouk Mkayel in Mount Lebanon. He opened a gadget, CDs, and DVDs shop in 1995. Today, Fadi wants to increase his inventory in addition to renewing the shop's décor; therefore he is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: Increase inventory and renew shop's décor

texts.en: Kifaya is a 43-year-old married woman with four children, living in Al Nabatieh in southern Lebanon. She has owned and operated a bakery since 2000, and she already has several micro loans from Ameen to improve it. Today, Kifaya is requesting $1,000 in order to renew her bakery's machinery.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruit for making juices and to buy stocks of soda and drinking water

loans.name: Moammad Ali

texts.en: Mohammad Ali is twenty years old and lives in Tarik Al Jadida in Beirut. In 2006, he opened a clothing shop with the help of his parents. Today, Mohammad Ali wants to increase his inventory, especially since he has the opportunity to buy a supply of clothing for a very good price.  He is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: Buy more clothing for his store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicks and supplies and equipment for raising poultry

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad is a 41-year-old married man with four children, living in Bourj Al Barajneh in the Beirut suburbs. He opened a small tailoring shop in 2000, and has twenty years of experience in this industry. Today, Imad wants to borrow $1,200 in order to buy an electrical scissors tool, and to increase his inventory.

loans.use: Buy electrical scissors and restock inventory

texts.en: Haytham is a 30-year-old single man who lives in A. Ouzai in the Beirut suburbs. For fifteen years he has worked in the air conditioning and ventilation field, which he learned from his father. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to repair or replace his tools and equipment.

Hussein is a 42-year-old married man and lives in A. Ouzai in the Beirut suburbs. He is a car mechanic, and he opened his shop in 1991. To further improve his services, Hussein is asking for $1,000 to buy new tools and machinery.

Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Mercy C. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children, aged 8 and 12. Mercy has been running a craft and a livestock business since 2005. She raises pigs and sells them when they grow up. She works at the business for 9-12 hours every day, six days a week and is assisted by one employee. Mercy currently earns about $200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan to renovate her pig sty. In the future, she plans to open another business. Mercy thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is twenty-five years old and lives in Haret Hreik in the Beirut suburbs. She is a shoe designer and manufacturer working from her house. She learned about this industry five years ago, when she was working in a shoe making factory. Today, Amina wants to borrow $1,200 to buy more raw materials and tools to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy more raw material and tools

texts.en: Atafallah R. is a 35-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Al Shhabieh in southern Lebanon. He has been a car electrician since 1995, and owns his own shop. Atafallah is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy new equipment and machinery so that he can introduce new services in his shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en: Afif R. is a 51-year-old floor tile specialist from Maarakeh in southern Lebanon. He is married with 3 children. He has been serving his village and the surrounding villages with tiles for the past 24 years. Afif is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a small van to help him further manage his time.

Bahaa S. is a 23-year-old single man living in Bzibdine in Mount Lebanon. He has been brick roof mason for the past five years, after learning the family business from his father. Bahaa is requesting a loan of $1000 so that he can purchase a welding machine.

Elie A. is 21 years old and married. He lives in the Ashrafieh district of Beirut. He opened a barbershop in 2005, after learning the business from a friend. Elie wishes to use this loan of $800 to improve his barbershop’s décor.

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces.
Doris es soltera, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Doris tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, además brinda servicios de fotocopiado, juegos, también vende golosinas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su sobrino.
Doris necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Doris sueña con cambiar de negocio por la venta de golosinas por mayor.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the communal bank "Sauces" (Willows). Doris is single, is 33 years old and has one son. Doris runs an internet cafe that also offers photocopying services as well as games and sells candy. This is something she does every day with the help of her nephew. Doris needs a loan of $300 so that she can buy candy to sell for her business. Doris dreams about changing business to sell candy in bulk and at wholesale prices.

(Translated by Elliot of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Yanina  es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces.
Yanina es soltera, tiene 24 años y vive con sus padres, Yanina estudia para Técnica dental, trabaja en un laboratorio dental, Yanina vende materiales dentales que vende a diferentes laboratorios. 
Yanina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales dentales.
Los sueños de Yanina son especializarse como técnica dental y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Yanina is a member of the Weeping Willow Communal Bank. Yanina is single; she is 24 years old and lives with her parents. Yanina is studying dental technology. She works in a dental laboratory. Yanina sells dental equipment to different labs. Yanina needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be used to buy dental equipment. Yanina's goal is to specialize as a dental tech and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

Fadi S. is 43 years old and married with two children. He lives in in Fourn Al Chebak in Beirut. Fadi has owned a car mechanic shop since 1981. He is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy new machinery so that he can improve his customer service.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diama 2 Group

texts.en:
http://sem-fund.org/oussouye.php

We’ve had a loan that enabled us to get started in commerce and the renting out of bicycles in our eco-village. Demand is stronger and stronger, and we live in an area where traveling on bikes is easier, due to paths that lead towards surrounding villages. With the first loan, we began marketing and renting mountain bikes to tourists, who prefer this mode of travel for exploring the most remote corners of our area that they couldn’t usually reach with a car.

But for a time now, thanks to the first loan that Kiva granted us, we are managing with difficulty to cope with the demand, which is leading us to augment our capacity to meet the demand through increasing the number of bikes available for renting and also for selling, since the demand for buying is much greater. With the first loan, we managed to resolve the problem of our children’s schooling costs. And we wish to expand our commerce. This is why we have come to request a renewal of our financing, since we’ve finished paying back the first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bicycles and spare parts

texts.es: Carmen tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres, tiene dos hermanos, ella es la mayor. Tras de haber realizado estudios de contabilidad en un instituto, ahora trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad como asistente contable. Sus padres se dedican a la agricultura y tienen una bodega, pero ahora están pasando dificultades muy severas, debido que no resultó su siembra por el alza de los fertilizantes y la tienda no está bien surtida, debido a ello su madre está desmotivada, ante sus dificultades. Carmen cree que su labor de hija es apoyarla incrementando la cantidad de productos de su bodega y convertirla en un negocio rentable para que sus hermanos tengan la misma oportunidad que ella, está convencida que incrementado los productos captará más clientes que le den la oportunidad de crecer y prosperar. Mientras tanto, sus planes son de seguir trabajando, con la esperanza que la vuelvan a contratar el resto de los seis meses del año para ayudar a sus padres y hermanos menores. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, tiene muchos anhelos de trabajar en este banco comunal, en el cual hace compromisos de pagar las cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para la bodega de su madre.
texts.en:
Carmen is twenty years old, single and she lives in a house with her parents and two younger brothers. After having achieved a degree in accounting from an private school, she now works at the city hall of her town as an assistant accountant. Her parents makes a living by farming and they also owns a grocery store, but they are now going through severe difficulties because the price of fertilizer went up by a lot and they were not able to buy enough. For this reason, their crops are suffering. Also, the store that they own is not well stocked since her mother is feeling very worried because of the crops. Carmen believes that she can help her parents by increasing the amount of products in the store and by making it a profitable business. She wants her younger siblings to have the same opportunities that she had to get an education. She is convinced that by increasing the amount of products at the store, they will be able to attract more customers. Carmen's plans are to continue to work with the hope that her contract at her job will be renewed for another six months so that she can help her parents and her younger siblings. This is the first loan that she is requesting through MFP. She hopes to work with this communal bank and she promises to make her loan payments on time. The money that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing more merchandise for her mother's store.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Sonia es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Sonia se dedica a la elaboración de panes variados, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza con la ayuda de vendedoras que se ubican en lugares céntricos de la ciudad por las tardes. Además Sonia tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Sonia son tener un horno propio e implementar cabinas de Internet.
texts.en:
Sonia es a member of the Paloma communal bank. She is married, 33 years old and has 3 children. Sonia works making various types of bread, which shes does in a rented oven. She sells the bread in the afternoon with the help of female vendors in centrally located places throughout the city. She also has a grocery store. Sonia needs a loan of 1500 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Sonia's dreams are to have her own oven and setup Internet booths.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Haydee es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Haydee tiene un puesto alquilado cerca del terminal terrestre, en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hermana.
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas, sillas.
Haydee sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She is married, 30 years old and has 2 children. Haydee has a rented booth near the bus station where she sells food, which she does everyday with the help of her sister. Haydee needs a loan of 1000 Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of tables and chairs. Her dream is to expand her business and have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Tacku Liguèye De Tessito 2 Group

texts.fr:
http://sem-fund.org/oussouye.php

Nous avons fini de rembourser le prêt qui nous avait été accordé par Kiva et souhaitons avoir un renouvellement car Kiva est un partenaire en qui nous avons confiance et par qui grâce à la facilité dont il fait preuve, nous a permis de travailler dignement et sans trop de contrainte. C'est ainsi que grâce au premier prêt, nous sommes parvenues à établir un petit commerce qui nous aide à gérer le quotidien au sein de nos familles, car toutes les membres du groupe travaillent tous les jours, alors que cela ne pouvait pas se faire auparavant. Le prochain prêt va nous permettre de stocker un gran nombre de produits et nous permettra d'aller vers les foires qui sont organisées dans différentes localités de la région pour y écouler des produits selon la saison( Mangues, oranges, poissons secs; huile de palme et tout autre type de produits de consomation domestique.
texts.en:
http://sem-fund.org/oussouye.php

We’ve finished repaying the loan we were granted by Kiva and would like a renewal because Kiva is a partner we trust and which, due to the ease demonstrated, has enabled us to work with dignity and without too many constraints. Thus, thanks to the first loan, we managed to establish small-scale commerce which helps us to manage the day-to-day of our families, since every group member works every day, whereas this could not be done previously. The next loan will allow us to stock a large number of goods and to allow us to go to fairs, which are set up in various towns in the region for moving seasonal goods (mangoes, oranges, dried fish, palm oil) and any other kind of domestically-consumed goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy woodland and marine products

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Graciela es casada, tiene 54 años y 6 hijos, Graciela venD. salchipollos todas las tardes en la puerta D. su casa, además Graciela los días sábados y domingos venD. cebiche. Graciela tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta D. ropa. 
Graciela necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa.
Los sueños D. Graciela son construir su casa con material noble, tener una tienda y que sus hijos tengan buena educación.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She is married, 54 years old and has 6 children. Graciela sells salchipollos, a Peruvian fast food, during the afternoon and sells ceviche during the weekend. She is planning to start selling clothing. Graciela needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of clothing for the new business. Graciela's dreams are to build house that is maD. out of sturdy materials, to have a store, and that her children have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Dina es soltera, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Dina tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, la especialidad es la comida típica, los fines de semana prepara mas platos, para lo cual cuenta con una persona quien le ayuda. Además por las tardes vende bebidas.
Dina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cervezas.
Dina sueña con comprar una casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She is single, 39 years old and has 5 children. Dina has a restaurant in a rented local. Her specialty is the typical food of the region. On the weekends she prepares more dishes, with which she has an employee to help her. She also sells drinks in the afternoons. Dina needs a loan of 1500 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of beer to sell. Dina dreams about having her own house and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Viviana es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Viviana vende cebiche de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Elena, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo. Además Viviana vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Viviana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de otro triciclo.
Los sueños de Viviana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She is married, 30 years old and has 4 children. Viviana has a mobile stand selling ceviche in the Santa Elena market, for which she uses a three-wheeled bike. She also sells cosmetics via mail-order. Viviana needs a loan of 800 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of another tricycle. Viviana's dreams are to build a house and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a three-wheeled bike for her business

texts.es: Carmen tiene 41 años, es casada hace 11 años y madre de una niña. Desde pequeña se ha dedicado al cultivo de la tierra, por ser de padres agricultores, en aquellas épocas ellos sembraban papa y arveja. Pero hace 10 años ella incursionó en la siembra de verduras en las chacras que heredó de sus padres y alquila otras tierras para el cultivo de flores. La venta de flores le resulta muy rentable durantes los meses de mayo y noviembre; pero en los otros meses se dedica mucho más a sus cultivos de hortalizas. Cada 15 días o fin de mes envía su producción a los mercados; dependiendo de los precios, vende en su misma zona o la lleva a la ciudad de Lima. Esta vez con la ayuda de su hermana y su esposo llevaron sus productos al mercado de su misma localidad, quedándose ella al cuidado de su sobrina. Carmen trata de no fallar a todas las reuniones programadas de su banco comunal, que fue uno de los motivos por los cuales ahora no fue con su esposo a la venta de sus productos. Este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha trabajado y pagado con responsabilidad sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra de hortalizas y para sus cultivos de flores, donde está a punto de reventar el capuyo.
texts.en:
Carmen is 41 years old. She has been married for 11 years and has a daughter. From a young age she has dedicated herself to farming as her parents were farmers. At that time they planted potatoes and peas. Ten years ago she ventured into growing vegetables at the ranch that she inherited from her parents. She also rents additional land to cultivate flowers. The sale of flowers is very profitable for her during the months of May and November but in the remaining months she dedicates herself more to her farming. Every 15 days or at the end of the month she sends her products to the markets. Depending on the prices, she will sell in her same area or will take her products to the city of Lima. This time, her sister and her husband took Carmen's products to the market in the area while Carmen took care of her niece. Carmen tries not to miss any of the meetings at her community bank which is one of the reasons why she could not go with her husband to the market to sell her products. This is Carmen's 11th loan with MFP and in all of this time she has been responsible and has worked and paid her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizer for her ranch and for her cultivation of flowers which are about to bloom.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Feliciana acaba D. cumplir 57 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, 6 D. ellos ya viven fuera, y una D. sus hijas y su nieta viven en su casa con ella. Más D. 40 años lleva en la labor agrícola, desD. entonces ha sembrado diversos productos como; papa, alverjas, maíz, hortalizas, y últimamente flores, el gladiolo.  Ahora no deja el cultivo D. este e último porque le ha resultado muy rentable desD. que hizo contactos con personas D. un mercado mayorista D. la capital, ya no espera los meses D. mayo y noviembre donD. tiene más demanda, sino que cada 15 días prepara los fardos D. flores que constan D. 12 docenas, a 20 soles, Feliciana lleva D. 20 a 25 paquetes por cada viaje, y una vez negociados, sus ganancias son muy buenas, acumulando a un monto D. 500 soles, incluido su capital D. trabajo. DesD. entonces siembra mayormente flores, sin abandonar sus otros cultivos, esperando que con el tiempo pueda comprarse un puesto en la cuidad. Feliciana es la tesorera D. su banco comunal, este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP y ha demostrados ser una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. fertilizantes, y para invertir en su negocio D. venta D. sus flores.
texts.en:
Feliciana just turned 57 years old. She is married and has 7 children. Six of her children live on their own and one of her daughters and her grandaughter live at home with her. She has been an agricultural laborer for more than 40 years. During this time she has grown various crops such as potatoes, peas, corn, vegetables and more currently Gladiolus flowers. She will continue to grow these flowers because it has been very profitable for her since she contracted with people in a wholesale market in the capital. She no longer has to wait for May and November when she has the most demand but rather every 15 days she prepares the bales of flowers which have 12 dozen and sell for 20 soles. Feliciana takes between 20 to 25 bales on each trip and, once negotiated, her earnings are very good. She accumulates an amount of 500 soles including her working capital. She has since mainly planted flowers without abandoning her other crops. She hopes that in time she will be able to purchase a stall in the city. Feliciana is the treasurer at her community bank. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she has been shown to be very punctual with her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizers and to invest in her business in the sale of flowers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Florista

texts.es: Florisa tiene 55 años, enviudó hace 25 años, tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales 3 viven en su casa y con una nieta. En vida, su esposo y ella trabajaban en la chacra con sus hijos, pero desD. que falleció su pareja ya no cultiva en grandes extensiones, sus hijos salieron del hogar y se quedó si apoyo para el cultivo. Entonces empezó a dedicarse además, a la venta D. comida los días sábados y domingos en el parque D. su pueblo, así como también en las diferentes festividades, como semana santa o los carnavales, el resto D. días venD. salchipapas (platillo a base D. papas y salchichas fritas) en la puerta D. su casa. Adicionalmente venD. ropa según la temporada, estos negocios le han permitido brindar una educación a todos sus hijos. Florisa está muy contenta con su labor, la dificultad es que ahora siente algunos malestares musculares que a veces dificultan su actividad, y eso le causa mucha pena; pero tiene el mismo entusiasmo D. seguir trabajando. Florisa es una D. la clientes fundadoras D. su banco comunal, en los ciclos anteriores ha pasado por varios cargos D. la junta directiva y los cumplió con mucha responsabilidad. Este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo no ha caído en mora. El dinero que solicita es para que restaure su máquina salchipapera, y otra cantidad para comprar abonos para los pequeños terrenos que tiene cultivados.
texts.en:
Florisa is 55 years old. She was widowed when she was 25 years old and has 7 seven children. Three of her children as well as one of her grandaughters live in her home. When her husband was living, he worked with her and her children at their ranch. Since her husband passed away, Florisa does not farm in large plots of land since her children left home and she was left without help for farming. At that time she started to also started selling food on Saturdays and Sundays at the park in her town. She also sells her food during the different holidays such as Easter and during festivals. The rest of the week she sells "salchipapas" (a dish maD. with potatoes and fried sausages) which she sells at the door of her home. In addition, she also sells clothing depending on the season. These businesses have allowed her to proviD. all of her children with a good education. Florisa is very happy with her work. The difficulty she is currently facing is that she has had some muscle pains that sometimes make her work difficult and cause her pain. However, she has the same enthusiasm to keep working. Florisa is one of the founding clients of her community bank. In past cycles, she has held various positions on the board and has met them responsibly. This is Florisa's 11th loan with MFP and in all of this time she has not been behind on her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to repair her machine that she uses to make salchipapas and to purchase fertilizers for the small plots of land that she farms.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair machine that she uses to make salchipapas

texts.es:
Esperanza es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Esperanza es casada, tiene 51 años y 5 hijos, Esperanza vende cereales, viaja a las Ferias donde vende verduras, frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los molinos. Además Esperanza tiene un kiosco donde vende cereales, verduras, carnes y papa.
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, quinua y cebada.
El sueño de Esperanza es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the community bank Guadalupe. She is 51 years old, is married and has 5 children. Esperanza sells grains. She travels to different festivals where she sells vegetables and fruits and at the festivals she buys grains that she then sells at mills. In addition, Esperanza has a stall where she sells grains, vegetables, meat and potatoes. Esperanza needs a loan in the amount of 2000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of corn, quinoa and barley. Esperanza's dream is to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Vedith

texts.es:
La señora Vedith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, vive en la Av. Perú Nº 120, Distrito de Morales, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada,  tiene 44 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 2 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inició con S/. 100.00, por iniciativa propia, empezó su negocio vendiendo mercadería de ropas, con un pequeño bazar ubicada en su misma casa. 

En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta de Pollos a la brasa, y por las mañanas vende menú; en un local muy bien acondicionado, su casa.

Con el préstamo de S/2,500.00 que cancelará a un plazo de 04  meses,  comprará  insumos como pollos vivos en javas, papas y tomates en sacos, mostazas, salsa de tomate y mayonesa en baldes para complementar el servicio de pollos a la braza; también bebidas refrescantes como gaseosas y aguas minerales en paquetes.

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y segura, ya que es ella quien toma sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera.

Vedith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vedith is a member of the "Sargento Lores" community bank. She lives at Avenue Perú Nº 120 in the Morales district of the San Martín department. Vedith is 44 years old and divorced. She has three children, two of whom depend on her economically. Vedith began with 100 soles, and on her own initiative she started a clothing sales business. She opened a small store in her own home. Now she sells braised chicken, and in the mornings she serves a full breakfast. Her restaurant is located in her home, which is well suited to cooking. With this loan of 2,500 soles, Vedith will buy supplies such as live chickens, sacs of potatoes and tomatoes, and buckets of mustard, ketchup, and mayonnaise. These will be used to complement the braised chicken meals that she serves. She'll also buy refreshing drinks, such as colas and mineral water. She'll repay the loan in four months. Vedith feels more independent and secure, now that she makes her own business decisions and earns her own income. Vedith would like to thank Manuela Ramos for helping her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies such as chickens, potatoes, tomatoes, condiments, and drinks

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is an entrepreneur from Kherson. She runs a business selling women’s outer wear in Dneprovskyi market. Antonina plans her business policies and strategy very thoroughly. She handles all the challenging situations with sheer optimism and enthusiasm. Antonina has been in this trade for the past five years. Presently, she has invested about 75,000 Grivnas in her business. Her monthly income is about 9,000 Grivnas.
 
Antonina has always strived to be helpful and friendly to all those around her. Today, Antonina is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnas to increase the assorted merchandise in her kiosk. We believe Antonina’s perseverance and careful planning will help her repay the current loan and make her more confident and knowledgeable about her business, going ahead.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of her inventory

texts.es: Gloria cuenta con 40 años de edad, lleva conviviendo, por más de 20 años, con el padre de sus 7 hijos, dos de ellos fallecieron, ahora viven con los cinco restantes. Ambos son agricultores, durante su tiempo juntos han sembrado papa en terrenos temporales, en los meses de invierno inician a preparar la tierra con el arado, lo que les cuesta un aproximado de 100 soles por cada chacra. Luego de la siembra, todos los sábados se dedica a la compra y venta carnes rojas y el resto de los días a la artesanía. Gloria es la encargada de hilar la lana de cordero, de acuerdo a los grosores que requiera a lo que vaya a tejer su esposo, sea manta o frazada. En su telar vienen trabajando por más de 17 años, a esta labor le prestan mayor atención mientras sus cultivos están en proceso de desarrollo, pero en las épocas de cosecha su labor es la selección de la papa, y la comercialización, que es el momento que más le agrada porque acumula sus ingresos económicos que le permiten cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Gloria está muy feliz con el trabajo de su banco comunal, este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y viene pagando puntualmente sus cuotas en las fechas programadas por su asesor. El dinero que solicita lo derivará en la compra de lana de carnero, así como en fertilizantes para el abonado de sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and father of her seven children. Two of her children passed away and she lives with her five remaining children. Both Gloria and her husband are farmers and during their time together they have grown potatoes in temporary land. During the winter months they begin preparing the soil by plowing which costs them about 100 soles for each ranch. After sowing, she buys and sells red meats every Saturday. The rest of the week she makes crafts. Gloria is in charge of spinning sheep wool depending on the thickness required by what her husband will weave, bet it a blanket or a shawl. Gloria and her husband have been working on their loom for more than 17 years. They pay more attention to this work while their crops are developing but during times of harvest their work is in the selection and sale of their potatoes. This is the time she likes best because she accumulates the income that allows her to cover the costs of educationg her children. Gloria is very happy with the work of her community bank. This is her second loan with MFP and she has been punctual in making her payments on the dates scheduled by her advisor. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase sheep wool as well as fertilizers for her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Marleny es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Marleny es Obstetriz, tiene un Consultorio Obstétrico en un local alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con una enferma , además Marleny vende materiales ortopédicos y cosméticos por catálogos.
Marleny necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos, materiales e instrumentos.
El sueño de Marleny es mejorar su negocio y tener una clínica propia.
texts.en:
Marleny is single, she is 26 years and has a son. Marleny is an obstretician and has an obstetrics clinic in a rented space. She employs a nurse and also sells orthopedic materials and cosmetics through catalogs. Marleny needs a loan in the amount of 2000 soles. The money will be invested in the purchase of medicines, materials and tools. Marleny's dream is to improve her business and have her own clinic.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicines, materials and tools.

loans.name: Filda

texts.es:
La señora Filda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Perlitas”, vive en la Jr. Daniel Alcides Carrión Nº 245, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 30 años y es madre de 2 hijos, que todavía depende de ella.

Se inició con S/. 300.00, motivada por su pareja; emprendiendo su negocio de Servicio Electrónico, ubicada en una parte céntrica de la ciudad; donde se dedica al arreglo de televisores, radios, dvs y parlantes.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un local ubicado en su misma casa; donde atiende a su clientela. 

Con el préstamo de S/2,500.00 que cancelará a un plazo de 06  meses, comprará artefactos de segunda mano, como televisores, radios, DVD, computadoras para próximamente ser vendidos a un precio diferente.

Se siente mejor ahora, que en sus inicios, más segura al ofrecer sus servicios y al mismo tiempo mas constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Filda, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Filda is a member of the "Las Perlitas" Community Bank. She lives at Jr. Daniel Alcides Carrión Nº 245, in the Tarapoto district of the San Martín department. She's 30 years old and single. Filda is the mother of two children, who still depend on her economically. Filda began with 300 soles, and support from her partner. She started a maintenance shop for electronics, located in the center of the city. There she repaired televisions, radios, DVD players, and speakers. She continues to run the business, but it is now based out of her own home. With this loan of 2,500 soles, Filda will buy second-hand electronics, such as televisions, radios, DVD players, and computers. She'll repair and re-sell these in her shop. Filda will repay the loan in six months. Filda feels better now than when she first began the business. She's more confident in the services that she offers her clients, and is also more consistent and responsible in repaying her loans. Filda would like to thank Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy second-hand electronics such as televisions, DVD players, and computers.

texts.es: Haydee cuenta con 33 años de edad, está felizmente casada y es madre de dos hijos que viven en su casa. Los padres de Haydee toda su vida se dedicaron a diversos cultivos, tanto de papa, arveja, y demás hortalizas; y en los primeros años de su matrimonio continuaba con estas labores, pero ha ella no le gustaba mucho la agricultura, por lo que cuando nació su hija, hace 5 años, motivó a su esposo para abrir una bodega, entonces él se hizo cargo de los cultivos, y ella al cuidado de sus hijos y a atender su tienda. Desde esa época le presta todo su tiempo y dedicación a su bodega, que al transcurrir los años ha ido captando clientela, y esto la motiva a seguir invirtiendo y trabajando en ella. Haydee está muy contenta con su negocio, ya que cuando la cosecha falla, o el precio del mercado no es tan bueno; su bodega es quien cubre los gastos básicos de la familia. Haydee es la presidenta de su banco comunal, es la encargada de convocar a las reuniones a los demás integrantes en casos de sesiones extraordinarias y estar pendiente del buen desenvolvimiento del grupo. Este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad en los pagos. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar la mercadería de su bodega, para de ese modo captar más clientes que le permitan acumular ganancias para la mejora de su economía.
texts.en:
Haydee is 33 years old and happily married. She has two children who live at home. Haydee's parents have always been farmers, raising potatoes, peas, and other crops. In the early years of her marriage Haydee continued raising these crops, but she doesn't particularly enjoy farming. When her daughter was born five years ago, Haydee convinced her husband to open a bodega. He did, agreeing to take charge of the crops while Haydee cares for the children and tends to the store. Since that time, Haydee has spent all of her time and effort on the store, which has grown a client base over the years. This motivates Haydee to continue investing and working on it. She is very happy with her business, because now when the crop fails or market prices are down her store is able to cover the family's basic expenses. Haydee is president of her community bank, in charge of organizing member meetings in extreme cases and staying in tune with the involvement of the group. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she has always demonstrated responsibility in her repayments. The money that she's asking for will go toward increasing the merchandise in her store so that she can capture more clients and earn more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Nievesa es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Nievesa es casada, tiene 68 años y 4 hijos, Nievesa tiene un puesto en el mercado Nazareno donD. venD. especerías y condimentos, que son usados en la preparación D. las comidas, Nievesa junto a su esposo preparan los condimentos en su casa.
Nievesa necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ajo, aji, etc.
El sueño D. Nievesa es mejorar y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Nievesa is a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank.

Nievesa is 68-years-old, married and has 4 children. Nievesa runs a stand at the Nazareno market where she sells herbs and spices used in food preparation. Nievesa prepares the seasonings at home, together with her husband.

Nievesa is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of garlic, chili, etc. Nievesa hopes to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

Irina is married with a son. She runs a small business selling clothing for women. Her kiosk is located in one of the busiest city markets of Kherson. A beautiful array of assorted clothes attracts many customers to Irina’s kiosk. Irina has been in this business for 10 years. She has currently invested 60,000 Grivnas in merchandise. 

Irina is a hard worker and a talented manager. She has had a perfect credit history in “Nadiya Ukraine” without any defaults. She has repaid 12 previous loans without any delinquencies. Moreover, Irina is very devoted to the success of her business, and we believe she will be able to service the loan without a problem. Irina needs the loan of 9,000 Grivnas to improve her business by stocking more clothing items. The loan will help her expand her business and clientele. Moreover, this financial contribution would have a positive impact not only on her trade profitability but would also improve the economic and social situation of her family.

texts.es: Jesús cuenta con 28 años, junto a su pareja tienen 2 hijos, actualmente viven en una casa alquilada. Años atrás trabajaba como peón arando las chacras, le pagaban a diario entre 50 y 80 soles, dependiendo de la extensión. Desde que formó su propia familia, empujado por la necesidad empezó a sembrar papa, arveja y maíz en chacras alquiladas, lo cual le ha resultado rentable, además de su trabajo como peón, estos ingresos económicos le han permitido mejorar su economía. En su afán de mejorar su calidad de vida, meses atrás cosechó gran cantidad de maíz, lo que lo motivó a abrirse mercado en la capital. Desde entonces, envía a Lima 3500 kilos de choclo en cada carga. Esto le incentiva a seguir sembrando y a invertir más en este producto, por lo que se siente muy feliz de haber emprendido este negocio. Pese a sus labores agrícolas Jesús acudir a todas sus reuniones en su banco comunal, solo en caso de viaje deja encargada a su esposa para que realice el pago, porque no le gusta caer en morosidad. Este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP del cual se siente orgulloso de pertenecer a su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de abonos sintéticos, asimismo para la compra de maíz que le sirva de semilla para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Jesús is 28 years old and he and his wife have two children. They rent their home. Years ago, Jesús used to work as a day laborer, plowing the fields. He earned between 50 and 80 soles per day, depending on the work. Ever since he started a family, Jesús began to plant potatoes, peas, and corn on rented farmland. He's found this work to be profitable, more so than his work as a day laborer. This income has allowed him to improve his personal finances. In his eagerness to improve his quality of life, Jesús planted a large quantity of corn a few months ago. This has motivated him to do business in the Capital. Ever since then, he's sent 3500 kilos of corn with each load. This has given him an incentive to keep planting and to invest more in this crop, because he is happy to have started this business. In spite of his hard work on the farm, Jesús attends all of the community bank meetings, and when he's away he leaves his wife in charge of repayments because he doesn't like to fall behind. This is his 11th loan with MFP, and he feels proud to be part of the community bank. He'll use the money to buy synthetic fertilizers, as well as corn to seed the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Gloria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la Jr. Independencia Nº 406, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 41 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 2 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inició con S/. 300.00, motivada por su pareja; emprendiendo su negocio de servicio de Renovadora de Calzados, ubicada en una parte céntrica de la ciudad; donde se dedica al arreglo y mejoramiento de zapatos.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un puesto alquilado, donde atiende a diario a su clientela.
Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelará a un plazo de 06  meses, invertirá en la  compra de plantillas y suelas para zapatos; una máquina de coser de segunda mano; hilos, agujas y tiras  de diferentes tamaños y modelos.

Se siente mejor ahora, que en sus inicios, mas segura al ofrecer sus servicios y al mismo tiempo mas constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Ana Gloria, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Gloria is a member of the Las Orquídeas community bank. She lives at Jr. Independencia Nº 406 in the Tarapoto district of the San Martin department. She is 41 and lives with her husband and two children. With 300 soles and encouragement from her partner, Ana Gloria started a shoe repair business in the center of the city. She works there, repairing and refurbishing shoes. She still runs the business and works out of a rented building, where she tends to her clients daily. With a loan of 2,000 soles Ana Gloria will invest in insoles and soles for shoes, plus a second-hand sewing machine and thread, needles, and scissors. She'll repay the loan in six months. Ana Gloria feels better now than when she first started the business. She's more confident when she offers her services and also more reliable and responsible in her repayments. Ana Gloria would like to thank Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soles and insoles for shoes. Buy a second-hand sewing machine, thread, needles, and scissors of various sizes and models.

texts.es: Robert tiene 43 años, es conviviente y padre de dos hijos que viven en su casa. La agricultura es la actividad que económica que heredó de sus padres, ellos sembraban, alverjas y hortalizas de acuerdo a la temporada del año, de eso dependía la cosecha, le enseñaron. Bajo esos conceptos empezó a sembrar pero no le funcionó, intentó con la floricultura, pero también fracaso. Sin embargo, hace cuatro años un amigo le propuso sembrar manzanilla en sus chacras; desde entonces este producto le resultó muy rentable, por no tener competidores. Las cosechas de su manzanilla son cada tres meses, en abril, julio y noviembre; para ello invierte mucho en la mano de obra, para trasplantar, sacar las hierbas, abonar y fumigar, por cada uno de estos trabajos le cobran entre 200 y 300 soles En esta última siembra a invertido 1500 soles con miras de ganar hasta 5 veces más, por lo que tiene que abonar y cultivar con mucho esmero, para hacer realidad sus sueños. Robert es un cliente nuevo que ingresa a un banco ya formado, es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que tiene muchas expectativas de desarrollo, asimismo hace compromisos de pagar sus cuotas en las fechas indicadas. El dinero que solicita, es para la compra de fertilizantes, que le permitan abonar su cultivo de manzanilla para que logre cosechar y obtener las ganancias de acuerdo lo que se propuso.
texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He inherited his farm from his parents, who planted peas and vegetables according to the season. The crop depends on the seasons, and his parents taught Robert how to plant accordingly. With these concepts in mind Robert began to plant, but his crop didn't do well. He tried planting flowers, but this also failed. Nevertheless, four years ago a friend proposed that Robert plant chamomile in his fields, and this crop has been profitable, because there is no competition. Robert harvests the chamomile every three months, in April, July, and November. This means that he must invest a lot of money in labor, in order to transplant,harvest, fertilize, and fumigate. Each of these jobs costs between 200 and 300 soles. Robert invested 1500 soles in this last harvest, hoping to earn five times as much. In order to realize his dreams he has to go to a lot of trouble to fertilize and cultivate large quantities of chamomile. He's now asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, which will help improve his crop and earn the projected amount of profits.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Juana  es casada, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Juana es Técnica de Enfermería y trabaja en el Hospital, también tiene un kiosco cerca al mercado Magdalena, donde todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos vende comida y bebidas. También en Semana Santa vende comida.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y bebidas.
El sueño de Juana es mejorar y surtir su kiosco.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Banco Comunal Guadalupe. Juana is married, 54 years old, and has three children. She works as a nurse technicion at the hospital. She also has a kiosk near the Magdalena market, where she sells food and drinks every day with the help of her children. She also sells food during Holy Week. Juana needs a loan for 1,000 soles. She will use the money to purchase sweets and drinks. Juana's dream is to improve and stock her kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr:
H. Jean est née en 1982 à Adjarra,département l'Ouémé; Jean réside dans cette même commune d’Adjarra. Jean est père de deux (02) enfants dont un scolarisé. La sauce de la viande de porc localement appelée « Han kpètè » est la sauce la plus consommée par les habitants de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Jean s’est donc lancé dans la préparation et la vente de cette sauce de porc. Jean a hérité cette activité de sauce de porc de son père. La clientèle de Jean s’accroît au jour le jour; mais il n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont dispose Jean sont faibles. Jean sollicite donc un crédit pour renforcer son activité.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
H. Jean was born in 1982 in Adjarra, Ouémé County. He resides in this same community of Adjarra and is the father of two children, one of whom is in school. The sauce made from pork locally called «Han kpètè» is the sauce most consumed by the people in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. And so he got started in making and selling this pork sauce. It is a business passed down from his father. Jean’s customers are growing from day to day, but he isn’t able to satisfy them because of the meager financial means he has. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to bolster his business.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Felicitas Yanira

texts.es:
Yanira es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Yanira es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Yanira trae ropa a pedido, sus ventas son al crédito, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además junto a su mama tienen un kiosco donde ambas venden comida.
Yanira necesita un préstamo de 1000 S., dinero que será invertido en la compra de uniformes escolares.
El sueño de Yanira es tener un negocio estable y sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Yanira is a member of the Guadelupe Communal Bank. Yanira is 28 years old and single with one son. She carries clothing to order which she acquires in the city of Lima and sells on credit. In addition, together with her mother, they have a kiosk where they both sell meals. Yanira needs a loan of 1000 Sols which will be invested in the purchase of school uniforms. Her dream is to have a stable business and to bring up her son.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of school uniforms

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Orquídeas”, vive en el Jr. Huascar - Colegio Tarapoto,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos independientes. 

Se inició, con S/. 50.00 y fue por iniciativa propia decidió emprender su negocio y empezó vendiendo refrigerios en un Colegio. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un Kiosco especialmente  acondicionado, dentro del Colegio; donde vende comidas preparadas como juanes, tamalitos, arroz  chaufa,  arroz con pollo; dulces y golosinas; chifles, canchitas y en bebidas gaseosas, refrescos y jugos. 

Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará en un  plazo de 06  meses, comprará productos como arroz y azúcar en sacos; aceites en galones y gaseosas en paquetes; para la prepación de sus alimentos diarios. Sus principales clientes son los alumnos, docentes y administrativos.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que ahora es muy independiente, seguro y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Juana, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to "Orchids" community bank. She lives in Jr. Huascar in the Tarapoto district in the department of San Martín, Peru. She's a 44-year-old married mother of three, all grown up and independent. She started with 50 soles and on her own initiative decided to start her business and began selling snacks at a local school. Currently she continues doing the same job and now has a specially arranged kiosk inside the school where she sells prepared food such as tamales, different rice dishes, candy and other snacks, fried bananas, popcorn, along with soft drinks, juices and other beverages. With the loan of 3,000 soles, which she plans to repay in six months, she will purchase products such as sacks of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, and packages of soft drinks for her daily food preparation. Her main customers are the students, teachers and administrators at the school, and she makes the decisions of what to do with the earnings. Personally, she tells us that now she is very independent, secure and responsible with her payments. Juana gives her thanks to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and a person.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as sacks of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, and packages of soft drinks for her daily food preparation

texts.es: Teodolinda tiene 38 años, es casada hace 19 años y madre de un hijo que vive en su casa. El labrar la tierra y el cuidado de  sus cultivos son las vivencias diarias, esta actividad la realiza desde su infancia; ahora cultiva papas, alverjas, y últimamente está empezando con la floricultura con el apoyo de su esposo, debido a que notó que sus vecinos en este negocio les va muy bien. Por ello desde hace 3 años, para la siembra de flores, alquila chacras donde hayan sido cultivadas papas anteriormente, para aprovechar el abonado, y solo se preocupa del fumigado. De ese modo reduce costos de inversión y trata de acumular ganancias para sus otros productos con miras de progresar y convertirse en una agricultora de éxito. Es por ello que no se le puede ubicar fácilmente en su casa, por ser una mujer dinámica y emprendedora, siempre está en actividad. Teodolinda quiere comprar un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, para que ella misma venda sus productos y gane mucho más que ahora. Teodolinda es secretaria de su banco comunal desde hace varios ciclos consecutivos, asimismo  apoya a su compañera tesorera en el cobro de las cuotas. Este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de arvejas para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola.
texts.en:
Teodolinda is 38 and has been married for 19 years. She has one son who lives in her home. Every day she works the land and takes care of her crops. She has done this work since her childhood. She grows potatoes, peas, and lately she has started growing flowers with the help of her husband since she noticed that her neighbors are doing well in this business. For 3 years, she has grown flowers. She rents plots of land where she had grown potatoes previously to take advantage of the fertile soil, and she only has to worry about fumigating. In this way, she reduces her investment costs and tries to save her proftis so she can make progress with her other porducts and be a successful farmer. She can't sit easily at home because she is a dynamic and enterprising woman and is always active. Teolinda wants to buy a stand in the market in the city so she can sell her products herself and gain a lot more than she does now. Teolinda has been the secretary of her communal bank for several consecutive cycles. She supports the treasurer in collecting their payments. This is her eleventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and in all this time she has demonstrated responsibility with her payments. The money she is requesting will go towards fertilizers and pea seeds to sow this season.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zuli Maribel

texts.es:
Zuli es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Zuli es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Zuli es Técnica en Enfermería y trabaja en el hospital, también vende salchipollo todas las tardes de manera ambulatoria cerca al mercado de la Magdalena, y en Semana Santa vende comida.
Zuli necesita un préstamo de 1000 S., dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, aceite y mayonesa.
El sueño de Zuli es mejorar su negocio, tener un local propio, mejorar su casa y sacar profesional a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zuli is a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank. She is married, is 32 years old and has 2 children. Zuli is a licensed vocational nurse who works in a hospital. She also peddles salchipollo (fried chicken and french fries) every afternoon near the Magdalena market and during Easter week she sells meals. Zuli needs a loan of 1000 S., money she will invest in the purchase of potatos, oil and mayonnaise. Zuli’s dream is to improve her business, to have a proper location for food sales, to improve her house and to get professional for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, oil and mayonnaise for food sales

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth, dyes, and related supplies and equipment

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La señora Ludith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la Jr. Tupac Amaru Nº 177, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 2 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inició con S/.300.00 por iniciativa propia, empezó su negocio con la confección y venta de  ropas interiores, para damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, confeccionando a pedido de sus clientes,  también cuenta con prendas en stock, para mostrar a su clientela, tiene una maquina que es su herramienta principal de trabajo.

Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06  meses, lo invirtirá comprando telas en metros, hilos, elásticos, adornos en cantidad de variados colores y tener una mayor producción de lencería para damas. 

Se siente mejor ahora, que en sus inicios, mas segura al ofrecer sus productos y al mismo tiempo mas constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Ludith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ludith belongs to "The Orchids" community bank and lives in Jr. Tupac Amaru in the district of Tarapoto in San Martín, Peru. She is a 42-year-old married mother of three, two of whom all still under her care. She started with 300 soles and on her own initiative started a business sewing and selling undergarments for men, women and children. She has been working with the community bank for five years. Currently, she continues with the same business, making items on orders from her customers, and also has dresses in stock to show her clientele. She has a sewing machine, which is her main working tool. With the loan of 3,000 soles, which she plans to repay within six months, she will invest in the purchase of fabric by the meter, thread, elastic and ornaments in a variety of colors and increase her production of women's lingerie. She says she feels better now than when she started and more secure in the products she offers, as well as more constant and responsible with her payments. Ludith gives her thanks to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and a person.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric by the meter, thread, elastic and ornaments in a variety of colors

texts.en:
Ludmila is an entrepreneur from Vinogradovo. She sells women’s clothing and lingerie in the central market. Her small vending place is located right in the center of the marketplace. It’s always stocked with good quality inventory and comes in a variety of colors and trends. Ludmila has been in this trade for 4 years.

She credits much of her success to the additional financial assistance she has received. Presently, Ludmila has about 13,000 Hryvni in gross income. Funds invested in inventory – 30,000 Hryvni. Her monthly income is about 4,000 Hryvni.

Ludmila has requested a loan of $875 (7,000 Ukrainian Hryvni) to open one more vending location and add to her working business capital. She hopes to increase her sales and resulting profits.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Marilu, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas”, vive en la Jr. España Nº 1349, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años y es madre de 3 hijos, que todavía depende de ella.

Se inició con S/. 10,000.00, motivada por su pareja; emprendiendo su negocio de la Venta de Repuestos de motos, ubicada en una parte céntrica de la ciudad; donde se vende a su clientela.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un local, ubicado en una parte céntrica de la ciudad, donde atiende a su clientela. 
Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelará a un plazo de 06  meses, invertirá comprando sistemas de arrastres, lubricantes, aceites, retenes y bujías, parte del dinero lo utilizara también para ampliar su negocio y mas adelante implementar su taller de motos.

Hoy se siente segura al ofrecer sus productos y al mismo tiempo más constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Marilu, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Marilu belongs to the "Dedicated Women" Community Bank. She lives in the district of Tarapoto, department of San Martín, Peru. She is a 32-year-old mother of three (all of whom are still dependent on her) and lives with her partner. She started with 10,000 soles and, motivated by her partner, set up her business selling spare parts for motorcycles in a central part of the city. Currently, she continues the work and has a store to tend to her clientele. With the loan of 2,000 soles, which she plans to repay in six months, she will invest in the purchase of system of trailer attachments, lubricants, oils, bearings and spark plugs. Part of the money will also be used to expand the business and later establish a repair shop. Today she feels secure in offering products and at the same time more constant and responsible with her payments. Marilu gives her thanks to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and a person.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of system of trailer attachments, lubricants, oils, bearings and spark plugs

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
http://sem-fund.org/carabane.php

Nous sommes de l'écovillage de Carabane qui est une zone très enclavée du delta du Fleuve Casamance. Notre écovillage est très pauvre à cause du conflit qui a reigné pendant longtemps dans cette partie du pays et- aussi par le fait du naufrage de bateau qui assurait la liaison avec le continant. Depuis cette date, nous vivons dans la pau vreté absolue, en essayant de nous en sortir avec le peu de moyens dont nous disposons. Nous sommes donc venues solliciter un prêt auprès de Kiva pour pouvoir commercialiser des produits halieutiques, des céréales et des fruits et légumes qui sont produits ici et que nous pourrons acheter auprès des agriculteurs et revendre dans les grandes villes. Les produits halieutiques et forestiers que sont produits dans les îles sont très recherchés dans le continent. La vente de ces produits en villes nous permettra de pouvoir acheter des céréales et divers articles domestiques que nous pourrons revendre chez nous et dans les îles environnantes.
texts.en:
http://sem-fund.org/carabane.php

We are from the eco-village of Carabane which is in a very isolated area of the Casamance River delta. Our eco-village is very poor because of the conflict that reigned for a long time in this part of the country and also because of the wrecked ship, which used to ensure the link with the continent. Since then, we have lived in absolute poverty while trying to lift ourselves out of it with the few means we have. We have therefore come to request a loan from Kiva to be able to market seafood products, grain, and fruit and vegetables that are produced here and that we’ll be able to buy from growers for resale in the big cities. The seafood and woodland goods that are produced on the islands are highly sought after on the continent. The sale of these goods in cities will enable us to buy grain and various home items that we’ll be able to resell in our area and on surrounding islands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables and grain

texts.fr:
Jeune femme active et dynamique, B.  Lucie est née le 14 janvier 1978 à Houédakomè dans le 1er Arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Lucie est mariée et elle a deux (2) enfants tous scolarisés. Lucie prépare et vend du riz et du haricot, localement appelé « atassi ». Mais Lucie ne dispose pas d'assez de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner à temps et pour répondre efficacement à la forte demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Lucie exprime un besoin de prêt pour renforcer son activité et constituer son propre capital.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
An active and energetic young woman, B. Lucie was born on January 14, 1978 in Houédakomè, in the 1st district of the city of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. She is married and has two children who are both in school. Lucie makes and sells rice and beans, locally called "atassi". But she lacks sufficient financial means for acquiring supplies on time and for responding effectively to the strong demand from her customers. This is why she's expressing a need for a loan, so as to bolster her business and to build up her own capital.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Agée de 39 ans, Mme Akossiwa H. est mariée et compte (07) personnes à charge. Elle réalise comme activité la fabrication de la farine de manioc. En effet, elle achète du manioc dans les fermes chez les paysans et le transforme en farine de manioc. 
Afin de satisfaire la demande du marché, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter en quantité suffisante un grand champ de manioc.
texts.en:
Ms. Akossiwa H., age 39, is married and has seven people to support. Her work involves producing cassava flour. In essence, she buys cassava on farms from rural suppliers and processes it into cassava flour. To satisfy the market demand, she's requesting financing to buy a large enough cassava field.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicks, goats, and pigs for his farm

loans.name: Wobuibé

texts.fr: Mme Wobuibé E. est née le 31 Décembre 1975 à Atakpamé. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de sachets et sacs en plastique, activité qui lui permet de faire face aux charges de sa famille. Toutefois elle ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour mener à bien son activité commerciale. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de donner un nouvel élan à sa vie sur le plan économique et social.
texts.en:
Ms. Wobuibé E. was born on December 31, 1975 in Atakpamé. She is married and the mother of three. She sells plastic packets and bags that is a business enabling her to cope with family expenses. However, she lacks sufficient financial means for carrying out her commerce. She's therefore requesting financing to supply herself with merchandise to provide a boost to the economic and societal aspects of her life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell plastic packets and bags

loans.name: Tikarisun De Ccachin Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco “TIKARISUN DE CCACHIN”;  son un grupo conformado por 12 miembros, este nombre significa “FLORECEREMOS”, Está comunidad campesina se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Lares de la provincia de calca del departamento del Cusco a 3 700 m.s.n.m. Los campesinos caminan diariamente 4 horas para llegar al distrito de Lares, dónde realizan sus compras en los mercados y dónde ellos también llevan sus productos para vender.

Esta comunidad es muy linda y muy típica, es una de las comunidades que aún mantienen su herencia Inca. y mantienen sus trajes típicos y sus costumbres ancestrales, su estilo de vida y sus danzas folklóricas vivas, nuestros nuevos socios, son gente muy humilde, pero llena de mucho coraje y muy cariñosa, ellos trabajan la tierra, producen diferentes variedades de papas, y variedades de maíz, (blanco, amarillo, y el maíz de muchos colores); pero sobre todo ellos son los mejores tejedores de la zona del valle de Cusco, tiene una técnica muy peculiar y elaboran chalinas, mantas, mantillas, pasillos, ponchos, gorros, y trabajos muy bellos con diseños de la naturaleza, todo eso realizados a mano y con teñidos naturales; todo lo que ellos saben lo aprendieron de sus antepasados y esto fue viajando de generación en generación; aquí podría fácilmente realizarse el turismo vivencia participativo, por que ellos son gente muy amable y desean seguir cultivando su pasado vivo.

Estos socios invertirán su préstamo en comprar semillas,  para sus nuevos cultivos, comprarán algunos ganados vacunos y lanas de alpacas y ovejas para que sus esposas sigan realizando sus tejidos; ellos también desean construir algunos cuartos para poder recibir a sus visitantes y darles hospedaje en sus casas.

Los socios están muy agradecidos con el préstamo otorgado, para estos socios esta experiencia es nueva, ya que nunca antes tuvieron la oportunidad de trabajar con créditos, ellos están ansiosos por invertir sus dineros y ver sus resultados, así mismo ellos los invitan a todos ustedes a la comunidad campesina de Ccachin en Cusco. Valorando el préstamo se comprometen a cumplir con las fechas de pagos programados.
texts.en:
There are 12 members of the "Tikarisun De Ccachin" community bank, which means "We will flourish." This country community is located in the district of Lares, in the department of Cusco, Peru. The peasants walk four hours daily to arrive in Lares, where they make their purchases at the markets and also take their products to sell.

This group is very pretty and typical of the region, and they still maintain their Incan ancestry in their traditional dresses and customs, their lifestyles and folkloric live dances. The members are very humble, but they are filled with courage and tenderness. They work on the land, producing different varieties of potatoes and maize (white, yellow, multicolored). But most of all they are the best weavers in the Cusco valley. They have a very distinct technique and make scarfs, blankets, lace, ponchos, caps and beautiful works depicting nature. All of this is done by hand and with natural dyes. All of what they know they learned from their ancestors, and this knowledge is passed on from generation to generation. It also allows them to participate in the tourism industry, and they are very friendly people who want to share and keep their traditions alive.

With the loan, the members will purchase seeds for their new crops, some heads of cattle for livestock, and alpaca and sheep fleece so their wives can continue weaving. They also want to build some rooms so they will be able to receive visitors and provide accommodations.

The members are very grateful for the granted loan. For them this is a new experience, since previously none of them have had to the opportunity to work with credit. They are anxious to invest the money and see the results. They themselves invite all of you to the country community of Ccachin. They value the loan and promise to fulfill the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: urchase seeds for their new crops, some heads of cattle for livestock, and alpaca and sheep fleece; and build accomodations

texts.fr: Née le 26 Mars 1973 à Tsévié dans le Zio, Mme Catherine A. est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Son activité principale est la culture et la vente de piments très utilisés dans l’art culinaire au Togo. Elle pratique cette culture depuis plus de sept (07) ans avec beaucoup de succès.  Afin d’agrandir sa surface cultivable et acheter des engrais, elle sollicite un crédit. Cela lui permettra d’obtenir de meilleurs rendements, d’augmenter ses recettes et améliorer les conditions de vie sa famille.
