texts.en:
Born on March 26, 1973 in Tsévié, in Zio prefecture, Ms. Catherine A. is married and the mother of six. Her main work involves growing and selling chili peppers, which are used a lot in the culinary arts of Togo. She has been in this business very successfully for over seven years. To extend her arable lands and to buy fertilizer, she's requesting a loan. This will allow her to obtain better yields, to increase her receipts, and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Lolo

texts.fr: Née le 31 Décembre 1957 à Vogan, Mme Lolo D. est une veuve avec cinq (05) enfants à charge. Malgré son age, elle a toujours travaillé pour la survie de sa famille grâce à son petit commerce de vente de beignets. Afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et tirer beaucoup plus de profits de son activité, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker les matières premières notamment la farine de blé, du sucre et de l’huile. Les bénéfices tirés de ce commerce serviront à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1957 in Vogan, Mrs. Lolo D. is a widow raising 5 children. Despite her age, she has always worked to support her family, thanks to her little business selling fried dough. So as to increase her turnover and gain more profit from her business, she is requesting a loan to stock up on ingredients, notably wheat flour, sugar and oil. The profit from this business serves to educate her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing wheat flour, sugar and oil

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
K. Marie est née vers 1966  à Guévié Zoukomè dans le 1er Arrondissement de la ville de Porto- Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Marie est Mariée et a un (1) enfant. Marie est une vendeuse de divers (tomates en boite,sardine,mousquito,etc.); mais faute de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner à temps, Marie n'arrive pas à bien satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Pour renforcer son activité Marie sollicite un prêt.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Marie K. was born around 1966 in Guévié Zoukomè in the First District of the city of Porto-Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin. Marie is married and has one child. She is a petty trader selling various items (tinned tomatoes, sardines, mosquito coils, etc.) but since she lacks sufficient capital, she is not able to restock her stall in a timely manner and thus does not manage to satisfy the needs of her clientele. To bolster her little business, she is asking for a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing tinned tomatoes, sardines, milk, pasta, mosquito coils,etc.  for re-sale

texts.es:
La señora Carla F. Montaño se dedica a la costura de chamarras, chalecos, mandiles, guardapolvos, etc. Tiene un bebe pequeño y trabaja junto a su esposo.
Es una pareja Joven que con mucho sacrificio logro equipar su taller, no trabaja con otra institución financiera, solo con Emprender.
A futuro piensan en crecer como microempresa y contar con más máquinas y atender a mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carla F. Montaño works making jackets, sweaters, aprons, overalls, etc. She has a young baby and works alongside her husband. This young partner has sacrificed a lot to outfit her workshop and doesn’t work with other finance institutions, only Kiva partner Emprender. In the future, they plan on growing as a small business and having more machines to attend to more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of basins and kitchen utensils for re-sale

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Saliou H. est un vieux qui habite au quartier Ndayane de Diourbel.  Il a une petite boutique de denrées alimentaires dans son quartier.  Ce prêt lui permet de renforcer ses marchandises dont les revenues lui permettent de nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Saliou H. is an older gentleman who lives in the Ndayane district of Diourbel. He has a little grocery store in his neighborhood. This loan will allow him to purchase more merchandise and the income from his sales permit him to feed his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise for his little shop

loans.name: Comfort

texts.fr: Mme Comfort D. est née le 04 Janvier 1960 à Agbétiko dans le Bas Mono au sud du Togo. Veuve depuis quelques années, elle est seule à s’occuper de ses sept (07) enfants grâce à la vente des boules d’Akassa appelées  «Akpan». C’est une pâte à base de mais très appréciée. Actuellement Mme D. est confrontée à une mévente qui ralenti son chiffre d’affaires. Elle sollicite un financement pour rentabiliser son commerce par le stockage du mais et la construction d’un hangar sous lequel elle va vendre. Les profits tirés de son commerce lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Comfort D. was born on January 4, 1960 in Agbétiko, Bas Mono, in the south of Togo. A widow for some years now, she is raising her 7 children alone, supporting the family thanks to the sale of "akassa" balls called "Akpan". They are made of maize porridge and are much appreciated in her area. Presently, Mrs. D. is plagued by a lack of raw materials that is causing her sales to drop. She is requesting a loan to make her little business viable by stocking up on maize and building a shed that she can sell out of. The profit from her business allows her to improve her family's living conditions and ensure that her children will be educated.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking up on maize and building a shed

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: MmeMme Akoélé D. est née le 31 Décembre 1970 à Dalavé. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, son principale activité se limite à la production et la vente de la farine de manioc et la culture du mais. Elle réalise ses activités pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mais son niveau de de production ne lui permet pas de réaliser un rendement meilleur afin de lui permettre de couvrir toutes les charges afférentes à l’éducation de ses enfants et  surtout les filles en age de scolarisation. Au regard de ce qui précède, elle souhaite avoir un financement lui permettant d’acheter du manioc à grande échelle, conséquence d’une production importante afin d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akoélé D. was born on December 31, 1970 in Dalavé. Married and the mother of three children, her principal money-earning activity is limited to the production and sale of manioc flour and growing corn. She works at these businesses to support her family. However, her production level does not allow her to earn enough to cover all the different needs of her family in regard to the education of her children, and above all the girls of school age. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy bulk quantities of manioc, so as to produce manioc flour in larger quantity and be able to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: production and sale of manioc flour and growing corn

loans.name: Patricia Leonela

texts.es:
La Sra. O. es comerciante hace 6 años, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad y esta en el kinder que esta ubicado en la colonia Morazan, a el le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus compañeritos de la escuela, es un niño muy dinamico.
La Sra O. vende su producto los dias viernes, sabado y domingos, ya que ella tiene un trabajo en una farmacia pero no le ajusta para el sustento del hogar, por eso ella empezo con este negocio y asi logra cubrir todos sus gastos, pero ella necesita mas mercaderia para tener mejores ventas y asi mas ganancias ya que la situacion en este pais es muy dificil y ella quiere darle lo mejor a su hijo.
su anhelo es terminar su casa que esta construyendo, esto es para darle una mejor condicion de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. O. has been a saleswoman for 6 years, and has a 4 year old son who is in the kindergarten located in the Morazan neighborhood. He loves to play football with his classmates at school, and is a very dynamic boy.

Mrs. O. sells her products on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. She has another job in a pharmacy but that alone doesn't take care of the household costs, so she started with her sales business and in this way manages to cover all her expenses. However, she needs more merchandise to make better sales and higher earnings, since the situation in this country is very difficult and she wants to give the best to her son. Her greatest dream is to finish the house she is building, in order to provide her son with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, perfumes, lotions, deodorants, creams, and powders.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mme Akossiwa A. est née le 31Décemdre 1964 à Adoguidi. Mariée et mère de huit (08) enfants, elle a pour activité principale la production et la vente de la farine de manioc « gari », un aliment très apprécié dans le sud Togo. C’est à travers cette activité qu’elle aide son mari cultivateur à supporter les charges familiales. Cependant ses moyens financiers ne lui permettent pas de produire à grande échelle afin de faire face aux demandes de la clientèle. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement lui permettant d’acheter suffisamment de manioc pour une production considérable. L’octroi de ce financement augmentera ses revenus et ensuite améliorera ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Akossiwa A. was born on December 31, 1964 in Adoguidi. She is married and the mother of eight children. Her main work involves making and selling cassava flour, gari, a highly appreciated food in southern Togo. Through her work, she helps her husband, a farmer, to cover family expenses. Yet her financial means don’t allow her to produce on a large enough scale for addressing customer demands. That’s why she’s requesting financing that will enable her to buy enough cassava for a considerable level of production. The granting of this financing will increase her revenues and then improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано продает детскую одежду на центральном рынке города. Раньше она ездила на различные рынки по району, сейчас имеет постоянное место торговли на рынке. Рано 48 лет, воспитывает 1 ребенка. Торговля единственный источник дохода ее семьи. Для развития бизнеса необходимы денежные вложения и Рано год назад получила свой первый займ в Микроинвест. Свой очередной займ Рано планирует потратить на новый ассортимент весенних товаров.
texts.en:
Rano sells children's clothing on the town's central market. She used to travel to different markets of the region before, but now she has a permanent vendor spot on the market. Rano is 48 years old, she raises one child. Retail is the only source of income for her family. To expand the business a financial investment is needed and Rano got her first loan one year ago at MicroInvest. Her next loan Rano plans to use to buy a new assortment for the spring season.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of children's clothing

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi Obema is married and a mother of seven children: two boys and five daughters. The first born is in the senior high school while the rest are in the junior high and the primary schools. One of them is currently learning a trade. She is 41 years old. Naomi lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Naomi, however, is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to the retailers and food vendors (beverage sellers) in her community. She also hawks to sell some of the bread. She procures her goods from Kumasi and Nkawkaw at cost-effective prices. Naomi has been in business for three years. She says she wants a loan to buy the materials in bulk and expand her business. It is her dream to help her children to have access to a good education.

loans.use: To procure bags of flour and ingredients and expand her baking business

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
A. Marie est née vers 1950 à Adjohoun, village de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. A. Marie est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants tous scolarisés. Marie est vendeuse de divers (savon,pâtes alimenaires, laits,sac de riz 5kgs,etc.). L'activité de Marie lui génère de revenus et lui permet de faire face un temps soit peu aux charges de sa famille. Mais faute de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner à temps afin de répondre efficacement à la demande, Marie perd ses clients. C'est pourquoi Marie a besoin de crédit pour renforcer son activité et garder sa clientèle.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
A. Marie was born around 1950 in Adjohoun, a village of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. She is married and the mother of five children, who are all in school. She sells various goods (soap, pasta, milk, 5-kg sacks of rice, etc.). Her work generates income for her and allows her to cope with family expenses for a time, short though it may be. But due to the financial means needed for acquiring supplies on time to respond effectively to the demand, Marie is losing customers. This is why she needs a loan, so as to bolster her business and to retain her customers.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory:  soap, pasta, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina O. is 46 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: three boys and two girls. Her last born is in junior high school. The rest are out of school and working. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. Faustina’s husband is a mason by profession.

Faustina produces palm oil to make some income to support her husband financially. She procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Faustina also sells to food vendors and wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She hopes to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm fruits to expand her palm oil business

texts.fr: Née en 1956 à Zanguéra, Mme Ablodalo H. vit actuellement à Kladjémé avec sa famille. Mariée et mère de huit (08) enfants, elle est cultivatrice comme son mari. Sa culture principale est le mais. A cet effet, elle sollicite un financement pour augmenter sa surface cultivable et acheter des engrais afin de rendre la terre plus fertile. La réalisation de ce projet va rendre ses rendements croissants et par ricochet ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Zanguéra, Ms. Ablodalo H. currently lives in Kladjémé with her family. She is married, the mother of eight children, and a farmer like her husband. She mainly grows corn. To that end, she’s requesting financing for extending her arable lands and for buying manure, so as to make the earth more fertile. The success of this project will lead to increasing yields and thus immediately rebounding revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth vive con sus 2 hijos y su madre en su casa propia. Hace 3 años decidió tener su propio negocio, bebido a su buena sazón eligió abrir un restaurante, el cual implementó en su casa, ya que está ubicada en una de las principales calles de su localidad por lo que garantiza sus ventas. Elizabeth ofrece almuerzo y cena, su trabajo empieza todas las mañanas, muy temprano, para comprar los ingredientes frescos para las comidas que ha de preparar, y es al medio día donde tiene muchos más clientes, necesitando la de sus hijos y su madre, quienes se encargan de atender a los clientes, y por la noche es la jornada de limpieza. Próximamente, Elizabeth está planeando ofrecer también desayunos por lo que tendrá que invertir más tiempo y dinero. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las promotoras de la unidad en su banco comunal, y para este nuevo ciclo se compromete, una vez más, a seguir  promoviendo ese valor. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de mesas y un estante para su restaurante, además de pintar el local para que tenga una mejor presencia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives with her two children and her mother in her own home. Three years ago, she decided to open her business, and due to her ability to cook, she chose to open a restaurant, which she started in her home. Now it is located on one of the main streets of her town, which guarantees her sales. Elizabeth offers lunch and dinner. Her work begins every morning very early when she buys fresh ingredients for the meals that she needs to prepare. At midday when she has many more clients, she needs her children and her mother to attend to the customers. At night she has to clean. Soon, Elizabeth plans to offer breakfast as well, which means she will have to invest more time and money. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is one of the promoters of unity in her communal bank, and in this ninth cycle of theirs, she will once more promote this value. The money requested will go towards purchasing tables and a shelf for her restaurant. She will also paint her location so it will look better.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint her location and purchase furniture

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria D. is 65 years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children: three girls and five boys. She says all her children are out of school and living independently. She lives with some of her grand children and her husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. Victoria’s husband is a cocoa/palm nut farmer.

She produces palm oil to make some income to support her husband financially. She procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She also treks to other towns to sell. Victoria wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She is hopeful to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her palm oil business

loans.name: Magali Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Magali del Carmen R. Pérez tiene la edad de 39 años habita en las enramadas ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , es madre soltera ella tiene cuatro hijos dos de ellos ya son casado y dos que ella tiene a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace ocho años se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio para poder cubrir la responsabilidad de sus pequeños , doña Magali inicio la actividad agrícola ya que sus padres le inculcaron trabajar la tierras que sus parientes le heredaron , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento , los planes hacia un futuro es diversificar con otros productos . Ella con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicárselo al cultivo.
texts.en:
Magali del Carmen R. Pérez is 39 years old and lives in Las Enramadas section of the city of Ticuantepe. Magali is a single mother of four children. Two of her children have already married, but the remaining two are still at home. Her plans for her family include improving their living conditions. For the past eight years Magali has devoted her time to agriculture and trade in order to carry out her responsibilities towards her little ones. She went into agriculture because her parents instilled in her working the land that she inherited from them. The biggest problem is a lack of financing. Magali is planning to branch out into other products and with this loan is going to buy fertilizer and agricultural supplies for her crop.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to improve her crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his arable lands and to buy manure

texts.es: La Sra. Eulogia  Isolina L. comenzó con un grupo llamado Palmeras el año 2002, después de tres secuencias se desintregró el grupo, y la señora Eulogia descansó 4 años, retornando el año 2007 con un crédito individual, su negocio es una tienda bien surtida, ella tiene tres hijos, el menor de meses, la Sra. Eulogia demostró responsabilidad en sus créditos, solo trabaja con nosotros, aunque es codeudora de un crédito que paga el esposo.El esposo es constructor y continuamente viaja. El negocio tiene buena venta, está bien ubicado, siendo la unica en la calle donde se encuentra, por el bebe que nació recién su mamá y sus hermanas le colaboran en la venta, ya que ella tiene su casa propia en la zona de Los Rosales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eulogia Isolina L. began with a group called Palmeras in 2002, but after three cycles, the group disintegrated. Mrs. Eulogia took a four-year break, and then came back in 2007 with an individual loan. Her business is well-stocked and she has three children, the youngest only months old. Mrs. Eulogia has demonstrated responsibility in her loans, she only works with Kiva partner Emprender, although she is a co-signer on a loan that her husband pays. Her husband works in construction and continually travels. The business has good sales and has a good location, being the only store of its kind on the street where it is located. The baby that was recently born, his mother, and her sisters work on sales together. Mrs. Eulogia has her own house in the Los Rosales neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by L. Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Brudit Jeanina

texts.es:
Brudit es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Brudit es soltera, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Brudit vende condimentos como canela, clavo de olor, comino, que ofrece a las tiendas. Además Brudit trabaja provenido alimentos en diferentes proyectos.
Brudit necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de canela, pimienta y clavo de olor.
Los sueños de Brudith son que sus hijos sean profesionales y compra un terreno para la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Brudit is a member of the communal bank of Paloma. Brudit is single and she is 35 years old. She has 2 children. Brudit sells seasonings such as cinnamon, cloves and cumin which she sells to stores. As a matter of fact Brudit is in charge of providing food for different projects. Brudit needs a loan of $325 (1000 Soles), which she will invest in buying cinnamon, cloves and pepper. Brudith’s dream is for her children to become professionals and buy property to build a home on.

(Translated by Edith of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cinnamon, cloves and pepper to sell

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua D. is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two boys and two girls. She says one of her children is learning a trade while the rest are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. Her husband is a farmer and commercial driver.

Akua is into palm oil production. She procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She says she also harvests some of the palm from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Akua wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She has been in business for 15 years and is hoping to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her palm oil business

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La señora Bernarda es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios primaria incompleta (segundo grado). 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 años, se dedica a engorD. D. ganado menor, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. ganado como cerdos y ovejas, para luego engordarlo y venderlo.  
Ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1600.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se compromete a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, el dinero lo invertirá en la compra D. ganado (vaca, ovejas y lechones),para poder venderlo en las ferias D. Zepita, Yunguyo.
Su anhelo es construir su casa en Copani, asimismo desea que sus hijos sean profesionales y es por ello que viene trabajando con mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a member of the "Central Urban" Community Bank and lives in the district of Copani, department of Puno, Peru. She is a 46-year-old married mother of five and has a second-graD. education. She was worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for five years and makes a living raising small livestock. Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she invested it in the purchase of livestock such as pigs and sheep to then fatten and sell. She is requesting a loan of 1,600 soles and promises to repay it in four months. She will invest the money in the purchase of livestock (cows, sheep, suckling pigs) in order to sell them at the outdoor markets in Zepita and Yunguyo. Her goal is to build her home in Copani and for her children to be successful. It is for them that she works with so much effort.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock (cows, sheep, suckling pigs)

loans.name: Alba Azucena

texts.es:
la Sra. Alba tiene 50 años de edad, es residente de la colonia Morazan de San Lorenzo, Valle.
ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada traida de estados unidos, este negocio es muy bueno ya que en dichos fardos viene ropa buena y de marca la cual se vende a un precio bajo entonces la gente compra bastante por la calidad y el precio.
ella tiene una nieta de 1 año de edad y es su felicidad todos los dias, ella dice que ella es su vida.
los dias que  ella mas vende son los fines de semana ya que mucha gente de varias comunidades viene a San Lorenzo a hacer sus compras los fines de semana y ahi es donde ella aprovecha a vender su producto.
ella necesita el prestamo pra ampliar su negocio, ella le ayuda mucho a su nieta.
su sueño es poder comprar una casa y ella dice en cada momento que lo va a cumplir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba is 50 years old, and a resident of the Morazan neighborhood of San Lorenzo, Valle. She has a store which sells used clothing from the United States. This business is very good, and the bundles she receives contain very good brand-name clothing which she sells at a low price. Her customers buy a lot from her, because of her high quality and low prices.

Mrs. Alba has a one year old granddaughter who is the apple of her eye, and Mrs. Alba says that her granddaughter is her life. She makes most of her sales on weekends, because that is when a lot of people from various communities come to San Lorenzo to do their shopping, so Mrs. Alba takes advantage of the opportunity to sell her merchandise.

She needs this loan to grow her business, because she provides a lot of support to her granddaughter. Her dream is to be able to buy a house, and she always says that some day this dream will come true.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing from the United States

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Llilda es una mujer muy alegre, tiene 37 años, vive con su conviviente, sus hijas Dayana de 17, Rosa Angélica de 14 y su pequeño sobrino de 1 añito de edad, el cual está a su cuidado desde bebé. Llilda y su esposo se dedican al servicio de transporte de pasajeros desde hace 3 años, él es chofer y maneja un minibus tipo coaster (propio) con rutas a diferentes distritos de la ciudad de Lima, como Villa Estela y Ancon, este último es un balneario muy visitado en época de verano. Llilda administra los ingresos y egresos, mientras su esposo se dedica netamente al manejo. Adicionalmente, ella vende cosméticos, negocio al cual le dedica una buena cantidad de su tiempo, ya que es un buen complemento y le proporciona ingresos extra para su hogar. A Llilda le agrada mucho trabajar, ya que posee un gran carisma, y con el cual convence a sus clientas para que le compren los productos que ofrece, por otro lado su coaster es el medio principal de sostenimiento de su familia y gracias a su trabajo y al de su esposo, pudieron comprar otro minibus, el cual presenta algunas fallas. Con el dinero que solicita refaccionará este minibus que alquilará a una pareja de esposos amiga para que trabajen en ese carro, de chofer y cobradora respectivamente, también haciendo transporte público local de pasajeros.
texts.en:
Llilda is a young lady who is very happy and she is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and her daughter Dayana, 17, and her daughter Angelica, 14, and her young nephew who is one year old. She has been in charge of taking care her nephew since he was a baby. Llilda and her husband have made a living in the transportation business for the past 3 years. He is a driver and he drives a small bus that they own. He has different routes throughout the city of Lima, such as Villa Estela y Ancon, which is swimming area at the beach that is visited by many people during summer. Llilda is in charge of the financial aspect of the business and her husband drives the bus all day. She also sells cosmetic products. She spends a lot of time selling the cosmetics and she is able to earn extra income for her family. She loves to work and she is very charismatic, which helps to to convince her customers to buy products from her. However, the bus provides the family with their main source of income. Thanks to her and her husband's hard work they were able to buy another minibus, but it needs some repairs. With this money she will repair the minibus and will rent it out to a husband and wife that she is friends with. The husband will work as the driver and the wife will work collecting the money.

(Translated by Dorian of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

texts.ru: Муж Шахнозы работает на заработках в России. Сама Шахноза уже несколько лет занимается предпринимательством – она продает детские игрушки в центральном магазине города Исфара. Шахнозе исполнилось 32 года, у нее 2 детей. За детьми следит ее свекровь дома, а Шахноза торгует. Бизнес налажен, за товаром она ездит на оптовый рынок и приобретает у местных оптовиков. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже несколько лет и показала себя образцовой клиенткой. Собирается и дальше сотрудничать с МикроИнвест и подала заявку на очередной займ.
texts.en:
Shahnoza's husband works as a laborer in Russia. Shahnoza has been doing business for several years - she sells children's toys in the central store in the town of Isfara. Shahnoza just turned 32, she has two children. Her mother in law is sitting with the children while Shahnoza works. Her business is steady. She travels to the wholesale market for the merchandise and buys from the local wholesalers. She has been with MicroInvest for already several years and has proven to be an exemplary client. She plans to continue taking out loans from MicroInvest and has applied for another loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Armandine

texts.fr: Née en 1983 à Zanguéra, Mme Armandine D. est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est domicilié à Kladjémé avec son mari et exerce comme activité la vente de chaussures et sandalettes. Elle va de villages en villages pour vendre ses produits les jours de marchés. Pour répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante  de ses clients et face aux problèmes financiers auxquels elle est confrontée actuellement, elle sollicite un crédit pour s’approvisionner suffisamment en marchandises. Ce financement lui permettra de satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients et ainsi accroître ses revenus
texts.en:
Born in 1983 in Zanguéra, Ms. Armandine D. is married and the mother of three children. She lives in Kladjémé with her husband and works selling shoes and flip-flops. She goes from village to village to sell her goods on market days. To respond to the ever-growing demand of her customers and to cope with financial problems she faces right now, she’s requesting a loan to supply herself with enough merchandise. This financing will enable her to satisfy the needs of her customers and thus to increase her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell shoes and flip-flop sandals

loans.name: Yawa Brigitte

texts.fr: Madame M. yawa brigite est une dame mariée  et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle habite avec sa famille le quartier  de togo2000 à Lomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la couture dans son atelier de couture qu’elle appelle « COUTURE BB », elle a besoin d’agrandir son activité pour pouvoir répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et livrer à temps les commandes. N’ayant jamais obtenu de crédit de wages, elle sollicite son premier prêt pour acheter trois (03) machines à coudre,  des tissus, des fils, des doublures et des pagnes.
texts.en:
Ms. M. Yawa Brigite is a married lady and the mother of three children. She lives with her family in the Togo200 district in Lomé. To earn an income, she works as a seamstress in her workshop she calls “COUTURE BB”. She needs to expand her business to respond to customer demand and to deliver orders on time. Having never obtained a loan from WAGES before, she’s requesting her first loan to buy three sewing machines, some fabrics, thread, lining material, and pagnes (colorful West African cloth).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines, fabrics, thread, etc.

texts.en:
Joshua B. is forty-five years old. He is married and is the father of four children, three sons and one daughter. According to him, his daughter has completed school while the rest of the children are in the junior high and basic school. His wife produces palm oil. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. 

Joshua is a farmer, and he also runs a grocery store in which he sells products such as sugar, milk, Milo (an instant chocoate malt drink mix), and toffee. He says he procures his goods from Nkawkaw, a nearby city. His shop is located by the roadside. He has been in business for three years. He wants a loan to buy various groceries to stock his shop. He wants to give his children the best education that he can afford.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr:
K. Marthe est née vers 1962 à Catchi dans le 2e Arrondissement de la vile de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Marthe est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants dont deux(2) scolarisés. Marthe est vendeuse de bouillie faite à base maïs et de galettes d'arachide, de farine de blé, de sucre et de fruits de coco ainsi que de jus de citron et de maïs localement appelé « adoyo ». Pour accroitre son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Marthe exprime un besoin de prêt.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
K. Marthe was born around 1962 in Catchi, in the 2nd district of the city of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She sells cornmeal bouillie (a thin porridge) and pancakes made of flour, sugar, and coconut, as well as a beverage made from lemon juice and corn called “adoyo” locally. To grow her sales figures and her revenues, so as to provide for her family, she is expressing a need for a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stock of flour, peanuts, and coconut

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, del Barrio Central, en el distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 42 años de edad, ella es conviviente, y tiene a su cuidado de 02 hijos. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años, ella se dedica a la pesca artesanal y a la compra y venta de pescado, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de mercadería (pescado) para su venta en las ferias de Yunguyo.  
Ella desea continuar con este negocio, por ello viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir mas pescado de lago al por mayor (Carachi, Trucha, Ispi, etc.) el mismo que le brindará buenos ingresos para ella y su familia; su anhelo es comprarse un Bote para poder pescar con tranquilidad, puesto que a la fecha viene alquilando esta movilidad lo que no l permite obtener las ganancias esperadas.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Urbano Central” [“Central Urban”], of the Central neighborhood, province of Yunguyo, in the Puno department. She is 42 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children under her care. Yolanda has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 5 years; she dedicates herself to traditional fishing, and the purchase and sale of fish. Her first loan was of 300 PEN, an amount that she invested in the purchase of merchandise (fish) to sell in the Yunguyo Market. She wishes to continue with this business, and because of that is requesting a new loan of 1,000 PEN, which she pledges to pay in 4 quotas. With this loan she will be able to acquire more wholesale lake fish (carachi, trout, ispi, etc). This purchase will provide a good income for her and her family; her greatest wish is to buy a boat to fish peacefully, given that currently she is renting a boat which does not allow her to obtain the desired profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more wholesale lake fish (carachi, trout, ispi, etc).

texts.en:
Yaa T. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one boy and two girls. She says one of her daughters is in the senior high school while the others are in the junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.   

Yaa is a food vendor. She cooks rice and stew and sells it at the local school compound. She gets bags of rice and other ingredients from Nkawkaw. Yaa wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk so that she can maximize her profit margin. She has been in business for two years and hopes to improve her living standard and give her children the best support that she can.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La señora Fabiana es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, D. la comunidad D. Taccapissi, sector Quellamaya, en el distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; ella tiene 42 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con 06 hijos menores y mayores. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 05 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado menor para engorD. (ovejas y porcinos), su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. ganado (ovejas cara negra) para engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias D. Zepita y Yunguyo.  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1800.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas ovejas y toros para poder engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias D. Yunguyo y Zepita, su deseo es ver profesionales a sus hijos, por ello viene apoyándolos en sus estudios. .
texts.en:
Fabiana is a member of the Urbano Central community bank in the Taccapissi community of the Quellamaya sector. It is in the Copani district, Yungua Province, Puno zone. She is 42 years old; is married; and has 6 children (young and grown). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years. She buys small livestock (sheep and pigs), fattens them, and sells them. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN which she used to buy livestock (sheep with black faces) to fatten and sell at the fairs in Zepita and Yunguyo. Now she needs a loan for an additional 1800.00 PEN. She promises to pay it back in 4 payments. With the money she would be able to buy more sheep and bulls to be able to fatten and sell at the fairs in Yunguyo and Zepita. Her wish is to see her children become professionals. For this reason she is supporting them in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more sheep and bulls to be able to fatten and sell

loans.name: Hard Work Group

texts.en:
This is Kadie K., Aminata K. and Mabinty K.. They named their group "Hard Work."  They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have had meaningful effects in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now they are requesting a loan of Le 1,300,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Kadie K. (left) is the leader of the group. She is forty-five years of age. She was born in Makeni City. Her husband is a welder and they have three children. One of their children is still in school and the older two have already graduated from college. Kadie has been a businesswoman for over ten years.
 
Kadie sells cooked rice and toys. She will use this new loan to expand her business by buying two bags of rice and two barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil. She will use these for her cooked-rice business. She will invest the  balance of the loan in her toy business. A bag of rice costs Le 90,000 and a barter of palm-oil costs Le 60,000. 

Kadie is a skilled and experienced businesswoman. At first, she was selling only cooked rice. Because of a drop in sales, she started selling toys – the first person to start a toy business in her neighborhood. Many of her neighbors then also began selling toys. Kadie therefore made a slight change in the toy business just to continue to maintain a competitive edge.

loans.use: Tp buy two bags of rice and two barters of palm-oil

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena López tiene la edad 53 años de edad, reside en ticuantepe,   ella se dedica al comercio , con el  primer financiamiento que le brindamos logro comprar sillas y mesas y ahora los planes hacia un futuro es terminar de construir parte de la heladería que quiere mejorar , ella vende , helados , sándwich , y otros , doña Maria Elena esta contenta ya que se le a apoyado para poder salir hacia delante , ella vive sola , tiene a cargo a una muchacha que le apoya en las actividades del negocio , el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer las mejoras a su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena López is 53 years old and lives in Ticuantepe. With the first loan that she received she was able to buy chairs and tables for her business. Now her plans for the future are to finish construction on the part of her ice cream shop that she would like to improve. She sells ice cream, sandwiches, and other things. Maria Elena is happy to have received the support to be able to get ahead. She lives alone, but she has a girl who helps her in her business. The loan she is asking for is to buy construction materials to be able to improve her business and provide her customers with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make improvements at her business location

texts.en:
Grace A. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two boys and two girls. She says her sons are learning trades and that one of her daughters is in the senior high. However, the other daughter dropped out of school due to a teenage pregnancy.
 
She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are involved in trading activities and palm oil production. Her husband is a palm nut farmer.

Grace is involved in palm oil production. She buys palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She says she also harvests some of the palm from her husband’s farm. Grace distributes her oil to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. She has been in business for six years and hopes to improve her living standards and give her children the best of support that she can.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina”, del barrio Mendoza,  en el distrito de Platería, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y esta al cuidado de 06 hijos, posee estudios de primaria incompleta (primer grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 02 años, su negocio es la artesanía (tejido a mano), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de lana para sus tejidos.  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas materiales para sus tejidos al por mayor (lanas de diferentes tonalidades y materiales); ella también se dedica al hilado y con la lana que compra puede elaborar vestidos, chompas, chullos y otros que entrega a los intermediarios en la Feria Acora, su anhelo es comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Puno, para sus hijos y el bienestar de su familia..
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Flor Andina” (“Andean Flower”) cooperative bank, located in the Mendoza neighborhood in Puno. She is 38 years old, married with 6 children, and did not complete her primary school education. She has been working with the Manuela R. movement for two years. Her work is crafts (knitting). She received a first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, an amount she invested into purchasing yarn for her hand-knitted goods. Currently, she needs a loan of 1,500 soles, which she commits to repaying in 4 installments. With these funds, she would be able to buy more supplies for her craft at wholesale prices (different color yarns and materials). She also dedicates herself to embroidery, and with the yarn she buys can make dresses, sweaters, hats, and other items. She delivers these to intermediaries at the Acora Market. Her wish is to buy herself a house in the city of Puno, for her children and the overall well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her knitting business, such as different color yarns and other materials.

texts.en:
Doris A. is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one boy and three girls. She says all her children are in the basic school at the moment. She lives with her children and husband in a rented house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are involved in trading activities and palm oil production. Her husband sells groceries.
  
Doris is a food vendor. She cooks rice and stew and sells it by the roadside. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from Nkawkaw. Doris wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk so that she can maximize her profit margin. She has been in business for four years and hopes to improve her living standard and give her children the best of support that she can.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, del Sector Tauccamaya, en el distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; ella tiene 42 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 06 hijos. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 05 años, ella se dedica al acopio D. ovejas y su posterior engorD. y venta, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. ovejas para engorD., afirma que le va bien en sus negocio.  
Actualmente ella requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir mas ganado (ovejas y toros) para continuar en su negocio D. engorD. D. ganado, su mercado es la feria ganadera D. Zepita donD. venD. sus ganados engordados, su anhelo es comprarse mas ganado y educar a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the “Urbano Central” cooperative bank, located in the Tauccamaya sector of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has six children. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. She dedicates herself to acquiring sheep to later fatten and sell. She invested her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles into the purchase of sheep. She affirms that her business is going well. She currently needs an additional loan of 1,500 soles, which she commits to repaying in 4 installments, to invest in purchasing more livestock (sheep and bulls) to continue her business. Her market is the livestock fair of Zepita where she sells her grown animals. Her wish is to buy more livestock, and to educate her children so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more livestock (sheep and bulls).

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is 34 years old. She is married and has five children, one male and four females. According to her, her first four children are currently in the basic school and the last one is yet to start school. Her husband is a cocoa and palm nut farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.  
Janet is also into the palm oil production business. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She adds the procured palm nuts to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. Janet distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. It is her dream to help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, en el distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; ella tiene 46 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y al cuidado D. 04 hijos. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 05 años, ella se dedica al acopio D. ovejas y su posterior engorD. y venta en las ferias D. Zepita, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. ovejas para engorD..  
Ella actualmente requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas ovejas para engordarlos en poco tiempo y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas D. Zepita, puesto que ahí le pagan bien, su anhelo es brindar una adecuada profesión a sus hijos menores, a quienes le falta apoyo  a la fecha.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the community bank Urbano Central. It is in the Copani district, in the Yunguyo province, in the Puno zone. She is 46 years old; is married; and has 4 children. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years. She gathers sheep and fattens them to sell at the fairs in Zepita. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN which she used to buy sheep to fatten. Now she needs a loan for an additional 1200.00 PEN which she promises to pay back in 4 payments. With the money she will be able to get more sheep, fatten them quickly, and sell them at the livestock fairs in Zepita. They pay well there. Her goal is to help her children becomes professionals. Right now they do not have the necessary support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get more sheep to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es: El señor Luís Francisco M. tiene la edad de 38 años habita en el barrio Pancho Luz ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa , ellos tiene su cargo dos hijos de 13 y 18 años de edad, que estudian y después de sus clases le apoyan en el negocio , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder darle bienestar a sus pequeños , el se dedicaba a la albañilería pero no le resultaba y desde hace dos años inicio con sus propios esfuerzos la venta de verdura , abarrotes y carnicería la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento . En un futuro hacia su negocio quiere comprar donde el alquila. El financiamiento que el solicita es para incrementar su negocio va a comprar verduras, frutas y carnes para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Luís Francisco M. is 38 years old, and lives in the Pancho Luz neighborhood located in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife. They have under their care two children who are 13 and 18 years old, who both study, and after school help out in the business. Luís’ plan for his family is to improve their quality of life, and to ensure his children’s wellbeing. Luís was a bricklayer but it did not turn out well, and so many years ago he began with his own efforts a business in the sale of vegetables, groceries, and meats; his major difficulty is a lack of financing. In his future having to do with his business he hopes to buy where he rents. The loan that he is requesting is to increase his business’ inventory by purchasing vegetables, fruits, and meats to offer his clients a better variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, and meats.

texts.en:
Joseph B. is 27 years old. He is married and has two children, a set of male twins. He says his children are already in the basic school. His wife produces palm oil for sale. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Joseph owns a cocoa, palm nut and food crop farm. He does not sell the harvested palm fruits in the raw state but adds value to it by producing palm oil. He procures additional palm fruits from nearby farms to increase his production. Joseph distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. He wants a loan to procure palm fruits in large quantities so that he can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to his increasing number customers. He aspires to give his children the best education.

loans.name: Carol Ivette

texts.es: La Señora Carol Ivette Gaitán A. tiene 24 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica de Doña Carol es la venta de productos de belleza. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a este negocio, Doña Carol comenzó con una pequeña pulpería desde hace tres años ella inicio vendiendo pan, tamales, leche agria por lo que las ganancias de estos fueron invertidos en su negocio ya que los ingresos de la pulpera disminuyeron, es así como decide establecerse con el negocio de la venta de productos de belleza. Los propósitos de Doña Carol son de obtener buenas ventas por lo que tiene que promocionar sus productos y sus clientes puedan interesarse en sus productos. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para realizar la compra de más productos. Los sueños de Doña Carol son de obtener un trabajo más estable para que su familia no pase necesidades económicas. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 4.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Carol Ivette Gaitán A. is a single, 24 year old woman. Ms. Carol's business is beauty product sales. She has been working for more than five years. She started with a little store three years ago, and she started out selling bread, tamales, and milk, and invested the earnings from her sales in her cosmetics business, since the earnings from her store were decreasing. This is how she decided to establish herself with her cosmetics sales.

Ms. Carol's goals are to obtain better sales by marketing her products to increase interest among her customers. This is why she is asking for this loan, to use as working capital to buy more products. Ms. Carol's dream is to find a more stable job so her family doesn't want for anything. She is asking for $4.000 córdobas (about $200 US).

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for purcahse of merchandise

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, D. la comunidad D. Taccapissi, sector Quellamaya, en el distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; ella tiene 61 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con 05 hijos mayores. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 01 año, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado menor para engorD. (ovejas y porcinos), su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra alimento para engordar su ganado (forraje y balanceado) y venderlo en la feria D. Yunguyo.  
Ella desea continuar con este negocio y requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas ovejas (para carne) para poder engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias D. Yunguyo, su deseo es ayudarse así misma y poder disfrutar su vejez, ya que sus hijos estame lejos y tienen su propia familia.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Communal Bank “Urbano Central” [“Central Urban”], of the community of Taccapissi, Quellamaya sector, in the district of Copani, province of Yunguyo, department of Puno. She is 61 years old, married, and has 5 older children. Juliana has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year. She dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of small livestock for fattening (sheep and pigs). Her first loan was of 300 PEN, an amount that she invested in the purchase of food to fatten her livestock (fodder and feed); she then sold the livestock at the Yunguyo Market. She wishes to continue in this business and requires an additional loan of 500 PEN, which she pledges to pay in 4 quotas. With the money she will be able to acquire more sheep (for meat) to be able to fatten and sell in the markets in Yunguyo. Her wish is to help herself and to be able to enjoy her old age, given that her children live far from her and have their own families.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more sheep, fatten them, and sell them.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort G. is 47 years old. She is married and has four children, two boys and two girls. The first-born has completed junior high school and is trading. The rest are in senior high and basic schools. Her husband is a tailor by profession. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Comfort trades in palm oil. She procures the palm oil from the producers in her community and distributes it. She distributes to customers who sell at retail and to food vendors. Comfort treks to nearby towns to sell. She wants a loan to procure palm oil in large quantities so that she can distribute to her increasing number of customers. She has been in this business for 13 years. She aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm oil in bulk

loans.name: D. Nicole

texts.fr:
S.  D.  Nicole est née vers 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Nicole est mariée et mère de trois(3) enfants dont deux(2) scolarisés. S. Nicole est une vendeuse de divers: biscuits, chocolats, fromages,sucres, laits, etc. Nicole arrive à faire face aux charges de sa famille grâce au revenu que lui procure cette activité. Cependant, Nicole manque de fonds pour diversifier son activité qu'elle veut plus prospère. Nicole a donc recours à ALIDé pour son besoin de crédit afin de développer son commerce. 
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Ms. S. D. Nicole was born around 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She is a retailer of various goods: cookies, chocolate, cheese, sugar, milk, etc. Nicole manages to cope with family expenses thanks to the income this business brings in. Yet she lacks the funds for diversifying her business, which she wants to be more prosperous. She has therefore turned towards ALIDE for her lending needs, so as to develop her commerce.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of cookies, chocolate, cheese, milk, sugar, etc.

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is 46 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: three males and two females. According to her, the first four children are out of school and learning trades while the last one is in junior high school. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.

She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm-oil production.

Beatrice is also in the palm-oil production business. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and on a retail basis. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. It is her dream to help her husband improve their standard of living.

texts.es: El Señor Denis Noel M. U. tiene 40 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero. Don Denis se dedica a la actividad económica de la venta de mercadería en general como camisetas, ropa interior, calcetines, camisolas y otros. Hace mas de tres años que se dedica a esta actividad económica ya que anteriormente trabaja en una empresa de obrero pero debido a la situación fue despedido por lo que decide sobrevivir con el negocio de la venta de ropa por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes le realizan los pedidos al crédito. Los propósitos de Don Denis son de ampliar su negocio ya que el recorre las diferentes calles para ofrecer sus productos. Es por eso que recurre a los financiamientos previstos para capital de trabajo. Los sueños que Don Denis son de tener un lugar estable para ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes una variedad de mercadería. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Denis Noel M. U. is 40 years old, and single. He sells clothing, such t-shirts, underwear, socks, and camisoles, among other items. He has been doing this for more than three years. Before, he worked as a laborer, but thanks to a rough economic situation was laid off. This is why he decided to survive by selling clothing, and the majority of his clients buy on credit.

Mr. Denis's goals are to grow his business, since he is now going street to street selling his wares. For this reason, he is asking for a loan for working capital. Mr. Denis dreams of having a stable place to offer a variety of products to his customers. He is asking for $6,000 córdobas (about $300 US).

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys O. is 42 years old. She is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. According to Gladys, her first son is in the university. The rest are currently in the junior high and the primary school. Her husband works in a learning institution. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and the palm oil production business.  
Gladys is also into the palm oil production business. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms to prepare the oil and then distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. Gladys wants to help her husband improve their standard of living and give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: El señor Pablo Emilio A. M., tiene la edad de 22 años habita en San José de los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su padres, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de su hogar ya que el le apoya a su padres, el tiene una manzana de tierra la cual necesita trabajar, por falta de financiamiento no ha podido explotar esa tierra, su papá le esta apoyando con una parte pero no es lo suficiente para poder establecer cultivo , los planes hacia su futuro es poder cosechar pitahaya y cítricos ya que el con el financiamiento lo que va a cultivar es piña, lo cual necesita comprar todos los insumos agrícola para obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Pablo Emilio A. M. is 22-years-old and lives with his parents in San José de los ríos, in the Ticuantepe municipality. He hopes to improve the conditions of his home now that he supports his parents.

He owns almost two acres of arable land, which he has not been able to cultivate for lack of funds. His father helps him out as best he can, but his help isn’t enough to make a go of it.

His future plans are to grow citrus and dragon fruits, but he'll start with pineapples and use the money to purchase the supplies he needs to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies for a better harvest

texts.ru: Рауфчон преподаватель в средней школе. Он женат, ему 37 лет, воспитывает 2 детей. Школу, несмотря на маленькую заработную плату бросать не собирается, поэтому занимается предпринимательством. Направление  его бизнеса  - это купля продажа сушеных абрикосов на местных рынках. Доход небольшой, но дополнительные расходы семьи покрывает. Рауфчон оборачивает свой бизнес небольшими деньгами и поэтому решил обратиться в Микроинвест чтобы получить займ.
texts.en:
Raufshon is a middle school teacher. He is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. Even though his pay at school is low, he does not plan to quit. So, to support his family, he maintains a small business. His main activity is buying and selling dried apricots at local markets. His income is not large, but still, it is sufficient enough to cover additional family expenses. Raufshon cycles a relatively small amount of money in his business; that is why, he decided to obtain a loan from MicroInvest to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

Sophia A. is 48 years old. She is married and has three children, two daughters and one son. According to her, her son is learning a trade and one daughter is in junior high school. The other daughter has yet to start school. Her husband is a cocoa/palm nut farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and the palm oil production business.  
Sophia trades in foodstuffs. She says she procures foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, yam, and fruits such as oranges, banana, etc. and treks to other towns to sell. She buys from nearby farms. Sophia wants a loan to procure the foodstuffs in bulk so that she can distribute to her increasing number of customers. She wants to help her husband improve their standard of living and give their children the best education they can afford.

Janet A. is 65 years old. She is widowed and has seven children, one female and six males. She says she lost her husband very long ago and decided not to marry again. She says all her children are married and living independently. She lives with some of her grandchildren in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.  
Janet says she been farming ever since she was young.  She cultivates both food crops and cash crops such as cocoa, palm nuts, plantain, etc. She sells her farm produce, the food crops, to retailers and food vendors in her community. Janet says she wants a loan to procure agro-chemicals such as fertilizers, insecticides, etc. to be able to practice modern farming practices. She aspires to give her grandchildren the support they need for their education.

loans.name: Melly Rosario

texts.es:
La Sra. Melly C. tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, ella es comerciante y estudia en la universidad, esta sacando Adminisracion de Empresas, ella tiene 4 años de vender su producto, el cual lo vende mucho en la universidad, ahi es donde ella tiene su mayoria de clientes.
ella vive con sus padres pero el dinero de las ganancias lo necesita para pagar su estudios y comprar libros ya que ellos no le pueden ayudar y necesita salir adelante.
ella necesita el prestamos para comprar mas mercaderia ya que se vende muy bien pero no tiene  capital para comprar mas, .
su meta es poder obtener su licenciatura lo mas pronto posible y asi poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Melly C. is 32 years old and unmarried. She is a business woman, majoring in business administration in college. For the past four years she has sold her products for the most part at the university, where she has the majority of her clients. Melly lives with her parents, but the money she earns is needed to pay for her studies and to buy books since her parents are not able to assist her. To improve her prospects for the future, she needs this loan to purchase more merchandise because, although it sells very well, she has not got the capital to buy more. Melly's goal is to be able to get her degree as quickly as possible so she can improve her lot in life.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lotion, perfume, creams, talcum powder and deodorant

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en:
Foster O. is 37 years old. He is married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. According to him, all his children are in junior high and the basic school. His wife is a fishmonger. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming.

Foster is a farmer and at the same time runs a provisions store in which he sells products such as sugar, milk, milo, toffees, etc. He says he procures his goods from Nkawkaw, a nearby city. His shop is located by the roadside. Foster has been in business for 10 years. He wants a loan to procure various provisions to stock his shop. He desires to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia es una mujer muy tranquila y trabajadora, a sus 36 años a logrado formar una familia y ser  el principal sustento de ella, vive en una casa alquilada y no pierde las esperanzas de mejorar su situación económica. Rodeada de sus queridos animales Basilia pasa sus días, ella trabaja muy duro para que su ganado se alimente bien y crezca sano, para luego llevarlo a la feria dominical y venderlos en espera de sacar un buen precio por sus animalitos y casi siempre lo consigue, ya que son los más grandes de la feria. Lo que más le gusta a Basilia de su trabajo, es que puede pasar sus días en el campo que tanto quiere y respirar su aire limpio, son ya 10 años, los que lleva en este negocio y piensa continuar el tiempo que sea necesario, con tal de darle una mejor vida a su familia. Lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es perseguir a los corderitos que a veces se escapan y corren muy lejos del resto del ganado. Basilia anhela poner un negocio propio, tal vez una tienda de abarrotes o un restaurante, todavía no se decide, pero sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para mejorar la vida que actualmente tiene su familia. Es su primer préstamo con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo para poder acceder a otro, en su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre participa de todas las decisiones que se toman. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más ganado, para mejorar sus ingresos, también comprará forraje para alimentar a sus animales en la temporada de heladas (frío intenso) que se avecina.
texts.en:
Basilia is a very peaceful and hardworking woman. At 36 years of age, she has formed a family and is its primary breadwinner. She lives in a rented house and has not lost hope of improving her economic situation. She passes the days surrounded by her beloved animals. She works very hard to ensure that her livestock eat well and grow up healthy, then takes them to the Sunday market and sells them in hopes of getting a good price for her animals, and she nearly always does since hers are the largest in the market. What she loves most about her work is that she can spend her days in the country she loves so much, breathing clean air. She has spent 10 years in this business and plans to continue doing so as long as it takes to give her family a better life. What she likes the least about her work is chasing after lambs that escape and run very far from the herd. Basilia wishes to have her own business, perhaps a grocery store or a restaurant; she still hasn't decided, but she knows that she has to work hard to improve her family's lives. This is her first loan with MFP, and she understands her responsibility to make repayments on time in order to access more loans. She is very active in her communal bank and always participates in their decisions. With this loan, she will buy more livestock to improve her income, and will also buy forage to feed her animals during the seasonal frost (intense cold) that lies ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer
