The members of the community bank are dedicated to different economic activities, such as food sales, promoters of different brands of cosmetics, sale of internet and phone lines, shoe sales, stall sales of clothing, and the sale of groceries. As in all commercial areas there always exists competition for the sale and for demand, especially in the product market, but all the members are progressing forward with their small businesses, thanks to their experience and willingness to work. The requested loan is to increase product stocks for their busineses, such as buying telephone cards, better quality clothes, and consumables. The majority of the members are in their third season with the institution, in which time they have demonstrated responsibility, honesty and punctuality with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: El grupo "Copacabana”  esta representado por la señora Graciela  y se encuentra un parentesco familiar entre las señoras, cristina y el señor José Miguel que son primos pero con ingresos independientes cada uno. Las socias del banco comunal se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como, venta D.  frutas, venta D. abarrotes, promotoras D. diferentes marcas D. cosméticos  y ala venta ambulante D. ropa. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero la experiencia D. las socias les permite salir adelante para llevar el ingreso diario para el sustento D. su familia.  El crédito otorgado es para ampliar el stock D. productos para sus negocios y a la compra D. materiales e insumos para mejorar sus ingresos y brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. La mayoría D. las socias han trabajado con fundaciones o organizaciones financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital por lo que  tienen experiencia en grupo solidaR..
texts.en:
This group is called "Copacabana” and is represented by Graciela. Two of the group's members are related: Cristina and José Miguel are cousins, but their incomes are independent of one another. The members of the community bank have a variety of businesses such as selling fruit, selling groceries, promoting different brands of cosmetics and selling clothing as street vendors. As with all business, there is competition in the market but the members' experience allows them to continue making a daily income to sustain their families. This loan will be used to increase the stock of goods for their businesses and to buy materials and ingredients to improve their revenue and give their families a better quality of life. Most of the members have previously worked with foundations or other financial institutions like Fundación Agrocapital and so they are familiar with group loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: El grupo " Nueva Jerusalén " esta representado por la señora Elvira y conformado por 14 miembros en los cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Elvira  y la señora Maria luisa las cuales son hermanas pero con actividades económicas diversas. En general las socias se dedican a la venta de productos como cerveza, cosméticos, ropa, joyas, hamburguesas, pan y al servicio de limpieza y lavandería. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia pero gracias  a los años de experiencia de los socios saben como salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra d insumos y materiales para mejorar la calidad de sus productos y hacerle frente a la competencia y poder mejorar sus ingresos para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En general una mayoría de los miembros del grupo ya tiene experiencia abajando con grupos solidarios en entidades financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital por lo que saben de la responsabilidad de sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Jerusalén" group is represented by Elvira and made up of 14 members, of which Elvira and Maria Luisa are sisters but have different sources of income. Generally, the members sell products such as beer, cosmetics, clothing, jewelry, hamburgers, bread and offer cleaning and laundry services. As with all businesses, there is always competition for their business but thanks to the years of experience of the members, they know how to keep their businesses going. The loan will be used to buy ingredients and materials to improve the quality of their goods and face the competition as well as to improve their income in order to give their families a better quality of life. In general, most of the members of the group have already had experience working with groups in financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital and so are aware of their responsibilities and obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo Tomás y su hija de 15 años llamada Roxana, la cual es su principal apoyo en su negocio, ellos viven en su casa propia. Se viene dedicando a la venta de frutas desde hace 9 años en el mercado de “Pachacutec”, que está ubicado en su misma localidad, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingresos. En este trabajo la ayuda su hija Roxana la cual atiende el puesto cuando su mamá sale a comprar más mercadería o se le presenta algún contratiempo. A Susana le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que siempre está en contacto con la gente y ha hecho muy buenas amigas con sus vecinas del mercado, además las ganas que le pone y la alegría con la que atiende, hacen que la venta sea buena y le arroje ganancias satisfactorias. Pero como toda una microempresaria, Susana quiere expandir su negocio y hacer que sea mucho más próspero, para lo cual quiere ponerle un techo nuevo a su puesto. Susana ha trabajado con MFP desde aproximadamente 3 años, siendo una cliente muy puntual y responsable en sus pagos, ahora tiene un préstamo individual, pero trabajó primero con un banco comunal con el cual estuvo muy feliz, ya que hizo buenas amigas y todas eran muy responsables. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más mercadería y en arreglar su puesto para brindar una mejor atención a su clientela, Susana está muy feliz y espera seguir progresando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Susana is 45 years old and lives with her husband Tomás and her 15 year old daughter Roxana who is her principal support in her business; they live in their own house. Susana has dedicated herself to the sale of fruits for the past 9 years in the market in “Pachacutec”, which is located in her same neighborhood given that this is her principal source of income. Her daughter Roxana helps her in this work by taking care of their stand when her mother leaves to purchase more merchandise or has some setback. Susana enjoys her work very much given that she is always in contact with people and has become good friends with her neighbors in the market. In addition, the effort that she puts forth in her job and the happiness with which she attends her customers make for good sales and give her satisfactory earnings. Like with any micro-enterprise, Susana wants to expand her business and to make it much more prosperous, for which she needs to install a new roof on her stand. Susana has worked with the MFP Bank for approximately 3 years, being a punctual client and responsible with her payments. She now has an individual loan, but first worked in a communal bank with which she was very happy, given that she made good friends who were all very responsible. She will invest the money requested in the purchase of more merchandise and in repairing her stand to offer better service to her clients. Susana is very happy and hopes to continue progressing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise, and repair her stand.

texts.es: El grupo " Nuevo Renacer" esta representado por el señor Edwin y conformado por 12 miembros entre los cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre el señor Diego y el señor Alex que son hermanos pero con ingresos y actividades independientes. Todos los miembros del grupo tienen actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como refrescos, cosméticos, ropa, chocolatería, comida, pan, abarrotes y empleados públicos.  Dentro del ámbito comercial existe gran competencia D. venta D. productos pero depenD. D. la calidad D. los productos y el buen trato que se le da al cliente para tener mayores ingresos. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas en especial para aquellas socias que se encuentran empezando nuevos negocios como la señora Brigitte que se encuentra empezando un negocio D. chocolatería y necesita capital para emprenderlo.  Una mayoría D. las socias ya trabajaron con entidades financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital por lo que tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y en el manejo D. fondos para mejor su calidad D. vida y la D. sus familias.
texts.en:
" Nuevo Renacer" is the name of this group, represented by Edwin and maD. up of 12 members, of whom two are related: Diego and Alex are brothers, but they have separate incomes and businesses. The members of the group are in sales: refreshments, cosmetics, clothing, chocolates, food, bread, groceries, as well as public servants. In commerce there is a great deal of competition amongst retailers but everything depends on the quality of the product and customer service if one wants to make more income. The loan will be used to buy materials, ingredients and tools, especially for those members who are starting up a new business, such as Brigitte who is starting up a chocolate-sales business and needs capital to begin. The majority of the members have already worked with financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital and therefore have experience with group loans and with money-management to improve the quality of their lives and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: El grupo " Chicas Rebeldes " esta representado por la señora María Flora, el grupo se encuentra cursando su quinto ciclo siempre cumplidas y responsables seleccionaron a las personas irresponsables de ciclos anteriores para tener mayor confianza entre los miembros que conforman el nuevo grupo para trabajar con el mismo entusiasmo como hasta ahora. En general el grupo se dedica a actividades como a la venta de comida, salteñas, medicamentos, cereales, cosméticos por catálogos y al servicio de trasporte público y al servicio de limpieza. El crédito esta destinado al incremento de mercadería e insumos así como a la compra y mejora de sus herramientas de trabajo. Dentro del ámbito comercial existe una gran competencia pero las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y su calidez ya que son el sustento de su familia. Los socios (as) tienen bastante experiencia en el manejo de los fondos otorgados y saben cumplir con sus obligaciones con responsabilidad y honestidad como lo han demostrado en sus anteriores ciclos trabajando con la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
This group, "Chicas Rebeldes", represented by María Flora, is in its fifth loan cycle. They have politely and responsibly, they have asked the people who were irresponsible in previous cycles to leave the group so that they can have more trust amongst the members who make up this new group. They are working with the same enthousiasm as they had before. In general, the group's incomes come from sales of food, salteñas [a savoury pastry], medications, cereals, cosmetics from catalogues and public transportation services as well as cleaning services. The loan will be used to increase the merchandise and ingredients as well as the purchase and improvement of work tools. There is a great deal of competition in commerce but the members know how to keep their businesses going thanks to their experience and their quality as their are their families' support. The members have a good deal of experience managing money and know how to fulfill their obligations responsibly and honestly as they have shown in their previous cycles working with Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Cleta

texts.es:
La Sra. Cleta H. tiene una familia compuesta por dos hijos pequeños en edad escolar, ella trabaja juntamente con el esposo en la atención de la venta de comida, especialmente días sábados y domingos donde existe mas demanda, ya que el esposo tiene un trasporte que  trabaja llevando pasajeros todos los días.
 Es una pareja joven, que hasta la fecha han podido adquirir bienes para el hogar, con este trabajo  que ella desempeña en ese lugar desde el año 2006,
Trabaja con crédito desde el año 2004, que comenzó con grupo San Alberto con tres integrantes, posteriormente se individualizó, trabajando responsablemente.
Ella tiene buena venta, ya que su negocio está bien ubicado, pues es la parada de los buses interprovinciales a la zona de Sud Yungas, ella vive con su familia en la zona de Coqueni .
texts.en:
Cleta H. has two small elementary school age children and works with her husband in food sales, especially on Saturdays and Sundays when there is a higher demand. Her husband has a vehicle which transports passengers every day. They are a young couple, and up to the present date have been able to acquire goods for their home with this work that she has carried out in this place since 2006. She has worked with loans since 2004; she began with the group San Alberto which was composed of three members, but later individualized herself, working responsibly. Cleta has good sales given that her business in well located, as it is at the inter-provincial bus stop in the Sud Yungas zone; she lives with her family in the Coqueni zone.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the kitchen (to purchase tile).

texts.es: El banco comunal "PrimaV. Júnior" es un grupo que esta cursando su segundo ciclo conformada por 19 miembros que  se conocen ya que residen en la misma zona y se tienen mucha confianza, esta representado por la señora carmen quien e la presidenta del grupo. dentro D. las actividades que realizan los miembros del grupo para generar ingresos se tiene al comercio D. productos como ropa, pan, comida, repostería y a actividades como moto taxista, secretaria , profesora, empleado, cajeras y modistas. Dentro del ámbito comercial y D. servicios  existe gran competencia, pero los socios (as) saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y ganas D. trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Los socios (as) cumplieron su anterior siclo demostrando capacidad, honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que la fundación agrocapital confía en este nuevo financiamiento.
texts.en:
The community bank "PrimaV. Júnior" is a group in its second loan cycle and maD. up of 19 members who know each other as they live in the same neighbourhood and have a lot of trust in each other. The group is represented by Carmen, the President of the group. Among the activities the members are active in are: the sale of products such as clothing, bread, food, baking and activities such as motorcycle taxi, secretary, teacher, employee, cashier and dressmaker. There is a great deal of competition in the commercial and services' worlds but these members know how to stay in business thanks to their experience and their desire to work to see their families progress. The loan will be used to buy ingredients, materials, and tools to improve their income and give their families a better quality of life. The member finished their previous loan cycle, showing their ability, honesty and responsibility in their repayments and because of this Fundación Agrocapital has entrusted them with this latest loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las Muchachitas" esta representado por la señora Rosario María y esta conformado por 12 miembros los cuales residen en la av. tres pasos al frente en el cual es son 11 mujeres y 1 varón, en cuanto al parentesco familiar la señora Rosario María  y la señorita Veracruz  son madre e hija pero ambas tienen ingresos independientes. Todos los miembros se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, venta de comida, de pan, servicio de limpieza, servicio de construcción de viviendas  y a la elaboración de prendas de vestir.  Existe gran competencia dentro del ámbito comercial así como variedad de productos para ofrecer a la venta, las socias se basan en su experiencia y en la calidad de sus productos para hacerle frente a la competencia y poder generar mejores ingresos cada día, es por este motivo que necesitan el crédito para la adquisición d material de primera para mejorar cada día mas la calidad de sus productos así como mejorar sus herramientas de trabajo para un mejor acabado. La mayoría de las socias tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que cuentan con experiencia crediticia en otras entidades financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital en la cuales han demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
This community bank, "Las Muchachitas", is represented by Rosario María and is made up of 12 members, 11 women and one man, who live on Tres Pasos Avenue. Rosario María and Veracruz are mother and daughter buth each has her own independent source of income. Each of the members has a different business, such as selling cosmetics from catalogues, selling food, bread, offering cleaning services, residential construction services and dressmaking. There is a great deal of competition to their business in the variety of products offered for sale: the members rely on their experience and the quality of their products to face the competition and make more money each day; because of this, they need the loan to acquire more raw materials to improve the quality of their goods as well as their work tools to give their goods a better finish. Most of the members have experience with group loans as they have experience borrowing from other financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital in which they have demonstrated their punctuality and responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: El grupo "Nueva Generación" esta representado por Margarita y compuesto por 14 miembros que ensu mayoría se dedican a la venta decomidas rapidas en todo tipo de acontecimiento, hay quienes tienen su pensión y otras venden carne de cerdo al por mayor. Dentro del amabito comercial existe gran competencia de ofertas y demandas pero la buena calidad de lacomida y su experiencia hacen que las socias tengan ingreso diarios para el sustento de sus familias. El credito esta destinado a la compra de insumos y herramientas para mejprar la calidad de su comida y la rapidez de la atencion de los clientes. Una Mayoria de los socios (as) van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando reponsabilidad y cumplimiento en su pagos.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Generación" group is represented by Margarita and made up of 14 members who for the most part sell fast foods at all types of events, some are retired and others sell pork wholesale. They have a lot of competition but the good quality of their food and their experience mean that the members have enough daily revenue to support their families. The loan will be used to buy ingredients and tools to improve the quality of their food and the speed with which they can serve their customers. Most of the members are in their third loan cycle and have proven responsibility in repaying their previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: El sr. Rolando trabaja con la institución desde el año 2005, con un grupo solidario, actualmente trabaja con su crédito individual, tiene su microbus está inscrito en el sindicato Villa Victoria, tiene su esposa y sus hijos, en edad escolar, su esposa lo ayuda con los gastos de la casa, con algunos trabajos de macramé que realiza cuando tiene pedidos. Invertirá el crédito en la compra  de caja y corona para el microbus,  que en este momento está teniendo algunas fallas. El horario de trabajo es de 06:00 de la mañana hasta las 24:00 horas.
texts.en:
Mr. Rolando has worked with the institution since 2005, with a solidarity group, and currently works with an individual loan. His bus is registered with the Villa Victoria union. He has a wife and school age children. His wife helps with the household expenses, working on macrame projects when she has requests. He will invest this loan money in the purchase of a change box and parts for the bus, which is currently having some mechanical difficulties. He works from 6am until midnight.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Deysy de 21 años, vive en la casa de sus padres y los ayuda en todas las tareas del hogar, es una joven alegre y tiene muchas ganas de progresar y mejorar su vida. Aprendió desde muy niña el negocio familiar, la crianza de truchas es en la actividad para la que más preparada está, muy de mañana empieza su labor, teniendo que remar y abrirse camino a través del lago Titicaca, para alimentar a sus truchas, que es justamente lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, ya que mientras transporta el alimento, puede disfrutar de los hermosos paisajes que se forman en el lago. Deysy anhela incrementar el número de truchas que cría, para poder exportarlas y así mejorar sus ingresos, tiene un año realizando esta labor y lo que menos le gusta es el olor de la comida que le da a sus truchas, aunque sabe que tiene que hacerlo, ya que si no lo hiciera su negocio no progresaría. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Deysy invertirá los setecientos soles que solicita en su negocio de truchas, comprará más alimento y mejorará sus jaulas.
texts.en:
Deysy is 21 years old and lives with her parents and helps them with the household chores. She is a happy young woman and has a strong desire to advance and improve her life. She learned the family business as a child, trout farming is the activity that she is best qualified for. She starts work very early in the morning, making her way out to lake Titicaca to feed the trout, which is her favorite part of the job, because as she transports the food she can enjoy the beautiful scenery surrounding the lake. Deysy wants to increase the number of fish she raises, to be able to export them and increase her profits. She has been in this business for a year, and the part she likes least is the smell of the food she gives to the fish, although she knows she must do it, or her business will not grow. This is her first loan with MFP, she is very happy to have obtained it and is dedicated to making all of her payments on time. She is very active in her communal bank, and is always aware of the agreements reached at their meetings. Deysy will invest this money in her trout business, buying more food and improving their tanks.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Edgar tiene 32 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres, es muy atento y preocupado, además tiene muchas ganas forjarse un buen futuro. Se dedica a la crianza de truchas, actividad que aprendió desde muy niño de su padre, él es muy feliz realizando este trabajo, puesto que es una actividad que le trae muchos beneficios y con la cual ha podido mantenerse. Edgar disfruta mucho de llevar su pequeña lancha hasta su criadero, donde con mucha dedicación alimenta sus truchas, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y espera que su negocio crezca y pueda tener más criaderos, para vender más. Lo más difícil de su trabajo, es darles el debido cuidado a sus truchas, ya que si no lo hace su producción puede disminuir y sus ganancias bajarían. Edgar sabe que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero está dispuesto a trabajar duro para mejorar su vida. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy contento por la oportunidad, ya que piensa invertirlo bien, en su banco comunal es una socio muy respetado, ya que siempre pone orden en el grupo. La cantidad que solicita la invertirá en mejorar su criadero de truchas y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Edgar is 32 years old, is single, and lives at home with his parents. He is very thoughtful and concerned, and wants very much to create a good future. He raises trout, a skill he learned from his father when he was very young. He is very happy with this work, as the job brings many benefits and he has been able to support himself through it. Edgar enjoys very much taking his small boat out to his fishery, where, with much dedication, he feeds his fish. He has been in this business for 5 years, and hopes that his business will grow and he can have more fisheries in order to sell more. The most difficult part of his job is caring for the fish appropriately; if they aren't cared for correctly, their numbers will drop and his earnings will too. Edgar knows that his job is very self-sacrificing, but he is dedicated to working hard to improve his life. This is his first loan from MFP and he is very happy to have this opportunity and intends to invest the money well. He is very respected at his communal bank, and always brings order to the group. The amount he is requesting will be invested in improving his trout farm and will increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles A. A. es una señora de 26 años de edad casada con Yinier Gustavo Araya. Ellos dos tienen una hija que se llama Enid Sofía. Viven en una pequeña comunidad al oeste de San José que se llama  Grifo Alto de Puriscal.
Grifo Alto es una comunidad rural que se ubica aproximadamente a una hora al oeste de San José. Es una zona montañosa y tiene una vista muy linda de valles, ríos y montañas que miran a la costa pacífica de Costa Rica. Grifo Alto queda sobre la carretera que va hacia las playas por lo tanto muchos turistas paran ahí a comer, o simplemente disfrutar de los paisajes y el ambiente rural. En la zona hay muchas fincas pequeñas que se dedican tanto a la agricultura como a la ganadería. Anteriormente se sembraba mucho tabaco pero luego los precios bajaron y la gente buscó otras opciones.
Doña María de los Ángeles tiene una granja de gallinas ponedoras para vender huevos en la comunidad. Este negocio lo iniciaron hace dos años cuando el papá de María de los Ángeles les vendió un pedazo de tierra y ahí construyeron un galerón en dónde iniciaron con 300 pollitas. Con un primer micro préstamo que solicitaron lograron aumentar la cantidad de gallinas ponedoras en 750. Ahora piensan obtener un nuevo préstamo para lograr llegar a 1.000 gallinas y en un futuro aumentar hasta 1.500 que es la meta que se han propuesto y con la cual consideran que pueden llegar a tener un ingreso suficiente para que se convierta en la fuente de ingresos para toda la familia. 
Con el préstamo que están solicitando esperan comprar 250 pollitas, 20 sacos de alimento, 10 comedores y 10 bebedores. 
En este momento María de los Ángeles se dedica a cuidarlas, alimentarlas, recoger los huevos y distribuirlos en las tienditas y casas cercanas. Su esposo le ayuda por las tardes cuando regresa de su trabajo. 
María de los Ángeles es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Grifo Alto de Puriscal la cual es una de las organizaciones comunales socias de EDESA. Anteriormente obtuvo un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) el cual pagó de forma puntual ya que la actividad le genera ingresos diarios.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles A. A. is a woman of 26 years married to Yinier Gustavo Araya. They have a daughter whose name is Enid Sofia. They live in a small community west of San Jose called Grifo Alto Puriscal. Grifo Alto is a rural community that is approximately one hour west of San José. It is a mountainous area and has a beautiful view of valleys, rivers, and mountains that overlook the Pacific coast of Costa Rica. Grifo Alto is on the road towards the beaches so many tourists stop there to eat or simply enjoy the scenery and the rural environment. The area has many small farms for agriculture and livestock. They used to plant a lot of tobacco, but then prices dropped and people sought other options. Doña María de los Angeles has a farm of laying hens for eggs which are sold in the community. They started this business two years ago when María de los Ángeles' father sold them a piece of land where they built a shed and started with 300 chicks. With the first micro loan they requested they were able to increase the number of hens to 750. Now they plan to obtain a new loan in order to get to 1000 hens and in the future increase to 1500 which is the target they have been proposed and which they think will provide a sufficient income to become the source of income for the whole family. With the loan they are requesting they plan to buy 250 chicks, 20 bags of feed, 10 feeders, and 10 waterers. At this time María de los Angeles works taking care of the chickens, feeding them, collecting the eggs, and distributing the eggs in nearby shops and houses. Her husband helps in the evenings after returning from his work. Maria de los Angeles is a member of the Community Credit Corporation of Grifo Alto Puriscal which is one of the community social organizations of EDESA. Previously she obtained a loan of six hundred thousand colones (¢ 600,000) which she repaid in a timely manner now that the business generates daily income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 250 laying hens, 10 feeders, and 10 waterers.

loans.name: Noel Alberto

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael en Managua el señor Noel R. se dedica a su actividad de ganadería habiéndose dedicado con mucho empeño a su actividad desde hace varios años. Es de importancia destacar que el señor Noel lha logrado salir adelante ya que es viudo y con un hijo que mantener.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de una ternera ya que requiere obtenerla para así continuar en su actividad  y por esto espera que su crédito sea otorgado lo mas pronto posible para así continuar beneficiando a su pequeño hijo en su municipio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of San Rafael in Managua Mr. Noel Ramirez has been raising cattle with much effort for some years. It is important to emphasize that Mr. Noel has managed to get ahead even though he is a widower and has a child to support.

Today the reason he is turning to Ceprodel is to benefit from a loan to purchase a calf that he requires to continue his business. For this reason he is hoping to be granted the loan as soon as possible so that he can continue to provide for his small child in his municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of a calf.

texts.es: Feliciana es una madre de familia muy querida por sus dos hijos; Eugenio de 13 y Carlos de 11, vive en su propia casa y tiene muchas gansa de superarse. Sale muy temprano a la calle a vender sus golosinas, pasa todo el día bajo el sol en espera de que sus clientes le compren los productos que vende, ella es muy alegre, por lo cual su carretilla es muy concurrida, llegada las 8 de la noche Feliciana enrumba a su hogar para prepararse para la venta del día siguiente. Lleva 24 años realizando este negocio y lo que más le gusta es que puede conversar con sus clientes y hacer más amena su actividad. Su deseo es tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus productos y atender mejor a sus clientes, lo más difícil de su trabajo es caminar todo el día en busca de clientes, aun así sabe que todos sus esfuerzos los realiza con el único fin de darles lo mejor a sus 2 queridos hijos, a los cuales quiere mucho. Este es el primer préstamo de Feliciana con MFP y está dispuesta a separar una parte de las ganancias del día, para pagar el crédito sin problemas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que les da alegría a las demás socias. Con el dinero que solicita planea incrementar la cantidad de productos que vende en su carretilla.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a mother who is very loved by her two sons: Eugenio, who is 13, and Carlos, who is 11. She lives in her own home and wants very much to better herself. She leaves home very early and sells candy as a street vendor. She spends all day under the sun in hopes that her customers will buy the products that she sells. She is very happy because her little cart is very frequented. At 8:00 at night, she returns home to prepare for her sales the next day. She has had this business for 24 years, and what she likes most about it is being able to converse with her customers because it makes her work more enjoyable. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her products with more comfort and attend to her customers better. The most difficult part of her job is walking all day in search of customers. But she knows that she puts forth all of this effort with the only goal of giving the best to her two beloved sons, who she loves very much. This is Feliciana's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is willing to separate out a part of her profits every day to be able to pay back the credit without problems. In her communal bank she is very loved, since she makes the other members happy. With the money requested, she plans to increase the quantity of products that she sells in her cart.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Nicaragua se caracteriza por tener mujeres muy trabajadoras que se desempeñan arduamente para llevar el sustento a sus hogares. En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de la ciudad de Managua la señora Rafaela P. se caracteriza por elaborar cuajadas y tortillas las cuales son comercializadas por ella misma. Las cuajadas las saca del ganado ya que para llevar a cabo su actividad requiere de ganado como lo son las vacas.

Este es el propósito por el cual hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel y es para obtener un crédito para la compra de una vaca y así continuar extrayendo su recurso para elaboración de las cuajadas y así venderlas junto con las tortillas en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Nicaragua is characterized by having very hard-working women who strive hard to support their homes. In the area of San Rafael del Sur in the city of Managua, señora Rafaela P. is known for making cuajada (a soft cheese) and tortillas, which she sells herself. She makes the cheese from livestock, and to carry out this activity, she needs livestock like cows. This is her goal and why she is turning to Ceprodel for a credit: to purchase a cow and to continue having the resource to make her cuajada and sell it with tortillas in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una mujer soltera que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, a sus 46 años siente que todavía tiene las fuerzas necesarias para seguir trabajando, vive en la casa que ella misma consiguió con mucho sacrificio. Tiene un pequeño puesto en un mercado importante de la ciudad de Puno, donde vende pescado a todas las personas que concurren a realizar sus compras diarias, ella es muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa, los cuales compran el pescado que vende con mucha tranquilidad, ya que saben que Francisca es una vendedora muy confiable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de puesto, ya que eso hace más amenas las largas jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 20 años en este negocio y anhela tener un frigorífico donde pueda vender su pescado, sin preocuparse de que se pueda malograr, lo que más le disgusta es que se le pegue el olor del pescado en la ropa, aun así ella está dispuesta a trabajar duro, con tal de mejorar su vida. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. El dinero que solicita será invertido en el arreglo y la mejora de su puesto de venta, para así atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisca is a single woman who has always fought for a better life. At age 46, she still feels she has the necessary strength to continue working. She lives in a home that she obtained herself through lots of sacrifice.

She has a little stand in an important market in the city of Puno, where she sells fish to everyone who passes her by while making their daily purchases. She is very happy and always serves her clients with a smile. They always buy her fish with an easy mind because they know that Francisca is a trustworthy seller.

The thing that she likes most about her job is conversing with her neighbors in the stalls next to her since that makes the long workdays more enjoyable. She brings 20 years experience to this business and longs to have a refrigerator so she can sell her fish and not worry about them spoiling. The thing that she likes least is that the smell of fish gets in her clothes, but she is still willing to work hard with the goal of improving her life.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is willing to pay it on time since she does not want to cause problems for the members of the community bank where she participates actively. The money that she is requesting will be invested in fixing and improving her sales stand, so that she may serve her clients better.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix and improve her sales stand.

texts.es: Jacinta tiene 50 años, trabaja muy duro para darle lo mejor a sus hijos, vive en su propia casa, tiene 2 hijos; Roxana D. 13 y Bernardino D. 8, quiere mejorar su vida y sabe que trabajado duro lo logrará. Tiene una carnicería en el mercado Unión y Dignidad (Mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Puno), su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que trata a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y respeto, tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad y espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en uno D. los principales puestos del mercado. Jacinta disfruta D. conversar con sus clientes e informarles sobre el precio D. la carne, D. esta manera toma confianza y pueD. realizar una buena venta, lo más difícil para ella es conseguir la carne que venD., ya que solo adquiere D. buena calidad y en buen estado. Jacinta quiere mejorar su vida y sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograrlo. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Jacinta invertirá el dinero que solicita en comprar más carne para incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 50 years old. She lives in her own home. She works very hard to give the best to her children, Roxanna who is 13, and Bernardino who is 8. She wants to improve her life and knows that she can achieve this by working hard. She has a butcher's stall at the Unión and Dignidad market, an important market in the city of Puno. Her stall is very popular because she treats her customers in a friendly way and with respect. She has been doing this for 20 years. She hopes that her business grows and becomes one of the major stalls in the market. Jacinta enjoys taking with her customers and informing them of the prices of the meat. This way they gain confidence and she can make a good sale. The hardest thing for her is getting the meat to sell because she only buys good quality meat. Jacinta wants to improve her life and knows that she has to work very hard to accomplish this. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay it back on time, and she is determined to do so. She is a happy and responsible member of her community bank. Jacinta will use the loan she is asking for to buy more meat to increase her sales and get a larger income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Julia de 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en su propia casa con su esposo y sus dos menores hijos; Yoel de 13 y Yenny de 7, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Ella es una joven madre de familia que desde muy niña aprendió el arte de transformar la totora en piezas artesanales, este arte lo aprendió de sus padres y actualmente se dedica a venderlas, lo hace de manera ambulatoria, ya que no tiene un lugar fijo donde vender sus obras artesanales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que tiene la libertada de elegir a qué horas trabaja y qué horas dedica a su familia. Lleva 15 años en esta actividad y se siente muy feliz realizándola, y lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar por las calles en busca de clientes, es por eso que anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus artesanías con mayor comodidad y así atender mejor a sus clientes, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el éxito de su negocio. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y tiene todas las ganas de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para eso tenga que juntar poco a poco sus ganancias del día, en su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan las demás socias. Julia invertirá el dinero que solicita en comprar más lana, alambres, hilo, adornitos, etc., materiales primordiales en la fabricación de sus piezas artesanales.
texts.en:
Julia, 37, is a very cheerful woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and two younger children. Yoel is 13, and Yenny is 7, both of whom are the motivation for all her efforts. She's a young mother who learned early on the art of transforming reed mace (cattails or bulrush) into handmade craftwork. She learned this art from her parents and currently sells them. She does this as a traveling saleswoman, since she has no fixed place where she can sell her craftwork. What she enjoys most in her work is that she has to liberty to choose which hours she works and which hours she dedicates to her family. She has been doing this for 15 years and feels very happy carrying out this work. What she least likes is having to walk the streets in search of customers.

For that reason, she desires to have a store where she could sell her crafts more comfortably and thus better serve her customers, since she knows that the success of her business depends on them. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has every desire to pay it on time, even though to do so she may have to collect her daily earnings little by little. In her communal bank she's very responsible and is always up-to-date on the agreements reached by the other members. Julia will invest the money she's requesting in buying more wool, wire, thread, ornaments, etc., essential materials for her handmade crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, el señor Efraín B. se dedica con gran sacrificio a su actividad de ganadería que posee en su municipio el cual le sirve para mantener su núcleo familiar donde diario lleva el sustento.

La razón por la cual el señor Efrain ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la mejora de la finca y el hato ganadero ya que requiere invertir en ella para así continuar mejorando sus cultivos y su ganado. Espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así saldrá adelante en su actividad.
texts.en:
In the area of San Rafael del Sur, señor Efraín B. is dedicated, with a lot of sacrifice, to raising livestock that he owns in the area, which lets him support his nuclear family and provide them with food every day. The reason that Efraín has turned to Ceprodel is to be benefitted with a credit to improve his farm and livestock herd. He needs to invest in it to continue improving his crops and livestock. He hopes very confidently that his credit will be offered satisfactorily so he can get ahead in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Margarita, a sus 46 años ha logrado tener su casa propia, vive con su única hija, Nery D. 11 años y lo que más quiere en esta vida, es darle unos buenos estudios superiores. La mayor parte D. su niñez la pasó junto al lago Titicaca, es ahí donD. aprendió D. sus padres la actividad que actualmente realiza para vivir, la pesca artesanal, que es para ella una labor fructífera, ya que realizándola ha podido brindarle una vida tranquila a su hija. Pero Margarita no solo vive D. la pesca, sino que los fines D. semana lleva a vender lo que ha pescado en el mercado Unión y Dignidad (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Puno), donD. tiene un pequeño puesto. Lo más difícil D. su trabajo es trasladar la pesca semanal obtenida hasta su puesto D. venta y lo que más le gusta, es que pueD. disfrutar casi a diario D. los bellos paisajes que le brinda el lago Titicaca. Lleva 25 años realizando estas dos actividades, su deseo es tener una embarcación más graD. y segura, con la cual pueda pescar más y así tener más pescado para vender. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donD. es muy querida por el resto D. sus socias. Margarita planea invertir los ochocientos soles en comprar más redes, boyas, espineles, etc, para incrementar la cantidad que pesca semanal.
texts.en:
Margarita, 46, has been able to obtain her own house, living with her only daughter, 11-year-old Nery. What she wants most in life is to proviD. her some good higher-level studies. She spent the majority of her childhood next to Lake Titicaca. It was there that she learned from her parents her current occupation, inshore fishery, which is for her a fruitful labor, since in carrying it out she's been able to offer a peaceful life for her daughter. But Margarita doesn't only live off of fish, since on weekends she takes and sells what she caught in the Union and Dignity Market (an important market in the city of Puno), where she has a small stand. The most difficult part of her job is hauling the weekly catch to her stand, and what she likes most is to enjoy almost daily the beautiful scenery that Lake Titicaca offers her. She's been doing these two activities for 25 years; her desire is to have a bigger and safer boat, with which she could fish more and thus have a bigger catch to sell.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows that if she pays it on time she'll be able to access another one with greater tranquility and without bringing complications to her communal bank, where she is very loved by the rest of the members. Margarita plans to invest the 800 soles (Peruvian currency) to buy more nets, floats, etc. to increase the quantity of her weekly catch.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Emma Rosa

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de la ciudad de Managua la señora Emma A. se dedica a su actividad  de agricultura por medio del cultivo de la tierra en la siembra de plátano.

Es importante destacar que actualmente ella ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel el cual le ha beneficiado arduamente en la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Espera confiadamente porque requiere con urgencia dicho préstamo para salir adelante y así mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Emma A. works the land cultivating bananas in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in the city of Managua. It is important to emphasise that she has managed to move her business forward by going to Ceprodel, greatly benefitting from the purchase of fertilizers for her crops. She is waiting in hope because she urgently requires this loan to develop her business and so improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín V. A. es un señor de 42 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y tres hijos: Gustavo, Jason y Estiven. Don Martín se dedica a la agricultura y toda su familia le ayuda un poco a la hora de la siembra y la recolecta de los cultivos. 
La comunidad en la cual vive Martín se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de unos dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y a las lecherías. El Sauce tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano, sin embargo varias veces al año, el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que caen en la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en el Atlántico de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona.
Con Martín tiene un pequeño terreno de 1.2 hectáreas en el cual siembra diferentes cultivos como maíz, frijoles, plátano y café. Él tiene 27 años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Durante ese tiempo ha tenido épocas en las que le va bien y otras en la que tiene que lidiar con problemas como malos precios de venta o fenómenos naturales que dañan sus cultivos. El terreno lo logró comprar con un pequeño préstamo. Anteriormente tenía que alquilar el terreno para sembrar.
Don Martín está solicitando un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, semilla de frijol y semilla de maíz. Con esto espera lograr una buena cosecha que pueda vender y ayudar a salir adelante a su familia. La cosecha la espera vender en la misma finca. 
Don Martín es cliente de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una organización local socia de la microfinanciera EDESA. Gracias a su vinculación con esta organización ha obtenido ya 6 microcréditos y todos los ha cancelado satisfactoriamente. Los montos han ido incrementando desde los cien mil colones hasta los doscientos cincuenta mil colones. Actualmente don Martín necesita un préstamo por quinientos mil colones para comprar las semillas y el fertilizante.
texts.en:
Martín V. A. is 42. He lives with his wife and 3 children: Gustavo, Jason, and Estiven. Don Martín makes a living through agriculture, and his whole family helps him a little during planting and harvesting seasons. The area where Martín lives is called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba. It's a small rural community with 2,000 people. They are dedicated to agriculture and dairy operations. El Sauce has an irregular landscape, and much of the land is mantained as tropical forests. The community has very picturesque landscapes which combine the tropical forest with lovely lakes, coffee plantations, and dairy farms. El Sauce is approximately an hour and a half from Turrialba by bus, the closest city. Several times a year, the road becomes impassable because of the rains that fall in the area. This is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges for the community. When there isn't any work, the people choose to look for jobs in Turrialba or on banana farms located in the Atlantic region of Costa Rica. Currently the prices of coffee and milk have improved, so the neighbors are looking to invest in projects in their area. Martín has 1.2 hectares, on which he plants different crops like corn, beans, plantains, and coffee. He has been dedicated to agriculture for 27 years. During this time, he has had seasons that have gone very well and others when he has had to battle problems such as bad prices or natual phenomenons that damage his crops. He obtained his land through a small loan. Previously he had to rent land to sow his crops. Don Martín is a client of the Association of Producers in El Sauce, a local organization that is a member of the microfinance institution EDESA. Thanks to his connections with this organization, he has already obtained six microcredits, and all of them have been paid back satisfactorily. The amounts of the loans have increased from 100,000 colones (180 USD) to 250,000 (450 USD) colones. Currently don Martín needs a loan of 500,000 (900 USD) colones to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bean and corn seeds and fertilizers

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de la ciudad de Managua el señor José Humberto A. se dedica a su actividad de ganadería atendida en su municipio donde a diario busca la manera de salir adelante manteniendo a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

Es de importancia destacar que el señor A. ha logrado mejorar su situación ya que desde hace 20 años se dedica a esta actividad de agropecuario en la ganadería y agricultura en la siembra. Hoy en día él ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita invertir en la actividad agropecuaria y también para  la compra de madera para aserrar y así continuar mejorando su situación en el negocio agropecuario.
texts.en:
Mr. José Humberto A. raises livestock in the area of San Rafael del Sur in Managua. Everyday he looks for the way to get ahead with maintaining his family that depends on his support.

It is important to point out the Mr. A. has been able to improve his situation over the past 20 years that he has been an agricultural farmer. Now he comes to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow him to invest in his agricultural farm. He would also buy construction material to continue making improvements in his agricultural business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael de la ciudad de Managua la señora Reyna C. es muy esforzada por lo que se dedica a su actividad e agricultura donde a diario atiende en la siembra de las plantas.  Es importante destacar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y por poseer amplios conocimientos en su trabajo.

Con el propósito de salir adelante en su actividad ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la ampliación  y mejoramiento de su finca ya que  es de importancia para continuar saliendo adelante en su actividad agrícola que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
In the San Rafael municipality of the city of Managua, Reyna C. works hard on her agricultural business, taking care of sowing plants on a daily basis. It should be mentioned that she is known as a very hard working lady who knows her work inside out. In order to develop her business she has come to Ceprodel for credit in order to extend and improve her land as this is important to continue moving her agricultural business forward, which so badly requires investment.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Francisca inició el negocio por necesidad de ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares
Comenzó el negocio en enero del 2006 inicio vendiendo calzado de segunda a vecinos y familiares
su negocio  ha ido progresando ya que ahora  ofrece calzado por catalago y obtiene mas ganancias.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $8,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar mercancia y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca started a business because she needed to help her husband cover household expenses. She started the business in January, 2006, selling used shoes to neighbors and family. Her business has been growing and now she offers new shoes and has increased earnings. She needs a loan of MXN $8,000, to be paid off in 5 months, in order to purchase merchandise and keep her business going.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Arcelia  inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para solventar los gastos familiares y estudios de sus hijos. Comenzó el negocio  abril del 2004 inicio vendiendo calzado por cetalogo ofreciendo a sus compañeras de trabajo ya que aparte de tener el negocio tambien es empleada en una empresa.

Debido a su esfuerzo le ha ido bastante bien ya que sus compañeras la han ido recomendado por lo cual ha logrado tener mas ventas y asi mas ganancias

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar mercancia y asi poder cumpli con pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Arcelia started the business because she needed to earn an extra income in order to cover the household expenses and her sons’ studies. She began the business in April 2004, selling shoes from a catalogue to her work colleagues; as well as having her own business she also works for another company. Thanks to her efforts and her colleagues' recommendations, things have gone rather well so she has managed to increase her sales and thus her earnings. She needs a loan of MXN $5,000 which she will repay in 5 months to buy merchandise and so be able to complete the orders she has from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Maria Luisa inició el negocio, ya que  ella trabaja ayudandole a una señora pero aun asi, su sueldo no alcanzaba para  solventar los gastos y opto por vender productos de belleza
Comenzó el negocio mayo del 2005 ofreciendo productos cosmeticos a vecinas y familiares por catalago,  a la fecha ha progresado mucho ya que  ahora utiliza tips que una amiga le dio como el de realizar bingos con los mismos productos y asi obtiene mas ganancias. 

Ella necsita un prestamo de MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mercancia y poder continuar asi con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa started her own business because although she was working helping another woman, her income was not enough to cover her expenses. She decided to begin selling beauty products. She started her business in May 2005, offering cosmetics to neighbors and family members from a catalog. At this point she has made a lot of progress, because she now uses some tips a friend gave her, like organizing lotteries with the cosmetics, so she earns more money. She needs a loan of MXN $5,000, to be paid in 4 months, to purchase products and keep her business going.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Ana inició el negocio para ayudar con los gastos familiares a su esposo ya que el no cuenta con un trabajo fijo. Comenzó el negocio en abril del 2006 ayudando a una amiga a realizar ventas de productos de plastico para el hogar, desde entonces a la fecha le ha hido bastante bien ahora realiza sus propias ventas  y surte mas mercancia que ha ido invirtiendo por su propia cuenta para revender.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para poder surtir  mercancia y poder realizar unos bingos que tiene programados, los cuales los usa como estrategia para atraer clientes y vender.
texts.en:
Ana started her business to help out her husband with the household expenses since he doesn't have a steady job. She started the business April 2006 helping a friend selling plastic products for the home; since then things have gone well for her and she now sells on her own and buys her own merchandise which she resells. She needs a loan of 5000 Mexican Pesos, which will be repaid in 10 fourteen day installments, to restock her merchandise and to organize some bingo games that she uses as a strategy to attract customers.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

Bun P., 40, resides with her husband and two of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She operates a grocery store to earn a living and is able to make about $5 every day, while her husband is a farmer and earns $2 per day.

Mrs. Bun P. would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demand.

Leng Y., 40, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband. She sells boiled corn and is able to make around US$ 6 per day. Her husband sells wood and earns US$ 5 every day. This couple has four children and all of them are in school. Leng Y. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport wood.

Seang C. is 26 years old and has a business selling CDs and VCDs to earn a living. She is able to make around $5 per day. Her husband earns $6 every day working as a construction foreman. This couple has one young child.

Seang C. is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials for her husband.

Heiy C., 29, sells desserts in the local market of the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes $5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman. On average, he makes $8 a day. This couple has one young child.

Mrs. Heiy C. would like to take out a loan to purchase construction tools for her husband.

loans.name: Ngov

texts.en: Ngov C. is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She lives with her family in the Kampong Cham province. Ngov’s husband works as a construction foreman, while Ngov works at a vending stall where she sells produce, CDs, and VCDs. On average, Ngov and her husband earn a combined total of $9 a day. Ngov is requesting a loan to diversify her range of marketed goods and expand her customer base. She will use her additional profits to support her family and child.

loans.use: To expand the range of her goods

texts.en: Chhun K. is 55 years old, married, and has one child who is also married. She lives with her family. Chhun’s husband works as a carpenter, while Chhun works at a vending stall where she sells CDs and VCDs. On average, Chhun and her husband earn a combined total of $5 a day. Chhun is requesting a loan to diversify her range of marketed goods and expand her customer base. She will use her additional profits to support her family.

Chhum K. is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in the Kampong Cham province. Chhum works as a wood vender, while her husband operates a moto-taxi. Together, Chhum and her husband earn on average a combined total of $10 a week. Chhum is requesting a loan to purchase a better moto-taxi in order for her husband to expand his business and attract a larger clientele.

loans.name: Generose

texts.en:
Generose is 37 years old and a mother of four. Her 2 children already go to school while the other 2 are very young. Before, she was busy doing vegetable and fish vending but now, she is engaged in hog-fattening thanks to the capital given by Ashi. Her current loan will be used in purchasing I pig, 1 sack of feed, 1 "ganta" (unit of dry measure) of peanuts, and 16 kg. of fish.

She dreams that this business will grow and expand after two years. She dreams that her children will finish their studies and find a good job in the future.

loans.use: purchasing 1 pig, 1 sack of feed, etc.

texts.en: Hum Y. is 37 years old and has a business selling grocery products. She is able to make US$ 7 every day. She is a widow who resides with her school-aged child. She is asking for a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more items to meet her clients demands.

Ya S. is sixty-one years old, married, and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham. She sells rice and food to earn a living and is able to make $40 in revenue per day. Her husband is a village chief and makes less than one dollar per day. This couple has five children, two of whom are moto-taxi drivers and three who are in school. Ya S. is asking for a loan to purchase gas to sell.

Met S. is thirty-three years old and sells food and beverages in the village to earn a living. She is able to make about $10 per day. She has been in business for about two years. She lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and three of her children. Her husband is a mechanic and typically makes $7 per day. Met S. would like  a loan to increase her inventory.

Mex M. is fifty-six years old, married, and lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about $2 each day and are supported by two children working in the garment factory. In light of economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This will reduce their daily transportation costs.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn L. is a hardworking fisherwoman. She has been catching fish since she was a small child. Her father influenced her love of the sea. She says, "treasures like what we saw in some American films are found beneath the salt water". 

She is thirty years old and has five children studying in school. She knows for sure that her children are counting on their parents to enable their continued schooling. As a mother, she wants to give her children the best life she can. She is grateful that her husband, Evaristo, is ever willing to provide for their needs.

She is asking for a loan of $250 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. Aside from their catch, Edelyn buys other fish to sell in the market. The loan will definitely help her market more fish and earn a bigger profit.

CEVI gives her credit assistance to run her business. She also receives training and insurance coverage to help her small "fish" enterprise to grow.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

texts.en: Choung C. is forty-three years old, married, and lives with two children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about $3 per day. Besides this activity they also sell cakes and cows. One of their children is a mechanic. Choung C. would like to take out a loan to purchase cows for resale.

Yim C., 41, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province. By selling grocery items, she makes US $1.60 each day. Her husband works as a farmer and a barber and makes US $2.00 each day. 

Yim C. is asking for a loan of US $200 to raise a cow. She sees this purchase a good investment to expand her business and she is confident it will increase her income. (She pictured with her husband.)

Moeurn S., 30, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and two young children. She works as a farmer, making US$1 a day, and is supported by her husband. He works in construction, making US$4.2 a day.  In light of these times of economic difficulties, Moeurn S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase fertilizer to expand her cultivation. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who one day hopes to set up a grocery store in front of her home. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that her business venture will be successful.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou C., 54, lives with his wife in the Kampong Cham province. He grows rice and works as a mechanic, making around US$6 per day. His wife stays at home doing housework. This couple has five children; two are in school, one is married and two others are employed as construction workers in Thailand. Ou C. would like to take out a loan to purchase mechanic's tools and use the rest to expand his cultivation.

loans.use: To buy mechanic's tools and expand cultivation.

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hội 33 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Gia đình chị có  3 con đang tuổi đến trường. Hiện tại chị Hội đang kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá và chăn nuôi tại nhà còn anh Bình chồng chị đi làm nghề thợ xây. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình chị đạt  4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hội mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng bánh kẹo, rượu bia... về bán.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hội is 33 yrs old, and joined TYM fund since 2005. Her family has 3 children of school-age. Currently Ms. Hoi has a grocery store and raises animals at home, while her husband, Mr. Binh, is a construction worker. Average income for her family is 230 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to purchase merchandise such as cakes, candies, wine, beer to sell .

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Laok

texts.en: Laok B. is 49 years old and works in a grocery store in the local market of Kampong Cham province. On average, she is able to make US$15 in revenue per day. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns US$20 in revenue a day. Laok B. has two school-aged children. Now she wants to expand her business by adding more products to meet her client’s demand.

loans.use: To buy more products for her grocery store.

texts.en: Nhev S. Nan, 29, lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making about $15 in revenue per day. Her husband earns $3 a day working as a security guard. This couple has two school-aged children. They need a loan so they can start raising pigs for additional profit.

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Vịnh 45 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó có hai con đã trưởng thành,  2 con đang đi học. Hiện tại gia đình chị Vịnh  chăn nuôi, làm vườn trang tại . Bên cạnh đó chồng chị còn làm thêm nghề đóng gạch, hàng tháng  các con đều hỗ trợ bố mẹ để tăng thêm thu nhập cho  gia đình .Với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Vịnh đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị Vịnh mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua cây giống về trồng và mua vật liệu  về đóng gạch bán.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Vịnh is 45 yrs old, and joined TYM fund in 2004. Her family has 4 children, 2 are grown and 2 are still in school. Currently, her family raises animals and ornamental trees. Besides this business, her husband is a brick layer. Every month her children help out to supplement the family's income. With average income of 287 USD per month, her family's economic situation is expanding and becoming more stable everyday. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to buy additional trees and seeds to plant, and bricks to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

texts.vi:
Chị Hoa 27 tuổi là thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2002. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, đến nay sau 7 năm tham gia Quỹ với việc  sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả hiện tại chị đã là chủ  một trang trại chuyên chăn nuôi trâu và trồng chanh với thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng. Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương xây dựng của chồng 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hoa mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua  thêm trâu về nuôi
texts.en:
Ms. Hoa is 27 yrs old and has been a member with TYM fund since 2002. At the beginning, she borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. After 7 years with TYM fund, she is now the owner of a ranch specializing in raising buffaloes, and growing lemon trees, with income of 262 USD per month. In addition, her family has another source of income from her husband's construction job of 115 USD month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 875 USD to purchase additional buffaloes to raise

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc 27 ở Hưng Nguyên , Nghệ An. Gia đình chị có 2 con nhỏ và đều đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2007. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chị là từ công sửa xe máy của chồng và từ chăn nuôi, làm ruộng của chị với thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000 để mua thêm phụ tùng đầu tư cho cửa hàng sửa xe của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Ngọc is 27 yrs old and lives in Hung N., Nghe An. Her family has 2 children who are still in school. She joined TYM fund in 2007. Her family's income currently comes from her husband's motorbike repair shop, and from her business of raising animals and farming, with total income of 260 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 875 USD to buy spare parts for her family's motorbike repair shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị Dũng  năm nay 50 tuổi . Gia đình chị có 4 con, trong đó có 1 con đã lớn và có việc làm ổn định. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2002, với nghề chính chăn nuôi. Nhờ việc sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả và  việc được vay vốn ngày càng cao đã giúp gia đình chị phát triển thêm nghề say sát gạo tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Hiện tạithu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua  lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Ms. Phạm Thị Dũng is 50 yrs old. Her family has 4 children; 1 is grown and has a stable job. She joined TYM fund in 2002 with main business of raising animals. Thanks to the loan program from TYM fund, her family expanded and opened another business of rice-milling to increase her family's income. Currently her family's income is 230 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 875 USD to purchase additional pigs and animal feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị Lý  năm nay 22 tuổi . chị đang sống cùng chồng và một con nhỏ hai tuổi tại xã Hưng Trung huyện Hưng Nguyên - Nghệ An. Năm 2006 chị Lý tham gia Quỹ tìnhthương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà.  Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi chị Lý còn đầu tư vốn để buôn bán hoa quả . Bên cạnh đó  Anh Tường chồng chị làm  nghề thợ xây cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và công việc kinh doanh hoa quả .
texts.en:
Ms. Đinh Thị Lý is 22 yrs old. She lives with her husband and her 2-yrs old child in the village of Hưng Trung, district of Hưng Nguyên - Nghệ An. In 2006 she joined TYM fund to borrow money to invest in raising chickens. Currently, in addition to raising animals, she also sells fruits. Besides these businesses, her husband, Mr. Tuong, is a construction worker and makes 116 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to invest in her businesses of raising animals and selling fruits.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for a group of four people, all residents of Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Mrs. P. has been selected to be the leader by the members. She is a 30-year-old widow who has given birth to two children, both now teenagers attending school.

Since early 2007, P. has run a store in front of her house selling snack foods for the neighborhood, earning approximately $4 per day. P. proposes to earn additional income by selling a few groceries; thus, she is looking for a loan to buy grocery inventory to sell.

The other three borrowers are: C., a snack-food seller who asks for a loan for repairing her husband's bicycle; T., a widowed trader who sells fish paste and is applying for a loan to increase her business capital; and P., a widow who sells fish paste in the local market and needs the loan to buy more fish paste in bulk to resell.

loans.use: To buy grocery inventory for sell

loans.name: Ma. Divina

texts.en:
Ma. Divina P. owns a small sari-sari store.  She sell various type of goods like rice, sardines, milk, coffee, instant noodles, detergents, edible oil and canned products to earn a living.  Aside from that, she also grow pigs in her backyard which she finds more profitable. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 18,000 from CEVI and will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store to attract customers.  In this way, she can grow her business and turn it into a mini-grocery store. Ma. Divina also plans to increase the size of her piggery to support the educational need of her four children.

CEVI helps Ma. Divina get her loan and sustain her business.  She receives credit, training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: Buy additional stock for her sari-sari store.

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Phượng  năm nay 36 tuổi . Chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đang tuổi đến trường tại xã Hưng Trung huyện Hưng Nguyên - Nghệ An. Năm 2002 chị Phượng tham gia Quỹ tìnhthương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn.  Hiện tại chị Phượng vẫn đang sử dụng vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và nấu rượu bán tại nhà. Anh  Thanh chồng chị ngoài thời gian giúp đỡ vợ chăn nuôi còn đi làm thêm nghề thợ xây cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 18.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Phượng, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two school-age children in Hưng Trung commune, Hưng Nguyên district, Nghệ An province. In 2002, Mrs. Phượng joined the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in raising pigs. Currently, she is still using loans from the Fund to raise pigs, and in addition she now brews wine for sale at home. Her husband Thanh, besides helping Mrs. Phượng with the animals, also works as a construction worker, earning 2,000,000 VND (114 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, Mrs. Phượng hopes to borrow 18,000,000 VND (1025 USD) to buy more pigs and animal feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Yên năm nay 53 tuổi . Gia đình chị có 3 con đã trưởng thành và đã đi làm.  Năm 2002 chị Yên tham gia Quỹ tìnhthương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn.  Hiện tại đay vẫn là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Ngoài ra hàng tháng 3 con của chị đều hỗ trợ thêm cho gia đình 2.000.000đ/ tháng nên cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 13.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. NguY. Thi Y. is 53 years old. Her family has three grown children who are working. In 2002 she joined TYM Fund to borrow loans to invest in raising pigs. Currently, this provides her family its main source of income. Each month, her three children's financial contribution totals 2,000,000 VND per month, making her family's economy quite stable. She would like to borrow 13,000,000 VND to invest in more pigs and feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

Byambatsetseg N., 35, lives in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia) with her husband, 15-year-old son and 2-year-old daughter. In 2001, her family moved into their own ger (a traditional tent) for the first time. In 1999, with her husband, she opened up a small butcher shop in the Hantalst open-air market in Ulaanbaatar. Since its inception, her business has been quite successful, and she has been able to invest her profits into opening a second, wholesale meat stall. Her husband has been having some kidney and back problems in recent years. Hence, she has been running the business by herself. Although she is a butcher now, she has a degree in pedagogy. In the future, she would like to make sure that her children receive a proper education and pursue their own professions, unlike her. She requests a loan to buy more wholesale meat for her inventory now, when the price of meat is at its lowest point of the year.

loans.name: Ongonbayar

texts.en:
Ongonbayar N. is 47 and married. She lives in the Narantuul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, with her husband and two children. Her two children go to a secondary school in Ulaanbaatar. Her husband is a taxi driver.

In 2002, her family moved from a small town in the countryside to Ulaanbaatar. As soon as she moved to the capital city, she became a retail consultant for Oriflame, a Swedish direct-sales cosmetic company. From the start, she has been quite successful as a saleswoman and received an honor of "Golden Associate."
